title: Great Location and a Lot of Bang for Your Buck.
text:
This was my third stay here, and I was not disappoined.  I like older mid-town hotels,for both the price and location.  Examples might be the huge Edison, the botique Belvedere, and this former apartment hotel.  It seems every room has a full kitchen.  This would be a lot handier if there was a decent grocery in the area, but I like exploring on the subway.  And there are a couple small groceres 5-6 blocks away.

On two stays my view was practically non-existent, and on one occasion, I could hear what sounded like drag racing down nearby Broadway well into the morning.

Again, however, the price was right, the room comfortable and clean, with nice guests I would run into.  There is a good (and popular) Italian retaurant on the first floor and numerous options in the area.  For a decent traditional breakfast I did have to walk three blocks to Bennegans (Applebee's?)  which was great.  This is an awesome location for theater goers, which was why I came.  I don't expect a lot of service, and had no problems to call down for.  But a place like the Marriott Marquee on Times Squre would probably have run me $200 more per night and wouldnt have had the convenience of the kitchen.  I'm a big fan of the RCA.

title: Superb stay
text:
Great apartment hotel in Times Square. Everything was perfect.
Spacious apartment with 2 bedrooms and a living room/kitchen with very comfortable sofa bed. Ideal for a family of 5 people. We feel like home.
Coffee and tea put in the kitchen every day and cleaning done every day.
Very warm welcome and the staff are always there to provide you with information.
The hotel lobby is very pretty.
Metro a few meters away.
We loved our stay and if we come back to New York, this is where we will stay again.

title: If you go as a family, don't hesitate!
text: Old hotel in excellent maintenance conditions. We went as a family to an apartment with two closed rooms and a complete kitchen, really complete. It is ideal for families since it is an apartment meters from Times Square and Rockefeller and since it has a full kitchen you can take advantage of it to dine in the room, preparing your own food or buying takeout. Nothing to complain or complain about since everything was perfect, even the daily cleaning of the room. The only thing I advise, if you go in summer, is to check the existence of air conditioning. Highly recommended!

title: Superb Accommodation - Superbly Situated - Superbly Priced.
text:
Easy and pleasant check-in at this art deco delight. Commodious apartment comprising of a twin bedroom, well equipped kitchen and bathroom with an efficient shower & tub.
The room was serviced each day and materials for the coffee machine replenished. 

Although no breakfast is available, there is a ‘walk thru’ entrance from the lobby to a rather nice pasta restaurant which offers tasty pizzas & pasta dishes at reasonable prices.

The accommodation is situated five minutes from bustling Times Square and only 50 yards from the nearest subway station on 49th St 7th Av. (N, Q, R, W Lines with direct connection to Jamaica for J.F.K.) And a five minute stroll to The Rockefeller Centre and the legendary Radio City Music Hall - another Art Deco gem! 

The staff are very polite a accommodating. There is a baggage room for depositing luggage on the day of departure.

Another quirky facet is a postal chute into which stamped mail for posting can be deposited - this falls down to the lobby and is emptied daily! It’s not just a decorative item; it really works!! 
To summarise, our next trip to The Big Apple will see us stay here. Do try it, you won’t be disappointed .

title: Great, great, go for it with your eyes closed
text:
Awesome location. Very quality apartment

* quality of bedding
* soundproofing of the rooms (you can't hear anything happening outside which is rare in New York)
* staff available immediately if there is any problem in the room
* room redone every morning with Kitt hot drink every morning

Nothing to say I strongly advise

title: 2 bedroom apartment option near Time Square
text:
Location, location, location! This hotel isn’t The Ritz but it has a fabulous location just a few minutes walk to Time Square. My boys and I stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment and it was perfect for our 5 night NYC visit. The bedrooms are “tight” but functional and having a small kitchen/living room was ideal. Great for cooking up breakfast and bringing dinner in. Our apartment was clean and comfortable. 

We had 2 close subway lines to chose from and there is a myriad of dinning options on your door step - Radio City Pizza is next door and they make awesome pizza. Central Park is a 10 min walk away. For basic groceries there is a Supermarket on 8th Ave - 5 min walk plus a CVS (for beer) in the same direction. 

The hotel staff were pleasant and always willing to assist if engaged. 

If you are looking for a value accommodation option in NYC with a great location I’d recommend this hotel.

title: I will come back !
text: Perfect location, metro at the foot of the hotel. Rather dated room but it doesn't matter, it has everything you need in it. It's clean and you can't hear the neighbors. On the other hand, you can hear outside noise because the windows are poorly insulated, but at the same time it’s New York. I recommend for a first experience and discovering the city.

title: Impecable. Muy felices.
text: Exclente por donde se mire. Ubicacion privilegiada, limpieza, atencion del personal siempre dispuesto, cocina bien equipada y con utensilios de calidad. Horno, microondas, heladera, todo impecable. Depto muy amplio, nos movimos muy comodamente. Solo palabras de agradecimiento. La mejor decision.

title: Excelente en muchos temas
text: Excelente en todo sentido. Buena atención, ubicación inmejorable, alojamiento muy bueno, y una relación calidad /precio extraordinaria. Tuvimos muy pocos detalles a resolver y el personal solo tardó 5 minutos en dar solución. Siempre tuvieron la mejor deferencia en el trato, la asesoría y las recomendaciones. Una ciudad cono Nueva York se disfruta más con esa tranquilidad en donde uno se aloja.

title: Excelente localização e limpeza!
text:
Hotel super bem localizado, na quadra da Times Square e na rua do Rockefeller! Peguei um quarto com cozinha, sala e banheiro.  Super atendeu minhas necessidades. Geladeira e fogão ótimos! Limpeza realizada diariamente pelas camareiras, com troca de toalhas e reposição de amenities.
Gostei demais! Irei voltar com certeza! Hotel mais antigo, bem a carinha de Nova York mais bucólica ! Amei!

title: Clean, comfy, well appointed and a great location
text:
I stayed at Radio City Apartments for 4 nights in mid-January 2024 and had a fully satisfactory stay. The room was big enough, well set up with a kitchenette and a little dining table for two tucked away. On the basics: very clean, good water pressure and plenty of hot water. The tap water was, as they say, good enough to drink. There was no issue with noise from inside the hotel and the standard noise level to be expected from midtown Manhattan. The bed was very comfy, just firm enough, and room temperature was, for me, optimal and made for good sleeping. 

The hotel location was great, minutes walk from just about everything from subways to restaurants to pubs/bars to shops to theaters - whatever you want to do  is nearby, and the subway is always great to take you further afield if you like. 

Check-in and check-out were also quick and easy. I had no other interactions with staff as everything was smooth during my stay. Only minor issue would be that the elevators were kind of slow. But for an older building that's not unusual and not a major hindrance. 

I would definitely stay here again. 

Note: 2 of the 3 pics posted were taken as I was checking out

title: New NYC Default
text: What a gem! We were in town to spend a few days with our adult son who is frequently in town for business. He set up his office in the living area and took the sofa bed in that space. We happily took the ginormous (and comfy!) bed in the bedroom. Spacious bathroom (and spacious everything, given the location). Elevators were a bit slow but added to the "old NYC" charm. Centrally located and easy to access Radio City, 30 Rock and Broadway. We definitely will be back!

title: Great location but old
text: The location is great, just a short walk to Times Square and Radio City, and has a subway station almost next to the hotel. The wifi was very fast. We had a one bedroom apartment which was spacious with a kitchen that has a fridge and microwave. The infrastructure was old. The heater was noisy, one of the stove was not working, water pressure was weak on 10th and the turnknob of shower felt like falling off. It was noisy in early moring with the garbage trucks on the street. The sofa bed was not robust. There's only two elevators and when it was busy it can be a long wait.

title: Great location..if your into walking
text: Literally yards from the theatre district  and times square, but this came with a price...noise. Single glazed windows and five stories up and I still wanted to put a contract out for Maria Carey and her Christmas soundtrack being played at 180 decibels by the rickshaw riders who apparently charge out a $8 a MINUTE. 2AM and it was still rocking off in the street below. The room was very well appointed and all the needs in the studio kitchen are there. A CVS is a 5 min walk for milk and fruit etc. The staff are not unpleasant which is about the norm for NY hospitality. The attached "Pasta Lovers" restaurant was surprisingly good and so busy it stopped taking reservations after 6pm working on the theatre going throng for its business. I would have a concern in the summer months as there was no AC in the room. An unfortunate issue was that due to security around the holiday crowds the 49 st road was closed to transit and our uber drop off and pick up could not deliver us, so just allow a bit more time and flexibility.

title: Small but comfortable room, everything we needed
text:
The room was small but efficient with comfortable beds
The room had everything we needed. Parking was not fun. 
It was a nightmare trying to park the van. The location was perfect. Right in the heart of everything.

title: Does the job
text: Good location - easy to walk to many areas from here and subway not far away. Consequently quite noisy at night from street but you can’t have everything. Minimal info at check in and no information in rooms- could easily be improved. Sofa bed uncomfortable. Toiletries and coffee/tea/washing up liquid supplied. No room heating/cooling options - we were cold at night in December. Rooms clean but a bit depressing to spend any time in - best used as a base.

title: Si je retourne à New York, c'est là que je séjournerai à nouveau.
text:
J'ai réservé cet hôtel presque 1 an à l'avance pour le rapport qualité/prix qu'il semblait avoir ainsi que son emplacement idéal.
C'est un vieil hôtel parfaitement entretenu et rénové tout en gardant son aspect "historique". La décoration est dans le même style un peu désuet. MAIS c'est exactement ce qui fait son charme et son authenticité.
L'accueil et le contact par mail sont très chaleureux et efficaces.
J'avais une chambre avec 2 lits queen et une kitchenette (frigo-congélateur, gazinière 4 plaques avec four, cafetière électrique, micro-ondes, ustensiles de cuisine en quantité suffisante). La salle de bain/WC était petite mais fonctionnelle.
Tout était EXTRÊMEMENT propre. La literie et le linge étaient de très bonne qualité. Ce n'était pas très grand mais l'espace était judicieusement occupé et on ne se sentait pas à l'étroit. Ma fille (adulte) et moi avions deux grandes valises et deux sacs à dos. 
Le ménage est fait tous les jours, les serviettes sont changées.
Tout dans cet hôtel semble fait pour que les clients s'y sentent bien. Un détail en apparence qui a une importance capitale : il y a des parapluies en prêt à la réception !
Cet hôtel et l'accueil que nous y avons trouvé ma fille et moi ont grandement contribué à la réussite de notre séjour de 4 nuits (Jeudi, vendredi, samedi et dimanche) à New York.

title: Excellent choice
text: We where very pleased with everything. The room was nice and very clean.   We were close to the red, orange and yellow lines of the subway.   We could walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, MoMA and much more.    There was some outside noise but you are in NYC so that is to be expected.   Our TV was not working and they fixed it within minutes of us  notifying them.  The front desk shift throughout our stay was pleasant and helpful with directions and information.    There is pizza, Korean, and ramen places within steps.    Highly recommend this place.

title: Very good location
text:
This was our first time staying at Radio City apartments. It’s a great location with the subway close by. We stayed in a studio for one night on the 12th floor which was very comfortable and then in a 1 bed apt, again very comfortable with 2 queen beds and one adequate sofa bed. All had a good fridge-freezer and gas hob. Bathroom had good quality towels and soaps and room service was very good. It can be noisy with passing traffic but not disruptive.
The staff were helpful and friendly.

I have no hesitation in recommending this as a good value place to stay in NYC

title: RATS IN THIS PROPERTY
text: I stayed at this property for 6 nights and even though the place is old and could use a remodel it seemed to fit my needs and seemed clean enough. The afternoon and evening shift on the front desk were all very friendly, the day shift not so friendly or helpful. Everything was fine until I saw a rat in my room on my last night. They did not offer to change my room, but they did send someone up with traps that they had readily available to look for the rat (which was in hiding and never found). It ruined my whole stay. The guy at the front desk on the morning I checked out would not connect me with management, acted like I was overreacting and that I should be grateful for a 20% discount. If you don't mind rats this is the place for you.

title: Fantastic place for our ladies weekend Broadway show trip !!
text: Loved staying here for our girls’ trip! Walking distance to Times Square, Theaters, Food and incidentals, studios, and all the sites!! Lift and Uber to further sites! Clean and private. The friendliest staff. From greeting us every time we walked in the door with smiles to taking our pictures for nights out standing on the beautiful staircase!

title: I'll always stay here, fabulous!
text: This hotel was excellent and exceeded my expectations. We arrived at 1 and were able to check in immediately (check-in is 3).  As a family of 5 with small children, this was invaluable.  We had booked a 1 bedroom but were given a 2 bedroom, so super stoked on the upgrade. The property is clean and well maintained with well-appointed amenities. We never had to call for more towels, etc.   We cooked a full breakfast daily and used the coffee and tea provided. The location is fabulous . Minutes walk to times square, 12 minutes to central park and there is a subway mere seconds away. There is some noise , sirens etc. But it's New York so you have to expect this.  We were able to use their laundry facilities after 9pm free of charge,  another great service. All the staff were impeccable..would 100% stay again.

title: Excellent Location
text:
We booked a 2 bedroom apartment, it was clean, comfortable and well equipped.  

The location was excellent for Times Square and Broadway, with a subway station about 30 yards from the front door was a great location for sightseeing.

The reception staff were really friendly and helpful.

Will stay here again if visiting New York.

title: Vecchio ma funzionale
text:
Vantaggi: posizione centralissima, le maggiori attrazioni si raggiungono facilmente a piedi, fermata metro sotto l'hotel, la nostra stanza aveva una kitchenette con tutto l'occorrente: pentole nuovissime, detersivo, spugnetta, asciughini,  rotolo di carta da cucina, occorrente per fare te e caffè americano. Grazie a questo abbiamo fatto la colazione e un paio di cene "a casa". Il bagno ha la finestra apribile (non è poco!) I letti davvero comodissimi, dopo i chilometri a piedi era un coccola  da non sottovalutare. Molto apprezzabili i tanti cuscini a disposizione. Il personale è cortese e disponibile, accoglienza h24.
Svantaggi: la stanza molto piccola, molto. Assenza di armadio, letteralmente. Molto rumorosa, ma sei su times square! Essendo un edificio vecchio anche il sistema di climatizzazione ha fatto il suo tempo, molto rumoroso, ma non si poteva farne a meno visto il caldo in quei giorni.

title: Geweldig verblijf! 5 sterren plus
text: 22 jaar geleden ben ik hier voor het eerst geweest en dit jaar terug gekomen! Ik heb een geweldig verblijf hier gehad. Als vrouwelijke reiziger alleen heb ik mij in dit hotel super veilig gevoeld. Door de jetlag was ik ‘s nachts wel eens wakker en ging ik beneden buiten een sigaretje roken the nightguard hield altijd een oogje in het zeil. Het personeel is super vriendelijk. De kamers zijn schoon en fris. Hebben een lekker bed en voldoende keuze uit kussens. De schoonmaker komt elke dag. De locatie is uitmuntend op loop afstand van Time Square Rockefeller center, en twee metrostations met verschillende lijnen in de buurt.  in mijn studio zat een volledige keuken inclusief ruime koelkast kookplaat oven waterkoker alles was aanwezig! Ik heb nooit lang op de lift hoeven wachten, eigenlijk nooit. beneden in de lobby ligt elke dag twee verschillende kranten die je gratis kan meenemen hier heb ik zelf geen gebruik van gemaakt toch keek ik elke dag even naar de voorpagina’s. In de kelder zijn wasmachines waar je gebruik van kan maken dit kan na dat Housekeeping klaar is en is kosteloos. Het internet werkt erg goed. Je hoort soms wat geluid op je kamer vanuit buiten maar je bent ook in New York want ik zag dit in verschillende Reviews staan en had speciaal oordoppen gekocht maar heb deze nooit in hoeven doen omdat ik na een hele dag genieten van de stad als een roos in slaap viel. Ik raad iedereen aan om een verblijf hier te boeken als je naar New York gaat!

title: Good
text:
Arrived around 3 pm, took the chance to check in as it's not until 4 pm. The room was ready.  Reception is very beautiful. I can see the 1920/1930 style. Went up to our room. Was expecting 1 bedroom plus sofa bed. When I got up, it was 2 bedrooms, which meant I had a proper bed. Apartment dark and needs little updating. The air-conditioning was a god send. This was noisy, and the drips from the apartments above dripped onto the box outside, which was annoying.  Bathroom/shower modern and clean. It was noisy at night, but it's literally round the block from Time Square.  The noise didn't bother me. Great location for subway/buses. Of I ever go back to NY I'd stay here. The only downside is no bar attached to apartments, although one right next door. But sometimes it's nice to take beer back to the room. 

These apartments are not for everyone.  If you like the luxury of a hotel, then don't stay here.

title: Rude service . Run away from it
text: Despite the good location, the place is old and smells musty, with very rude service, especially towards foreigners. Avoid it, there are better places with more polite people. Only positive thing about The place it ia because it ia near a subway.

title: Décevant
text: Chambre petite. Très peu de rangement. Pas de plaque électrique juste un micro onde un petit frigo et un cafetière  non ravitaillement en café. Personnel à  la réception très  limite. On essaye de nous faire payer un prix plus élevé  que le prix indiqué  sur notre réservation. Hôtel qui aurait besoin d être un peu rénové Le point positif étant l emplacement qui est parfait

title: Good value for a NYC stay
text: Stayed four nights.  A very good value.  Real close to theatre district, Times Square, great restaurants. Room included small fridge, which I wanted.  Upon arriving, to save money, bought some breakfast foods at close Whole Foods (cut up fruit, yogurt granola); saved by not having to buy breakfasts. Everything in the room worked, was clean.  Note the elevators are small, holds around four people with luggage.  Luckily our room was on 2nd floor so we staired up-down.  Yes, I'd stay again.

title: Great location and good space
text:
Really great location and staff were helpful. We had a clean one bedroom apartment with kitchen and with 2 teenagers was great to have a little more space. 
It's not the most modern hotel and no bar/restaurant attached, but a couple of shops local and many bars/restaurants nearby.

title: De lo mejor
text:
La situación es excepcional… pero eso no es lo mejor, lo mejor es la amabilidad de los que trabajan alli, son de lo mejor.
La limpieza extraordinaria, tiene de todo para cocinar y parece q estuvieras estrenando la vajilla de lo bien que está,
Las toallas las cambiaban a diario y de muy buena calidad.
No tengo ni una sola queja sobre los apartamentos. Volveremos seguro!

title: Location, location, location!
text: We've stayed at the Radio City Apartments on three different occasions.  The location can't be beat.  If you don't mind a bit of walking you won't need to use transportation (public or private) to see many NYC highlights. We attended two plays that were a short walking distance from the hotel. It's a short walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, or Central Park. We also walked to the Met and Guggenheim.  The hotel lobby is small, but lovely. The staff was courteous. Housekeeping was excellent. The window air conditioner was loud, but cooled the room nicely. The kitchenette in our room allowed us to buy food at a grocery store (Ernest Klein gourmet) and pick up bakery (Paris Baguette) and eat nearly every meal in our room.

title: Excellent location and lots of space (for New York standards)....highly recommend this hotel
text:
Our family of 6 (4 children aged 17-12) stayed in a 2-bedroom apartment on the 7th floor for a week. The hotel was amazing for 2 main reasons: location (right next to Times Square) and space (2 bedrooms with a living room/open kitchen and one bathroom). The hotel is old-fashioned and furnishings are outdated but the location and space in the flat more than made up for it. We had breakfast in (although beware, New York is exorbitant for food so even supermarkets were very expensive....The Food Emporium had a good selection but is very pricey, we ended up shopping at CVS which had the basics for breakfast). Avoid eating in Times Square and go to Hell's Kitchen where the food is good and more reasonable. The staff at the front desk was extremely friendly, obliging and professional and the few requests we had were immediately seen to. The flat is well air-conditioned, housekeeping comes in daily to make the beds and change towels.....the hotel is very clean.Our flat had a view on tall buildings and despite facing the street, we did not get disturbed by any noise (air-conditioning helped). The beds were very comfortable. We didn't use the pull-out couch for sleeping as the 2 beds in the second bedroom were large enough for two children each. The hotel was the best price quality accommodation I could find in that location and I would definitely recommend it (especially for families). We were allowed a late checkout until 12 am and left our luggage with the reception until our departure in the afternoon. The hotel is very close to the subway (we took the subway back and changed in Queens to take the air train to JFK...took about 1hr15 minutes total whereas the cab when we arrived took about 40 minutes). Advice buying the one week metro pass (about 30 dollars, the air train is about 8 dollars a head from queens to JFK).
I also advise buying the New York pass for first comers....very economical for those who want to do tons of sightseeing like us.
We loved our stay....hotel is very good and we would definitely stay there again.

title: Would recommend for first timers in New York!
text: Had a great stay here - couldn't really ask for anything more for my first trip to New York. It is super central - close to Times Square, Central Park and any subway line that you might need. The room was clean and having a kitchen was so convenient due to my dietary restrictions. It comes stocked with pots and pans, a baking sheet, various utensils and even a colander! The staff was super nice and helped order us transportation back to the airport and will hold your bags for you if you are checking out long before your flight. Would highly recommend Radio City Apartments!

title: Pleasant Surprise
text: We have been to NYC a number of times and like to try new hotels. We picked this on because we wanted one close to Radio City Music Hall for a concert. Also the reviews were positive. We enjoyed this place. We booked a one bedroom king bed with double sofa. It was nice for our party of 4. Loved having a refrigerator for drinks. It was larger than most of the hotels we’ve stayed in. The separate bedroom was great for some privacy. Everything was clean. There were 2 televisions so no problem choosing what to watch after a long day out. We had no problems with outside noise. The elevator was fine. The staff at the front desk were nice. Short walk to lots of stuff. I would stay here again.

title: come sentirsi a casa
text: Piacevole sorpresa per soggiornare nei pressi di Times Square in un hotel di 12 piani. Appartamento bilocale con servizio giornaliero di pulizia e rassetto camere, arredamento un pò datato ma ben tenuto. Il nostro appartamento era composto da una camera da letto con due letti matrimoniali da una piazza e mezzo e un soggiorno con divano letto e angolo cottura molto accessoriato (piano cottura, forno, frigo, forno a microonde, macchina caffè americano, teiera, tostapane e tutto l'occorrente per cucinare e mangiare). A disposizione anche una tavola da stiro con ferro da stiro, detersivo per i piatti e prodotti da bagno. Due tv da 32" senza canali italiani, ottima connessione wi-fi. L'unica nota negativa è che avendo la posizione con affaccio sul retro il rumore dell'impianto del condizionatore era costante e l'appartamento aveva poca luce. Nella hall sono sempre disponibili ombrelli per i clienti e dalle 20:00 in poi nel seminterrato (magazzino) è possibile usufruire gratuitamente di tre lavatrici e quattro asciugatrici. Al 2° piano sono stati collocati due distributori automatici di bevande e snack, a fianco c'è anche una postazione internet ad uso gratuito.

title: Will definitely stay at this hotel again
text: Close to Times Square and multiple sites and several subway locations. Front desk staff were courteous and helpful with suggestions. Hotel was clean and beds were comfortable. An added benefit no resort fees.

title: A poor choice
text: This hotel is poorly run. The front desk help is surly. The rooms are cramped and because many have small kitchens the smell of cooking is everywhere and unpleasant. Rooms are occupied by more than they can accommodate. It is in a very busy area with scaffolding in front and construction noise is awful. It is surrounded by three small restaurants that are very busy and the sidewalk has lines of customers. Not worth the price. Also the bathrooms are tiny and cramped.. avoid it.

title: Great location but issue with doors.
text:
We have just finished a 5 night stay, as many have said, the location cannot be faulted. Room whilst small (studio with kitchenette) and traditional decorated, was clean and has air con (but noisy). Bathroom small but clean and plenty of towels. Maid service great and no issues. Beds are comfy and plenty of pillows. 

Only issue is the traditional keys for the room, we felt uneasy leaving the room on the first day and would much prefer the modern digital key cards, door also did not fit well and anyone letting the fire door slam shut, would then rattle our door. There is a room safe but this didn’t fit all valuables in towards the end of the week.

If this was resolved I would be happy to recommend to others, but won’t purely as sexism important.

title: Nice staff, functionnal rooms, great location
text:
Great location in the heart of Times Square, well-equipped rooms, helpful front desk staff, and check-in and check-out processing with no surprises.
Thank you for everything

A little bit of noise, and a little bit of vis à vis, but it's normal in Manhattan
The room lacks a bit of natural lighting.

title: Great location - that's about it!
text:
Average hotel. The guy on the front desk was less than average - provided us with absolutely no information when we checked in. Did not know what time to check out, where the laundry facilities were, etc. There is also no compendium in the room to give information about the hotel and nearby facilities. He basically gave us our keys (which were physical keys, not key cards) and that was it. 

The room suited us well for the 5 nights that we stayed there, and its proximity to Times Square and subway stations was fantastic. However, Friday & Saturday nights, bring ear plugs or don't expect to get any sleep. The noise from bars below as well as crowds and traffic for Times Square was insane (and we were on the 10th floor!) The other alternative is that you go and join the madness below so then you are kept awake.

Laundry facilities are in the basement free of charge to guests. HOWEVER, they're only able to be used between 8pm and 8am because these are the washers used by the cleaning staff to clean the bedding and towels. The timing was super inconvenient for us. 
We asked for house keeping only one of the days that we were there and it was also below average. Towels got replaced, but sheets were not changed, dishes were not washed that we had in the sink. We had left a tip so we expected more to have been done. There are separate window air con in the bedroom and the lounge which are very noisy and the hotel 'hums' when these are turned off, so I would not recommend this place to anyone who is a light or sensitive sleeper. 

All in all, the only thing saving this hotel is its location and relative cheap price compared to other hotels in the area. The building is older with solid walls and floors so no noise from other apartments. There are 2 elevators and they take forever to get you anywhere. Leave your room a few minutes earlier if you need to be anywhere in a hurry! 

We would only ever return to this hotel and recommend to others if they specifically needed to stay in this area, or were only staying for a few days excluding weekends.

title: Great stay
text: After several trips and stays on NYC we could that our room and accommodations were excellent. This by far was the largest room for the price we have experienced in NYC. It's a great valve, friendly staff, and great location. We would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend to others.

title: Clean but permanently smelt of short order cooking
text:
The location is ideal for Broadway and the beds are comfortable. However, although you expect the sights and smells of a city to be around you, our apartment had an all pervading smell of fried onions and burgers that did not diminish even when we completed the 'maintenance form' left in the room.  The air conditioning system is also very noisy so possibly two reasons for it to be upgraded soon!
There was a plentiful supply of clean towels and beds were made up daily, but we were surprised that 'serviced apartments' did not include washing the tea mugs. Maybe that's a British thing...

title: Another great stay
text: Stayed at Radio City apartments in December for a week in a 2 bedroom apartment plenty of space for 4 adults. Have stayed here before and again they did not disappoint the location can't be beat 5mns away from Times Sq and Rockefeller Center. Apartments are very clean and has a handy kitchenette with everything you would need would definitely stay here again.

title: Fine but beware families with strollers
text: We are staying at the hotel and it is it has a fine location. The rooms are fine. Sadly this place is inconsistent when you need assistance  to enter or exit the hotel with a baby stroller. Some of the employees are helpful with the main entrance stairs, but others (Alex) refuse to help and  complain if you request access to the small stair assistance elevator.

title: Servicio y ubicación
text:
Fue la mejor decisión haber elegido este hotel.
Esta ubicado a 200 metros de Time Square, Rockefeller Center y de diferentes líneas de subte. 
Las habitaciones son chicas pero tienen cocina con todo lo necesario (platos, vasos, tazas, ollas, sartenes, heladera, cocina, horno a gas, microondas, tostadora, cafetera, etc.). Limpian a diario y te dejan cafe, azucar y crema todos los dias. El baño es completo con secador de pelo y te cambian toallas y toallones en cada limpieza.
Habia un poco de ruido de un aire central que se encontraba en el patio interno que daba a la ventana. 
Destaco que aceptan pagos en efectivo ademas de tarjetas. Te cobran 250 dolares de deposito pero si no rompes nada te lo devuelven al hacer check out. 
Personal muy amable, hablan español y nos dieron la habitacion 4 horas antes del horario del check in, ni bien llegamos, porq ya estaba lista .
Volveria sin dudas a elegirlo.

title: Excelente hotel
text: Impecable. Un hotel con todas las comodidades en pleno centro de Manhattan. Ayudam un montón en lo cotidiano, la limpieza es buena y tiene una estación de subte a 50 mt., Doblas la esquina y estás en time square. Voy a volver sin dudas en cuanto pueda. Brindan paraguas para el día de lluvia, café crema azúcar todos los días, las toallas son hermosas y pesadas y la ropa de cama impecable. Lo único negativo es no haber podido quedarme más días.

title: Very good location
text:
We were 5 with my family.
Very good location, close to Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue and the subway.
Otherwise, the hotel was a bit old... a bit disappointed by that.
But it was good to have a kitchen in our flat.

title: Awesome location
text: The apartment room was clean and comfortable, and the location was  just awesome. It is so cental to everything. The staff were friendly and helpful. We loved our stay here and would thoroughly recommend Radio Apartments to anyone looking for good accommodation in New York.

title: Girls’ Trip
text: Second stay at radio city apartments. This place is amazing. We had a two bedroom apartment and it was fabulous. It is always a delight to stay at this hotel. Clean, great towels and linens. Staff couldn’t be nicer. Fantastic location. Loved it.

title: AVOID 100%
text: What an absolute mess. Months after reserving a family room for my wife and I, plus our 6 year old daughter, hotel have come back to us to advise that our daughter must sleep in our double bed OR give her a baby crib. That’s right, a BABY CRIB for a 6 year old girl! I pleaded with reservations to get this amended as clearly the booking was for 3 guests, however they REFUSED to arrange this for me unless I wanted to pay an 80% increase on our reservation directly to her. DISGUSTING way to operate. DTAY CLEAR OF THIS HOTEL!!

title: Extremely comfortable apartments close to Times Square
text:
We chose Radio City Apartments to stay in New York because of the location being a few minutes walk from Rockefeller Center and a short walk to Broadway / Times Square in the other direction. We originally booked a one-bedroom apartment but as we were late arriving all of those had been allocated so we were upgraded to a two-bedroom apartment. 

The apartment immediately felt spacious with an open-plan kitchen diner setup, the bedrooms although not large were absolutely fine, the bathroom was good with a bathtub and powerful shower. Although the apartment felt dated it wasn't a huge issue because it was immaculately clean and because of the generous amount of facilities that were provided.

We found all the staff members we came into contact with to be extremely friendly. It is an ideal place to stay location-wise and also as it is an extremely comfortable place to stay. It is also relatively quiet especially given its central location, for the price paid it just cannot be beaten.

title: Viaje en Julio
text: Un hotel barato , pero limpio y prolijo, no hay desayuno, el lavadero es gratis y cuando llueve te ofrecen paraguas sin costo adicional. El personal es excelente con trato muy amable, Time Square esta a 200 metros. Simplemente me gusto, por todo y su ubicación mas que comoda, el subte esta a 20 metros

title: Great Base
text: We stayed here for 4 nights in February. This is a little gem of a place. Fantastic location near to Rockefeller and TImes Square. Handy for subways too. The room was a great size and has a little kitchen in it with a coffee maker which was handy. The place was clean and the beds very comfortable. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. I will definitely book here again when coming back to New York. The pizza place downstairs was delicious too!

title: Excellent stay!
text: Excellent stay and a great value. Reserved a one bedroom and got upgraded to a 2 bedroom, but even without the  2nd bedroom we, as 3 friends travelling together, would have been very comfortable. Apartment was spacious and clean with a well equipped kitchen, plenty of towels and toiletries, extra blankets, and multiple tvs.

title: Tiny Apartment!
text: It's very quiet. It was so very quiet, I has to put on the TV. Very small room... I enjoyed the fact that it was set up like an apartment even with a full kitchen. The front desk staff was a little accommodating otherwise all good. Oh, I don't like the stairs. Looks like one from a horror movie. I wouldn't be surprised if they made a movie there.

title: Buenísimo
text: Muy buena ubicación y el servicio de todos sin duda lo mejor, todo el tiempo preguntando si estamos bien, las de limpieza muy atentas.las habitaciones muy cómodas y la cocina con todo lo necesario para preparar los alimentos

title: Don’t go if you don’t like to sleep!
text: Radio City apartments in NYC. Lovely place but omg the radiator made hammering noises all through the night. We did not sleep properly for our whole ´break'. We politely asked them to sort out on after the first, second and third night and they really were not interested. Such a shame because it could be amazing. We are exhausted for little sleep. My husband thought there were people drilling outside the window or someone hammering the wall. Just as you are dropping off to sleep the noise starts up and lasts about 15 minutes then silence. Drop off again and then an hour later the hammering starts… then stops then starts … all through the night . When we told reception they shrugged their shoulders… ´that’s the way it is’ although said they would try and sort… but they didn’t . Shambles

title: Excellent!! Immaculate and right in the middle of NYC
text: Absolutely fantastic! Perfect location . 2 minutes from Times Square but on a side street so not busy. 5 minutes to Rockefeller 10 minutes to Central Park. Staff on front desk very helpful and friendly. We had. 2 bed Apartment for 5 of us so my daughter was expecting to sleep on sofa bed but 2 queen beds in one room so big enough for her to have her own bed. Kitchen had everything you needed. Microwave toaster coffee machine big fridge freezer table chairs and sofa. Apartment Immaculately clean with beds made up everyday and clean towels. Bathroom beautiful with bath and shower. Lifts were absolutely fine and we were on 8th floor. Lovely bagel shop next door serving breakfast coffees etc and shops and restaurants everywhere. Excellent value for money

title: Excellent, comforatble hotel.
text: I have some strangely negative reviews of this hotel. OK, it isn't the Waldorf Astoria but it is an excellent, clean, comfortable hotel in an ideal Manhattan situation with thoughtful, helpful and good humoured staff. THe bathroom wasn't huge but then there was only ever one of us in there at a time. The kitchenette was very well eqippped and we could have cooked a full meal using it. We were treatd with respect by those on reception and nothing was too much trouble for Jaime and his colleagues, but then we treated them with respect and thanked them for their good advice and kind attention. We would certainly stay there again.

title: Super emplacement
text: Très bien situé à 2 pas de Times square, du rockfeller centre et de la 5th. Appartements propres et suffisammentspacieux pr 3, bien que bruyant car fenetres tres mal isolées, mais c'est NY... bon rapport qualité prix, métro en bas de l'immeuble.

title: An unexpected gem
text: After the pandemic halted our yearly family NYC Christmas holiday tradition, we were not sure what to expect. We booked relatively late and for a while it didn't look like we were going to find anything that we could afford until I came across the Radio City Apartments. Because we were traveling with extended family that included a toddler, we needed to find a place that was close to everything mid-town. I'd never heard of the Radio City Apartments and wasn't sure what to expect. Well, we'll be coming back. Is there a better referral than that? The staff was absolutely great, friendly, and courteous. Then, the room was clean and spacious and if we needed anything, someone would bring it right away. We couldn't believe our luck! No question we'll be coming back!

title: Très déçue !
text:
A part un emplacement exceptionnel, j’ai été super déçue par l’hôtel : j’avais réservé un studio avec kitchenette, j’ai eu une petite chambre (certainement pas un studio !) sans kitchenette : juste un frigo, une cafetière (qu’on ne pouvait remplir qu’en faisant une acrobatie…), un micro-ondes et quelques pièces de vaisselle. Ni plaques de cuisson ni évier et rien pour cuisiner ! La chambre était petite et pas très fonctionnelle, avec très peu de rangements.  Alors que les chambres autour étaient exactement ce que je voulais (comme celle que j’avais réservée il y a quelques années).
A la réception, accueil très limite (sauf un).
Les « services au client » étaient situés dans un local encombré de lits pliants et de cartons.
Guest office : juste un ordinateur sans connexion internet ni imprimante.
Vending machines : pas réapprovisionnées. Pas de boisson chaude. 
En outre, la confirmation de l’hôtel stipulait un taxi gratuit pour une réservation supérieure à 1000$. La mienne était largement supérieure (10 jours) mais je n’ai pas eu droit à cet avantage.

title: Pire expérience à vie
text:
Chambre très petite, tapis défraichit, vitres tellement minces que vous entendez tous les bruits de la rue, et il y en a des tonnes!! Portes se déverrouillant avec deux clés (impensable en 2022).   Le personnel à la réception très peu accueillant mais bon... Le pire est arrivé le matin de notre départ.  Le loquet de sécurité (dead lock) c'est brisé et nous étions coincé à l'intérieur de la chambre, même le personnel n'a pas réussi à enlever la poignée.  C'est mon conjoint qui avec un couteau à dévissé les vis et nous avons pu sortir.  Ceci est une question de sécurité, s'il y avait un feu ou une urgence médicale les conséquences auraient pu être plus graves.  

Cette chambre à 400$ la nuit est beaucoup trop chère pour cet hôtel aussi désuet.  Il y a des limites à faire payer la localisation.  

Vous pensez que j'exagère, et bien non ne gaspillé pas votre argent allez ailleurs quitte à être un peu plus loin de Times Square.

Je ne comprends pas que des sites comme Booking.com recommande cet hôtel.  Je ne ferai plus affaire avec ce site de revente.

title: La mejor ubicación y buena atención.
text:
No puede tener mejor ubicación, ya tenes garantizado varios puntos de Ney York a solo metros del alojamiento, y eso es fundamental. Jaime y Carlos O. suman un punto extra en la dedicación que le ponen a cada consulta con su amabilidad. El personal de limpieza es muy amable también, aunque se nota que no dan abasto con tanto trabajo, porque se les escapa algún detalle  como dejar todas las toallas, pero al instante te traen todo y mas.
La cocina es super completa, no hace falta nada, mas si necesitas una dieta especial y no podes comer todo de la calle . Cerca, a 200mts, hay un supermercado muy completo.
Al hotel le faltaría modernizarse, cambiar las alfombras, se nota la antigüedad, esos detalles, pero el resto está bien.
De nuevo, agradezco la amabilidad de Jaime y Carlos O.

title: Disappointing from the moment I arrived.
text: I arrived to face 8 steps to the front door. The elevator from the sidewalk is clearly intended only for those with mobility challenges (staff later confirmed to me that others are NOT permitted to use it).  Since I was solo, I couldn't simply leave my luggage on the sidewalk to go inside for help, so I dragged my suitcase up the steps.  I selected a studio, which was poorly laid out and cramped even for 1 person. The bureau is inches from the  foot of the bed so the drawers can't be opened and you must squeeze through to get to the other side of the bed.   There is no closet, only a clothing rack that hangs over the table, in a tiny corner that includes the luggage rack and ironing board.   The bathroom is tiny, with not an inch of shelving and not even a single hook.   The sheets and towels are thin and rough and the bed is rock hard. Construction left the hallways alternating between layers of dust and wet paint.  And despite being on the 8th floor, with the air conditioner running, I could still hear noise from the street.

title: Bare basics close to Broadway
text: Perfect location for theater goers!  Misleading photos of room amenities.  The hotel photos show lovely , but small kitchenettes. No so for us. Also no closet, just a rack. One overhead horrible light and one bedside lamp lines for the2 small elevators all the time. Nice people though, just an old hotel. Pictures to follow if allowed.

title: Nice midtown hotel
text: Stayed in a one bedroom. It was nice having the living room for extra space. Very clean apartment and close to everything! We walked to Rockefeller center, M&Ms store and Magnolia bakery. Very convenient and safe location! Will definitely look to stay here again.

title: Location perfetta in pieno centro - Rapporto prezzo-qualità ottimo
text:
Appartamento ottimo con buoni spazi (in 5 abbiamo preso "One Bedroom Apartment with Two Queen Beds and a sofa bed" situato al 11 piano).
Situato in posizione strategica vicinissimo a Times Square, a Rockfeller center e a 2 fermate di metro (49th street a pochi metri dall'ingresso + 50th street anch'essa vicina).
Staff molto gentile e disponibile.
A disposizione dei clienti anche lavatrice e asciugatrice nello scantinato (l'uso è gratuito bisogna solo portare detersivo).
La cucina dispone di tutto l'occorrente.
Pulizia ottima
Presente moquette in tutto l'appartamento.

title: A home away from home in the centre of the city
text:
We are a family of 4 with 2 teens and stayed in a two bed apartment. The children were happy to share a  double room and the adults shared the 'single' which has a bed big enough for two!
Having our own kitchen and sitting room was ideal as we could save money by making our own meals. There is also a good takeaway breakfast place next door called Toasties and plenty of restaurants nearby. 
The hotel was clean and although older than some, has been recently renovated so the facilities were modern.  I would put it at the 3/4 star level. 
The location is close to Times Square and a lot of the main sights were within walking distance for us. Top of the Rock is literally 5.minutes away. 
The staff are very friendly and helpful plus they stored our luggage for free on checkout day which not all hotels do. There were no hidden 'resort fees' and checkout was easy. 
One minor issue was that the Aircon was loud but I give this place 5 stars as that seems to be normal wherever we have been!

title: Location, decor, staff, comfort - very enjoyable stay!
text:
The price was very reasonable. The location was fantastic - close to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, etc. 

The lobby was beautiful! It seemed small to a mid-westerner, where we are used to a lot of space. I think it was fabulous for Manhattan! The ceiling and stair case were gorgeous!

The staff was top notch. The beds were comfortable with nice linens. There was enough coffee for three small pots. It seems most hotels are a little stingy with the coffee in the room, not this place. We were there for a one night layover. The coffee was needed as we were jet lagged and trying to reset our body clock. 

The staff was incredibly kind, respectful and helpful. The luggage storage was secure while we spend our morning sight seeing. The staff scheduled a car service to the airport in the afternoon. 

We didn’t sample the restaurant.

The (2 double beds) room was plenty big for the two of us with our medium suitcases and backpacks. It was small for those of us from the Midwest, but seems to be the norm for the city.

title: I liked the visit at the property
text:
Very good property and neat and clean area, 
Where all staffs are well behaved and helpful, 
We came for a business meeting that was nice of time spending place there hope my feedback will be a help to other's to choose it though.

title: Precisa ser modernizado
text: Boa estada, ar condicionado de janela sem controle remoto, chuveiro sem agua quente e pouca agua. Quarto confortável.  Limpeza diária a contento. Faltam travesseiros. Pedi mais dois e me atenderam.  Rua movimentada com restaurantes proximos. Bar em frente, na rua, sem uso

title: GREAT value!
text: My family of 5 was VERY impressed with the staff at the Radio City Apartments! They were kind and patient, and were able to swing some different accommodations when necessary. The building is not modern and new, but was clean and we felt very well taken care of. I would recommend this hotel to family travelers on a budget anytime! Great experience for our first time in NYC!

title: Très bien (mais vieillot)
text:
Très bon hôtel, nous avions une chambre avec 2 lits en 140 + 1 salon avec 1 canapé lit (1 vrai lit en 140) et un coin cuisine bien équipé (manque une bouilloire électrique) + table. 
Salle d’eau tout à fait correcte. 
Finalement assez grand (meubles de rangements…)
Déco vieillotte (moquette) et climatisation d’un autre âge. Ménage tous les jours (+ serviettes). 
En plein centre de Manhattan (2 minutes de Times Square et du métro). 
Je recommande vraiment pour les groupes ou les familles.

title: Great value and service; centrally located
text: Our family of two parents and two teenaged boys stayed one week in a 2 bedroom apartment.  The place was located near multiple subway stations and a bunch of typical tourist stops (Times Square, EBS, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, GST) but was quiet and spacious (relatively speaking for NYC).  It was great having a kitchenette as it saved us money and time.  There is also a washer/dryer available free for guests.  You need to provide your own laundry detergent though.  The place was clean and the reception desk was professional and helpful.  As many have noted, the furnishings were not modern or luxurious but they were perfectly functional and the place was perfect for the price.  I would stay again.

title: Radio City Apartments New York
text: Really impressed with location, staff and cleanliness of these apartments. Cleaning staff were meticulous with freshly made beds and towels every single day. Front of house guys really helpful and a real friendly vibe throughout. Wouldn’t stay anywhere else whilst in New York! Thanks for a really memorable stay.

title: Hidden Little Gem
text:
Best thing was the location, so close to Times Square, safe and quietly tucked away.    Rooms were dated and older but very clean and functional, actually bathroom was nice.   Front desk were professional and good at their job.  

We would definitely stay again and recommend.  But don’t go if you’re expecting luxury 5 stars.

title: Wonderful!
text: Just returned from a 4 night stay.  Had a one bedroom apartment with 2 double beds.  It is an older hotel but in pristine condition.  Absolutely beautiful.  Super clean rooms.  Plush towels.  Quality sheets.  Lovely.  Fantastic location.  Front desk is awesome, especially Jaime!

title: An oldie but goodie
text:
If you are looking for an ultra modern chrome and glass apartment, then Radio City is not for you.  If you want convenient location, comfort and cleanliness, then read on.
We chose a one bedroom apartment as opposed to a double room for the extra space and seating area, which it offered.  We didn't really need the kitchen, but the fridge, kettle, microwave, china, glass and cutlery were very useful.  The bedroom and lounge were both good size. 
The decor and colour scheme in the apartment is very dated and tired looking, and even the cream coloured sheets look a bit worn BUT everything was scrupulously clean. 
 It was bitterly cold in New York, and we appreciated the central heating, which at first did not seem to be working, but was switched on as soon as we mentioned it to reception.  They even gave us an electric heater to use until the room warmed up.
The apartments are just a step away from 8th Avenue, and the subway is around the corner at 49th, very convenient for everything. There are plenty of restaurants, cafes etc. in the area.
We would definitely stay here again.

title: Great Budget Hotel
text:
Hotel in a great situation approx 10 minutes walk from Central Park, 20 minutes walk from Empire State, 5 minutes from Times Square etc.
Reception was efficient and polite. Room was more than adequate and clean with kitchen area.
Umbrellas for guest use by entrance.
I had a query following my stay and my message was answered satisfactorily within 5 minutes.
Would recommend this hotel for the price and location.

title: Excellent location. Top class budget hotel
text: 3 nights. Small, but this is NYC size. The kitchenette was ideal. Full size cooker and fridge. Spotless and reasonably equipped. Quirky but charming building. Only issue was double bed against a wall. Not great in the middle of the night for the 'wall' one. Would certainly recommend, and as everyone says it is top for location. Good grocery store one block away. It was NYC pricey, so take a few of your own fixings- sugar, seasonings etc if you intend to do even minimal cooking.

title: Whaaoouh what a service , I ll give 5 stars !
text:
We did organize a wedding in NYC and we chose to stay at the Radio city apartments
We have to manage more than 10 rooms during the week and we ask Tina Rossman for help at the hotel 
She managed perfectly all our stays and I have to say, me as a road warrior, I never had such good service 

Thanks Tina and THANKS to the entire team at the Radio code city 
You was perfect thank you again

title: Location, Location, Location
text:
Perfect find for a girls trip!   Spent 3 nights in a 2 bedroom apartment- which was stocked with everything we needed. Liam was GREAT + helpful.
We had a walk-in shower (1 guest had knee issues) as requested.  Beds were very comfortable.  Easy to use TV's.  Free internet.

Thanks to the housekeeping staff!  They came in every day and did a heavy clean, left towels and extra lotions.

Furniture was a bit dated (but comfortable).  Only complaint was the heater- very very loud and not able to control.  But since it was 20 degrees outside I'd rather have noise then freeze.

Plenty of restaurants, food trucks, gift shops right outside the front door.  Only steps from a few Broadway Theaters and Times Square.

title: Vintage but refined
text: The hotel is a couple of blocks from Times Square making it a great location to access the subway system, the ticket outlet and the theatres. All are within easy walking distance. The room is small but well appointed, clean and comfortable. Sleep quality is excellent. The room is equipped with a kitchenette which includes a full-size refrigerator, gas stove, cookware, coffee pot, tea kettle and microwave. Yes, there is street but this New York.

title: Very good choice.
text:
Very good choice. Right in the heart of Broadway 
Easy walk to all shows. Room was spacious, by Manhattan standards. Small kitchenette was a nice bonus. Spotlessly clean. Comfortable bed. Powerful shower. Great staff. Slightly disconcerting factor, was the water radiator that let off steam and gurgled every hour. Would return. Great price, booked a couple of weeks before travelling.

title: Basic Hotel, Vintage NYC
text: I stayed one night in Feb 2022 in a studio. For $120/night in downtown NYC, this place did the job. It was clean, comfortable, and the staff was helpful. The place itself was interesting - a converted old apartment building, with some very old systems still in place - physical keys instead of key cards, and no thermostat in the room. (They had to send someone up to adjust the radiator) The lobby was beautifully decorated in Art Deco, the staircase was very cool, but there were some odd smells in the hallways and the door to the room wasn't very thick. All in all, it was fun staying here for a night, if only to feel like I had stepped into a time warp.

title: Location can't be beat
text: A great value, especially considering the location. The appearance and decor of the rooms may be somewhat dated, but the property is quite clean and one typically visits NYC they don't spend a ton of time just hanging in their hotel room and to enjoy its ambience. Budget hotel rooms in Manhattan usually leave much to be desired, but considering that you're practically in the heart of Times Square, I can't imagine there's a better value to be had.  Good wifi, full kitchenettes (standard-sized fridge/freezer, microwave, sink, stove) in each room, comfortable beds, the only negative I can really think of is that their two elevators are a bit slow.

title: Una buena opción cerca de todo
text: Estuve alojada con mi marido y 4 hijos (20 a 15 años). El departamento está ubicado estratégicamente. Cerca de todo si te gusta Times Square es ideal . Creo que está un poco antiguo y deberían renovar la decoracion. Falta luz en la cocina y había vajilla para 4 cuando éramos 6 . Faltaron sillas y vajilla. Las camas cómodas pero muy poco espacio para guardado. Creo q es así en todo NY. El baño bien, salía ok el agua caliente. Lo que fue de turrón es la calefacción. Súper caluroso el Depto, imposible abrir ventanas. Están trabadas y re ahogas. Después a cualquier hora( medianoche- madrugada) empieza a golpear la cañeríia de la calefacción y te despierta. Sumamente molesto. Y estábamos en un piso alto , el ascensor es lento así q tardas en subir y bajar y esperar que llegue. Así q no se si volvería a alojarme acá. Reconozco que fue cómodo tener una cocina.

title: Mostly good
text:
The positives:
* Size of the apartment (very roomy one bedroom)
* Kitchen
* Nice bathroom with tub
* Great location
* Lovely and tasty restaurant connected
* Secure
* Adequate internet
* Very clean, with daily service as needed
* TVs in both living room and bedroom
The cons:
* Radiator - super noisy
* Front desk - responsive, but not particularly friendly

title: Tired Property
text: Great location and have stayed here several times in the past because of location and having access to a two bedroom with living area.  Have in the past overlooked the tired condition of the property, but it just appears to be more and more worn..... Old carpeting in rooms,  terrible bedding..... Heat did not work and remotes had to be replaced.....    Until there are some serious updates done we will be staying elsewhere in the future.

title: Mixed reactions!
text: We check out tomorrow, December 14th, 2021. Since we checked in on Friday the 10th we have complained about the room’s #208, lack of heat and our tvs’s remote! We just returned tonight, December 13th from dinner a day before we check out and the heat seems to be finally working properly. And during our 4 days, the day time temperature has been unseasonably warm, up to 60 on Saturday. Now to the tv remote, the maintenance person can to our room on our first day, the 10th and aiming the remote at the tv he was able to control the volume and the off and on of the tv, he was capable of completing those functions. Of course that is both handled by the tv itself. We asked for replacement batteries for the remote, 2 triple A batteries. Nope, never replaced. The cable box is hung on the back of the tv and requires RF signal provided by good batteries!!! Not the weak ones we have in our room 208 tv remote! My review would have been much higher since the property is located near to most NYC attractions and the rooms offer a kitchenette. But since the “attention to detail is very poor” I will stick with a rating of mediocre, 3 stars!

title: La mejor ubicación
text:
Nos alojamos por nueve días en este edificio de apartamentos. Realmente disfrutamos de estos días. En nuestro caso éramos dos personas, nos dieron un pequeño estudio con dos camas, pero sumamente cómodo con kitchenette Anafe, microondas, heladera, y todo lo necesario tanto en la cocina como en el baño. Con servicio de limpieza diario. Todos los días nos dejaban café y té.
La tención del personal fue excelente, sumamente agradables. La mayoría hablaba español.
La ubicación inmejorable, a tres minutos de Time Square a pie, en una zona muy transitada.
Sin dudarlo regresaría a este hotel en una próxima visita a Nueva York.
100% Recomendable!!

title: A great place to stay
text:
As other reviews have mentioned, the decor in the rooms is dated.  However, the rooms were clean; the location was very centrally located to walking, theater, subway, etc.  We appreciated having the coffee maker and refrigerator and microwave in our room.  My daughter and I stayed in a double deluxe, and we had enough room to leave one suitcase open.  The other we closed up and kept in a corner.  It felt like plenty of room.  My mom stayed in a queen, and that layout was even more comfortable.  

The hotel was pleasant in accommodating our request for a late check-out for one of our two rooms.  

Finally, this hotel was an excellent location for us to view the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day parade.  It was a half a block walk to the parade route.  (Parade went past on 6th Ave at 49th St.) We got there at 6:30 am and got a great spot, but we were still close enough to take turns going back to the hotel for bathroom breaks.  

The hotel itself was also pretty quiet for New York.  There was some street noise but not as bad as I’ve experienced elsewhere.

title: Gas leak, cold shower, heat that you can’t turn off, moldy tea pot, and front desk doesn’t care about any of it
text:
Worst hotel experience I’ve had in 30 years and the front desk could care less. 

The day I checked in I smelled natural gas in my room, I thought perhaps it was coming from the outside so dropped my things off and left for the day. Came back to change and the smell was still there. Left a few minutes later for a show and came back to smell it in the hallway. Called the front desk and maintenance came and turned the stove off. They couldn’t smell the gas. I asked to change rooms and the front desk said it was too late in the day to do that. He said someone will come up and show me how to open the window.! I packed up my things and went to the front desk and got a key to another room. That room did not smell like gas so I slept there. I should’ve packed up and left the hotel.

Day 2 - Went to take a shower, took 10 minutes to get lukewarm. Front desk said they would fix it. The solution, let it run longer to heat up.

Day 3 - Went to heat up water in the kettle for tea, it was filled with mold - replaced with an insincere apology

Day 4 - The  room was so hot and there was no way to turn the radiator off. Called the front desk at 5am “he’ll show you how to do it.”  The controls were behind the fridge (half the radiator is covered by the fridge) and the way to to adjust the temp is to pull the entire fridge out to get  behind it. Called the front desk back to tell him guests cannot be expected to do this. He didn’t care, “call the manager on Monday.”

We stayed here because some people we know with very discerning taste have stayed here multiple times (pre COVID). Looks like this is another business that has gone downhill significantly. I tried hard to be patient due to all the problems the pandemic has brought to the hospitality industry. But if the room is too hot (or filled with noxious fumes), the shower too cold, the teapot too moldy, and a front desk clerk who is completely unsympathetic… it’s time to sell to a new owner or close down.

title: Terrifying stay
text: This is literally the worst hotel experience I’d had in my life. I stayed there for one night 10/13-10/14, I checked in around 3:30, firstly my room was still being cleaned when I came up to the floor. Which is fine. But that night at 1:44 am, someone literally OPENED MY DOOR and try to walk in!! Thankfully I had the chain latched, and I screamed out. The man said he was maintenance and was sent to clean the room (at 1:45 am?!?) he then started saying that I’m not in the computer and I need to come out and go downstairs. I said I’m not going downstairs, so I called the front desk, who was like oh but the room was unoccupied earlier. No apologies nothing! I don’t know if they were trying to get me out of the room so they can bulgrarize the room, or saw a single female checking in. But of course I stayed up all night and as soon as I could go back into my office, I checked out, and now disputing the charge.

title: Excellent place!
text: Three women spent four nights here, in a two-bedroom unit. Yes, it is old, it is small, and there is a lot of noise from area construction and night-time revelry. The higher the floor, the less the noise. It was very clean, with good beds and a nice, though small, bathroom. The extra lavatory and big counter outside the bathroom was a bonus for the three of us. We had a few service requests of the staff, and they were met immediately, and with a smile. One warning--if you need total darkness to sleep you may need to take your own black-out curtain to hang over the window blinds, which do not keep out the glow of city lights. We will stay here again.

title: 100 % recomendable. Excelente ubicación
text:
Excelente atención y predisposición de todos sus empleados.
El servicio de mucamas  y limpieza es  de primer nivel
Gracias a Carlos y Jaime, por la atención recibida
Ubicación ideal para conocer la ciudad de a pie y/o en el Subway.
Esta situado a escasas cuadras de Times Square, MOMA,  Brian Park,  Broadway,  combinaciones con todos los medios de transporte.

title: Great location but very tiny
text: First of all, my advice is do not book the studio with two double beds. Its a shoe box. Book the deluxe studio or the one bedroom apartment. Even if you book the deluxe studio, be aware there is no closet or place for you to store your suitcases. You will have to keep them standing next to your bed because there is no place for them.  We booked a room for a couple and a twelve years old child and we thought it was too small for the three of us in the room. The beds were not spacious. The apartment was clean and the location is right by Times Square and the deluxe studio has a kitchenette with refrigerator, stove and a small round table with two chairs, which can be very useful.

title: Don't Overthink It, Just Book It!
text: This hotel is in a perfect location. A subway station is at the end of the block. Central Park is less than a fifteen-minute walk, Time Square is less than five, and restaurants, food carts, and convenience stores are all right there. You get an actual set of keys for your little apartment, including a 4 burner gas stove, small fridge, sink, flatware, and dinnerware. Didn't feel like the walls were thin. Only heard neighbors when walking down the hall to my room. I wish I'd found this hidden gem long before now.

title: A Hidden Gem!
text: Family vacation with my daughter and grandkids (11 & 14).  We had the most amazing time and LOVED Radio City Apartments. The location was perfect! Close to so many must see NYC attractions, hop on/hop off bus & subway within 200 ft. Restaurants close by.   The apartment itself was perfect.  We enjoyed the extra room & kitchenette.  Very, very clean.  Not much ‘city noise’.  We were here on the hottest day of the year (so far).  A/C worked perfectly.  Can’t say enough great things about this hotel.  Great location, clean, excellent customer service - the best!  We will definitely be back!!

title: Superb location, clean, value for money
text: My wife and I stayed for about two weeks in April-May and got upgraded to a a two bedroom apartment from the one bedroom that we had booked (we also got an early check-in too). The apartment was clean, had a decent kitchenette (could do with more utensils and cutlery like wine glasses though) and while the rooms were small, there was ample space to move around. The staff was quite pleasant. There’s also a laundromat in the basement though we didn’t use it. It is a bit noisy given the location and construction activity that was going on next door. The rooms look a bit aged as well. But the location is super convenient and the rate that we got in April was great value for money. And that was the best part!

title: MANAGEMENT needs to address to employees
text: 1/10 stars!!! Very very noisy stay.. especially in the Morning with constructions in every directions.. Terrible customer service as well..only Carlos In the morning had good customer services and was friendly.. We are here for vacation and we came back from dinner.. met up with my sister who lives here and she walked back with 4 of us to the hotel and the front desk person was being soo rude at night shift.. he noticed that there were 5 of us and our room was only meant for 4 guest.. like cmon bro she’s my sister she’s only gonna go up for a minute and leave and he was being rude.. I even offered to give him a tip just let my sister go up and see how we were staying.. I understand it’s company policy for no guest allowed but what kinda BS** is it that your own sister can not even come up for a minute and visit you. That old African American man in the front desk was very rude.. not knowing the situation he immediately enforeced the no visitor and only 4’guest are allowed in the room.. we are definaley never returning to this place becuase of his attitude.. other than being soo rude to the hotel is very comfortable but not very welcoming.. seems like late graveyard  staffs are hawks looking to kick us out!!! Terrible customer service for sure!! Worst newyork experience ever .. not RECOMMENDED to anyone visiting ..

title: Very nice apartments and excellent friendly staff
text:
I stayed with my family of 4 (me, my husband, and my two adult daughters) from Feb. 15th to Feb 18th, 2021. The location of the apartments is excellent, the apartment very well equipped and has comfortable beds, enough pillows, and covers. A cute and very practical kitchen with all needed glassware, pans, microwave, kettle, silverware, etc..
The apartment was well heated although it was very cold. The staff are very friendly and allowed us both early check-i and late check-out and helped us get a taxi to the airport during a nasty snowstorm.

title: My favorite place to stay in NYC
text: Perfect location, a block from Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Times Square. Great people, great service, always helpful.  Little apartments with kitchens and places to sit! Most midtown hotels you have to step over your bed to get to the door or the bathroom.  We come in a group and rent a two-bedroom apartment--we can all stay together, in comfort, keep some cold drinks and doggy bags in the refrigerator, make coffee in the morning.  Absolutely love it here!

title: キッチン付きホテル
text:
ニューヨーク到着後、2週間ほど滞在しました。アゴダで予約して一泊平均85ドルでした。コロナの関係でニューヨークに来る人も少ないのか、過去の口コミのような単価ではありませんでした。

このホテルの特徴は、各部屋についている台所です。普通の弁当を買うのでも10ドルを超えてくるマンハッタンの物価に対応するため、台所で週に何度か調理して食事を済ませました。一ブロックぐらい西に進んだところにスーパーがあり、そこで買い物をしました。備え付けとして、鍋、フライパン、お玉、フライ、皿、カップ、グラス、ワインオープナー、かご、ボウル、やかん等々があり、料理は可能です。（唯一ラーメン用のお椀がありませんでした）コロナで飲食店もあまり自由に食事ができる雰囲気ではなかったので、少なくとも朝ご飯はホテル、昼か夜はホテルで調理するか外食でした。

部屋の広さはそこまでではありません。また部屋番号にってレイアウトが異なり、私の滞在した1002号室は北西の角部屋で、割と明るくて良かったです。低層になると窓の数が減ったり、暗くなったりするようです。またバスタブも部屋によってはついてないようです。

欠点は、外の騒音がうるさいことです。タイムズスクエアに近いので、夜遅くまで騒いでいる人がいたりします。また建物自体が古いので、配管が錆びているのかお湯が時間帯によって黄ばんでいます。（特に使う人が少ない早朝？）お湯を張る場合は、しばらく待った方が良いと思います。

あとデポジット250ドルが返金されるのに1ヶ月かかって、正直1ヶ月はないなという印象です。ただ、カード会社によっては引き落とされないケースもあるみたいです。

title: great secret in NYC
text: This is our second stay at Radio City. The staff is very kind and helpful, the apartments are clean and well appointed and you cannot beat the price, also you are in the middle of NYC w great restaurants and  times square

title: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION !!!!!!!!
text:
Apartment is a bit dated decoration wise but when in  New York you're really never in it  but location is everything....
 
We had a 2 bedroom apartment and the sofa bed for 5 of us which was great a full double and 2 queen size beds.
Beds very comfortable, plenty of towels and a small but brilliant little kitchen with full 4 ring cooker, microwave, large fridge freezer, kettle, toaster cutlery 

the location here is everything just around the corner from time square. Subway at your doorstep . Deli on the doorstep. Bar and restraint on the doorstep 
5 minute walk to Rockefeller 
5 minutes to 5th Ave 
Just around the corner from the bus tours 
could not fault this place for location, price and room facilities.
staff were friendly and very helpful.

title: A full kitchen 😃 Wow!
text: Location location location! A few steps off Broadway. The title lives up to the property. How it feels to live in New York City as a resident not just a tourist. The full kitchen completely allows for a home cooked meal.

title: Stay
text: Check in was seamless, I was extremely satisfied with the cleanliness of the room. Friendly staff. And accessing my room was real easy. Would Defenitely go back when ever staying in midtown. Real studio apartment feel.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Muy buena la ubicación, puedes llegar caminando a las tiendas famosas y lugares emblemáticos. Personal amable, todo funciona, decoración antigua Estacionamiento muy cerca. Puedes tomar bus o metro muy cerca del edificio.

title: A hidden gem in the city
text: The studio apartments are the best place I visited and or stayed in NYC. It's home away from home. The hotel is clean, the staff very pleasant, the kitchenette in the room is priceless and the pots, dishes, and utensils are the icing on the cake.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Perfect location to access the Theater District, Central Park, Rockefellar Plaza, Penn Station. Was able to walk everywhere and save loads in cab fare. Rooms were clean and well equipped, staff was helpful and friendly.

title: Okay, but misleading
text:
It's an okay property if you know what you're going into, but the pictures do not match the rooms.  I booked the room with the kitchenette.  Instead, I got a small dresser with some dishware on it, a fridge with some garbage still in it (expired soy sauce maybe?), a sponge, and some previously opened dish soap.

The bathroom was a bit cramped, but the best part of the room.  There was no stove, only a minifridge (a full fridge was pictured), and no microwave.  If you planned on staying here and getting groceries, call ahead to ensure your room has all of the amenities you expect as the pictures don't represent the truth.

When trying to resolve all of these issues, they offered to move me into a larger room, however, when I went to work out the logistics, they told me that the room would still not match what I was offered.

For similar pricing, better hotels are available for what I received.  If you can get what they promised, stay here.

title: Great place
text: The personnel are always ready to help. Convenient location. I enjoyed having a stove and being able to cook for myself. It is a safe place. The building is well taken care of and always clean. I would return here.

title: 100 % recomendable. Ubicación ideal.
text:
Limpieza, ubicación y trato excelente. Camada comodísima. 
Nuestra habitación tenía cocina y estaba todo nuevo y super limpio. 
Ubicación perfecta. Si tienes que ir a la zona de Manhattan baja, el metro está al salir del hotel y super bien comunicado. 
Única pega, estaban en obras y se escuchaba en nuestra habitación.

title: Comodidad a metros de TS
text:
Muy buen Apart, cómodo, limpio, con todo lo necesario para prepararse algo en las tardes, algo que es muy útil en una ciudad tan cara como NYC.
Lo del café excelente.
El trato del personal es muy bueno y todos hablan español.
La ubicación para recorrer NYC es inmejorable, cerca de las principales atracciones. Los 100 km recorridos en 7 días lo certifican.
Al debe solamente el sistema de calefacción a veces ruidoso y temperatura muy elevada algunos días.
El sistema de guarda equipaje muy útil.
Recomiendo al lado del Apart, la Pizzería Radio City y el restaurante Pasta Lovers y hay un Food Emporium a 3 cuadras y estaciones de metro a la mano.

title: NUEVA YORK EN MARZO
text:
Este hotel tiene un servicio impecable. Los apartamentos son amplios con 2 camas grandes muy cómodas . Tiene living con sofá cama para dos personas más . Cocina equipada con heladera grande y refrigerador, cocina, horno y microondas. Cambian las toallas todos los días y las sabanas cada 4. El laundry está incluido y solo tenes que pagar el jabón 50 ctvos . El 2do piso tiene máquinas expendedoras de gaseosas y refrigerios y una P.C. por si la necesitas . El PERSONAL EN SU TOTALIDAD ES SÚPER AMABLE Y TODOS HABLAN ESPAÑOL.
En pleno Manhattan a 1/2 cuadra del metro. Lo recomiendo 100%.  Éramos 4 personas y estuvimos re bien!!

title: Great location!  Also great to have the full kitchen, and spacious too
text: We loved our trip to the Radio City Apartments.  You just can't beat the location, walking distance from Times Square.  It wasn't too loud, our kids slept just fine.  Saved a ton of money cooking several meals (especially breakfast) in the room.  It was so nice to be in this location.  Yes, the decor is a little outdated, but why cares?  Very reasonably priced...

title: NY 40th Birthday Stay
text:
Can't fault the apartments/hotel. Friendly service, great location and great room. The room was well equipt and comfortable. Beds were also very comfy and I am very fussy! Best place I've stayed for comfy pillows! 😃
There is building work round the one side which is very noisy but that's no fault of Radio City! Take your earplugs! 
Housekeeping were great. Friends had sprinkled 40 confetti on the table. When we got home that night the maids had put it in the shape of a heart! ❤ Great stay and wouldn't hesitate booking again.

title: Incredible Location, Clean Reasonably Priced Quiet Rooms
text: We caught a great deal and booked 3 nights (Sunday to Wednesday) here for $130 a night. At this price it was a great bargain. We added a night at $280 a night which was a little steep.  Location is amazing. We had a large one bedroom with two double beds that were reasonably comfortable , TV and dresser  in the bedroom.  Living room, kitchen area had a sofa bed with a TV.  Sofa bed would be fine for kids but not adults cause Mattress was pretty thin.  They have daily room cleaning available we did not use it.
