Apartment was equipped with stove, microwave, fridge and small dining room table.   Had a nice walk in shower.   They arranged for a car service to Newark airport. Cost is steep at $100 but worth it if you have limited mobility.  Time to airport was 30 minutes but could take as long as  1 hour.   We flew out at 1:15 PM to avoid travel during rush hour. Great breakfast place called Toasties is 2 doors down

title: Parfait
text: Hotel très bien placé, metro, Times square, Rockefeller centre tout à pied! Tres propre, cuisine et salle de bain top, café à dispo et nécessaire pour la cuisine très pratique. Personnel agréable et disponible. Des travaux incessant et du bruit mais normal c'est New york il suffit de prévoir des bouchons pour dormir. Super séjour !!

title: Great Hotel!
text: The hotel is in the PERFECT location!  It is clean, the staff are very friendly and the price is reasonable. It is right next door to an amazing Italian restaurant, which is where we went frequently.  I would recommend this to everyone.

title: Great Reception staff.
text:
Unfortunately my husband became unwell and we returned home .... the Reception staff were great  and their concern and help very much appreciated.  Otherwise, our room was perfect, clean and quiet,
very convenient for breakfast.  Room service personnel were quietly efficient and very pleasant. Overall, we were happy with the Radio City Hall apartment.

title: So convenient
text: We had a very hard time finding something to accommodate us as a family. I really don't understand why all hotels offer 2 double beds when you're travelling with 2 teenagers. This hotel was the only one that remotely met our requirements with 2 double beds in one room and a sofa bed in the living room. The kids said their beds were very comfortable, the sofa bed however was a little tired, not sure we could have used it for any longer than the 4 nights we stayed. Having the kitchenette was a real bonus. The rooms and the property were very clean and the staff were really helpful and friendly. Its a nice touch that they'll hold your luggage if you have a late flight. The location of this hotel was brilliant with subway stations on the next block and on the corner, restaurants and shops all around you and Times Square just a couple of blocks walk away. It was surprisingly quiet for the location too. Had no problem with the free wifi, always a bonus with teenagers! Would definitely stay here again.

title: Un empleado nos arruinó el día
text:
Me recomendaron bastante este hotel por su ubicación y si!  Su ubicación es inmejorable.  Somos 5 en mi familia y tomamos el one bedroom apartment con sofa cama.  Nos dieron el apartment 410, situado justo al frente de una construcción, a menos de 10 metros.  A las 7 am empezaban con la fuerte bulla, incluido el domingo.  Después de la primera noche fuimos a hablar con recepción para cambiar.  Nos ofrecieron un cambio pero en 2 horas que hacía check out otro departamento y nosotros ya queríamos salir a conocer la ciudad.  Pedimos para hacerlo en la noche cuando estuviéramos de regreso pero nos dijeron q en la noche ya no estaría disponible.  Les sugerí bloquear el arrendamiento de esos departamentos que dan a la construcción pues de ninguna manera garantizaba el descanso de sus huéspedes y su empleado Carlos de recepción se metió a la conversación de la forma más malcriada y altanera, gritando que no debería darles consejos de cómo manejar el hotel que ese era asunto de ellos, le increpé la forma de hablarnos y nos dijo que él nos hablaba como él quería.  Jamás en nuestras vidas habíamos sido tratados de esa manera.  Mis 3 hijos se asustaron y nos malogró el día.  Leyendo comentarios aquí, he visto quejas de trato de este mismo señor, Carlos.  Me pregunto, los administradores o dueños leen estos comentarios?  Cómo pueden mantener a una persona así dentro de su personal?  Cabe resaltar que el resto del personal es muy amable!
Aparte del ruido de la construcción lo que no me gustó fue el sistema de calefacción.  Había demasiado calor y uno no podía regularlo porque es un sistema muy antiguo.  Tuvimos que llamar a un empleado a que nos ayude bajándole la temperatura, un muchacho bien amable.  Sobre la limpieza, no me gustó encontrar las cubetas de hielo en el freezer con algunos cubos de hielo utilizados.  Dos de mis hijos son alérgicos al polvo y empezaban a estornudar cuando llegábamos a la habitación.  Lo positivo de este hotel indudablemente es su ubicación.  El servicio de café, té, toallas es muy bueno.  Te prestan paraguas cuando llueve y te reciben paquetes sin costo.

title: Affordable NYC hotel
text: The rooms were clean and quiet. The price was very affordable. The staff was friendly and helpful. Beds were a little uncomfortable and the WiFi didn't always work well but otherwise a great stay. We would consider staying here again.

title: Muy buen departamento
text: Es un hotel basado en apartamento muy completo, tiene todo lo necesario para que la familia esté bien, muy bien ubicado. Con la cocina completa y un supermercado cerca en la 49 y 8 con precios buenos y accesibles, podes cocinar y ahorrar un montón

title: Couldn't have been in a more convenient location
text: We really enjoyed our stay at Radio City Apts, brilliant location and our room was cosy and spacious. We were facing the street so it can get loud in the mornings but we brought ear plugs so it was no biggie. Would definitely recommend.

title: Great Stay!
text:
We arrived early to the Radio City Apartments, and Javier told us our apartment was not ready, which we completely understood.  He offered to store our luggage so that we could get on with our day, which we did.

When we got back after 3 PM,  we checked in and were given keys to an apartment.  When we arrived at the apartment, we realized it was a handicap-equipped apartment.  We immediately went back downstairs to request another apartment.  Javier was wonderful.  He did not have another apartment with a king bed, but he did have one with two queen beds, which was fine with us.  

We were impressed when we stepped into the apartment.  The living room had a double sofa bed, two end tables, side chair, round tall cube, round table, and 4 chairs.  There is only one closet in the apartment, which is in the living room (without a door).  The kitchen is compact and in the living room.  There was an apartment-size refrigerator, microwave, toaster (in the cabinet), 4-burner gas stove, oven, and sink.  There were enough plates, cups, bowls, cutlery, etc. for four people.  We had two minor issues – one was a wobbly dining table and the other was a clogged toilet.  Within minutes of us calling the front desk, Alex from maintenance was knocking on our door and fixed us right up.  Now, that is real service!  There is construction going on around the building, so you do hear some noise.  It was not a problem for us, as I had my sound machine with us.  The location is perfect to visit nearby sites as well the fact that there are two different subway stops (for different subway lines) close by.  We were very pleased with our stay and would definitely come back again.

title: Volveré, Volveré, Volveré.....Inmejorable situación para visitar Manhattan.
text:
Hotel con años, pero todo muy correcto y necesario para poder pasar una estancia en familia muy agradable.  Situación simplemente excepcional (metro, restaurantes, supermercado....times square) en pocos minutos caminando.
La habitación mas que sobrada para una comoda estancia para 4 personas.  Cocina bien equipada con fogones, horno y microondas, además de cuberteria para 4 comensales.
Existe una zona para poder lavar la ropa (limitado desde las 8 pm hasta bien entrada la madrugada) cosa que se agradece para estancias de mas de una semana. 
Respecto a la limpieza hay que decir que es muy buena  y cada hay reposición de toallas muy muy suaves y confortables.
Un pequeño defecto podria ser el aislamiento del ruido....pero NY es ruidosa, muy ruidosa.  Aun con el ruido después de días agotadores se dormia igualmente.
Personal atento y siempre colaborativo con cualquier pregunta o duda que pueda surgir.
En resumen si volvemos repetimos con toda seguridad.
Gracias @RadioCityAparments por proporcionarnos una magnifica estancia.

title: El mejor lugar para hospedarse en familia!
text:
Estuvimos en la primer semana de febrero con mi familia y realmente el Radio City Apartments superó las expectativas.
La relación precio - calidad es excelente. Está ubicado en un lugar inmejorable, acceso al metro en la esquina del hotel, a 2 cuadras de Times Square y a pocas más de todos los musicales de Broadway, cerca de todo, de hecho recorrimos todo caminando, sólo usamos el metro para llegar al Soho y a Brooklyn.
Eramos 4 hospedados en el departamento de un dormitorio y estuvimos super cómodos! Es amplio, con todas las comodidades para desayunar y cenar alli, está limpio y muy bien calefaccionado. El servicio del personal de limpieza y recepción es perfecto, siempre muy amables y dispuestos para lo que se pueda necesitar.
Sólo nos genera dudas cómo será la climatización en verano, ya que no vimos que hubiera aires acondicionados o salidas de sistema central.
Lo adoptamos como nuestro lugar para parar en NY y recomendar!

title: Great price great location.
text: We had a two bedroom suite. The kitchen was well equipped and clean. The location is near great restaurants and easy walk to theaters. Good location to go shopping on 5th Avenue and easy walk to Central Park.

title: First time up the Radio City tower Liverpool
text: Went on recommendation there are great views from the Tower looking all round and fully explained. Great experience. View over Mersey very good and Anfield of course .Not expensive. Nice to see Liverpool from above....Good to see the Radio studio as well.

title: Realmente recomendable
text: Estuve en el mes de febrero. A pesar del frio, los departamentos estaban muy bien acondicionados. El lugar tiene toda la comodidad necesaria para pasar unos días en esa gran ciudad. Contas con refrigerador, microondas, vajillas, muy luminosos, con muy buena ubicación, y lo mejor, su personal. Destaco la permanente asistencia brindada por el Sr. Jaime. Nos hizo sentir muy cómodos.

title: Recomendable, para un viaje fugaz
text: Un poco vieja las instalaciones pa cafetera estaba realmente sucia y algunas partes de la habitación pero en relación cion calidad precio esta pasable por su ubicación es recomendable si quieren ahorrar un poco en estadia

title: Radio city apartments
text: Radio city apartments are lovely home away from home have got friends to book and they delighted with it as well so nice And clean very easy to find and plenty of good internet and no hidden charges. Love this place

title: In the heart of Manhattan
text: Such a well situated hotel - minutes walk to the iconic spots in each direction and so much within walking distance . Minutes from Broadway, Rockefeller Centre, Bryant Park, Time Square and the action of NY . Position will not disappoint. Rooms are tired but a decent size for the location - we had two double beds in bdrm and a sofa bed in lounge with triple aspect so size will not disappoint and you forgive the decor.  The shared areas are well maintained. The rooms were quiet and no sound of road noise or a city going to work. However what was not shared was that a new building was going up beside you - eye level to fifth floor at present and the noise at start up early in morning was unbelievably loud and unacceptable - no mention made at checkin or at booking and to me this should have been an essential . Check out was easy for us but I read the reviews and realized we had to make it downstairs before the lifts jammed up and people became hostile at the service they received at reception however there was one very frustrated young woman who was being quite rudely treated as I waited . There was often chaos happening and frustrated guests as we went in and out - so you need to be organized and aware of times as you check out or it will disappoint. The staff were the worst I have encountered ever at a reception desk. The staff that were great was the security man that always met you with a smile , the porter who was wonderful and the maintenance man who bought us a heater - so Thank-you . The main staff reception require lessons in good manners, good grace , customer service and humility . My complaint regarding someone opening our door with a key after midnight was met with disdain . When I rang to find out the outcome I was told he had sent up security and that someone had mistakenly opened door - after repeating my complaint that someone actually had a key and it was unacceptable they had access to our room he dealt with it by over speaking - he  was arrogant and fobbed me off - he finally asked what I wanted and I said to be reassured so he rudely offered to shift us - however it was 1.15 am and I felt this was more stressful . He said he would write it down in the book - two days later and no mention of apology - so if like me you are part of a group of women traveling and you want to feel you are safe then this property was a huge disappointment to me . However if you want it written in the book of safety you will not be disappointed.

title: Toujours bien cet endroit au fil du temps
text: Si près de tout! Accès facile. Courtoisie et gentillesse du personnel. Un événement inattendu, la ville a dû couper l’eau en raison de travaux urgents., on aurait dû nous fournir de l’esu embouteillée.

title: Nice place...
text:
Just checked out of here after an enjoyable 4 night stay in NYC.
We pre booked the hotel and had a one bedroom king bed apt on the 12 floor (there’s only 13).
Check in was smooth. No safe in our room although many have, but small safes available for at reception for valuables (not iPads etc).
Apt was quite large considering it was NYC. Very clean with spacious bedroom & large comfy bed, bathroom & lounge with dining area and a more than adequate kitchenette. Easily feed yourself if you wanted to (we didn’t). Air con in the bedroom only.
Close to Times Square and all expected attractions in that area.
Staff informative and courteous.
Would we stay there again. Yes BUT when the new skyscraper construction is finished directly behind it (probably 12 months to go). Awoken weekdays at 6.30am prompt ( quiet sat & sun) by construction noise.

title: Great location and cozy apartments
text: This was my second stay here. Love the location, the rooms are very comfortable. Appreciate they have tea kettles on the stove as well as a coffee maker. The only down side to the recent stay this month was the construction of a building right outside our room. At least they didn't start working until 7 a.m.

title: Excelente!
text: Buenísimo hotel. Iba con bajas expectativas pero todo fue súper bien! El hotel muy limpio y las habitaciones muy buenas. Se preocupan por mantener en buen estado todo y se agradece. De lo mejor qué hay en NYC!

title: Excelente
text:
Muy buena ubicación ante todo!!, a 2 cuadras del time square. 
Personal muy amable,  hablan español,  limpieza a diario,  departamento súper amplio (penth house B ).
Al lado de toda la movida de Manhattan,  bares, restaurantes,  atracciones!!.
Excelente opción. 
Baño, cocina completa , habitación amplia,  etc. 
Nos encantó!!

title: Really really great!
text: Perfect location to explore Manhattan spacious rooms with all facilities that you need and a great shower! Friendly staff and lots and lots of fresh towels. Steps away from 5th Avenue, 6th Avenue Broadway and Central Park.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Stayed in a queen studio just before Christmas. Great kitchenette, very friendly and attentive front desk and the location can’t be beat. Minutes to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Madison Square Garden and a short subway ride to 911 Memorial and Battery Park for Statue of Liberty Cruises. Amazing restaurants within walking distance. Would definitely recommend to friends and stay here again. Those who are saying the rooms are small...you know you are in the heart of Manhattan right? An amazing getaway!

title: 3.5 Starts No Way
text: I booked this room on Priceline and the room they gave me was incredibly small. Besides that, it was definitely old and run down. Bed was not comfortable either. This is a 2.5 star hotel at best. At the very least it was clean and in a good location but I would never stay there again. How this got a certificate of excellence is beyond me. I have stayed at dozens of hotels in New York and this is one of the worst considering the supposed star rating.

title: Disappointing
text: About midnight of 1st night, we smelled electric burn smell. Called front desk & they sent up maintenance man. He can't find source. He tells us to call back in 2 hours. We asked to move to another room. We move, no help with bags.New room at 2 AM. Terrible sleep. Move bags next morn to old room. Javier at desk is nasty to us. Says prob will be fixed. 2nd night, same smell + room spray. Ask to move.  We move, no help with bags. No apology. Bad attitude. No help with bags. No comps. We were always polite & not demanding. We were worried this could be something dangerous for everyone at the hotel.  Management didn't seem to really care.

title: Nice hotel
text: While this is not a 5 star hotel it gets a 5 star rating. Our room was clean and nice. Front desk people nice. They tag and store your luggage for you before or after your stay. Discounted parking is available at the Rockefeller parking garage around the corner. Centrally located near Rock Center and Radio City Music Hall. Can’t wait to stay again! By the way the pizza next door is awesome.

title: Reasonable price, great location!!
text: We were in NYC for a couple days for fun.  Our room was small but perfect for our staying. The hotel was simple and classic design. Very clean and comfortable after long walks in the city. There was a small kitchen with some utilities for our breakfast  and dinner at the room, or if you would prefer there was an Italian restaurant downstairs.  Great location... easy access to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park.  Reasonable price!!  Staff was very friendly and helpful.

title: New York
text: Stayed at radio city apartments in November location was excellent rooms were spacious has a small kitchen but didn't cook to busy shopping lol was lovely and clean 3 minute walk to times square & 5 minute walk to Rockefeller centre subway right beside them it's nice to have a little more space than a hotel room as most hotel rooms are quite small in New York was my 3rd time there have stayed in hotels the past times but will definitely book here again

title: Good place to stay in NYC
text: We really enjoyed staying at Radio City Apartments. It couldn’t be a better location in NYC… one block from Rockefeller Center/5th Avenue, only three blocks from Times Square, theaters at Broadway and good restaurants. The staff were all very nice and courteous. No problem in doing an early check-in or keeping our luggage after the check-out. Very reasonable rates. I’m  already recommending it to family, friends and everyone who want a good place to stay in NYC.

title: Emplacement parfait et service impeccable
text:
Appartement vieillot mais très propre. Localisation parfaite, à côté de Time Square. Nous étions 2 adultes et 3 enfants dans un appartement d’une chambre au 7e étage. Deux lits doubles et un divan-lit avec tout le nécessaire.
Travaux juste à côté donc très bruyant de 7h le matin à 18h le soir. Mais pour notre part ça ne nous a pas dérangé puisque notre but était de visiter et non de dormir le matin ;)
Je recommande sans hésitation !

title: Best hotel 01/03/20
text: Stayed at one of the best hotel with some the best friendly and helpful staff I seen .....see Carlos O. He is very helpful very friendly and very Respectful I wouldn’t stay anywhere else room are clean great view next to time square

title: Below average in every aspect except location
text:
I am very disappointed in my stay here. The service was very poor and the people were rude. My friend and I stayed here the week before christmas. It was cold outside and the room was freezing as well. There was no thermostat in the room and upon calling, we were told there was nothing they could do about it. The room was unbearably cold. There was a kitchenette in the room, but the stove and oven were not functioning, and we had to turn on the refrigerator ourselves. 
It was incredibly noisy, but I understand due to the location. Which I may say is amazing. Very close to many attractions and a subway station. The location is the only thing that made this hotel a decent place to stay. 
Everything was very outdated and seemingly dirty. However, the service was horrific. We were barely acknowledged during our stay here. When we contacted about the heating issue we were basically dismissed. The service and lack of heating inevitably led myself and my friend to check out early and relocate. 
Following our stay, I had realized I had left two items in our room. Upon calling, I told them exactly what I left and where I remember leaving them. I was told they did not find anything and they could do nothing more. They did not offer to double check or look in the location where I told them my items were. I am very disappointed I will never get my items back. I do realize I should've double checked myself before leaving, but the hotel should have at least offered to look again. 
Lastly, upon checking in to the hotel, they take a $250 deposit in case of broken items, smoking in the room, etc. as many hotels do. I was told when I checked in that the deposit would be reimbursed among checking out. That was not the case. About 5 days after checking out, I had still not received my deposit back. I called the hotel and they told me some banks take a week to refund the account. Which is understandable. Today, it has been over TWO WEEKS since I have checked out, and I still have NOT received my money back. 
Overall, I would recommend that anyone should find another place to stay while visiting New York City. I strongly advise against staying at Radio City Apartments.

title: Noisy Front Rooms
text: Do not book a room in the front of the building as the staff said there was absolutely nothing they could do to stop the street performers from making it impossible to sleep. The location is very nice. Good eateries are close.

title: Great Location.
text: Location is excellent, close to many icons as well as restaurants and shops. Stayed in deluxe studio. Room is clean and spacious, complete its amenities and kitchenware. Great place for staying with family.

title: Un excelente hotel
text: No tengo mas que agradecer todas las atenciones, súper ubicación y todo confortable, los servicios al máximo. El subway a metros. Times Square a la vuelta. Dos veces he estado aquí en el hotel y creo que habrá más.

title: Reminder
text:
The staffs of the hotel are excellent. Near at 
malls times square, rockefellers, restaurants, etc. Apartments down streets, pizzas, ichiran ramen -one of the best food in japan. Definitely  will return to your apartment.

title: BEST PLACE TO STAY IN NYC!
text: Great location! Courteous Staff! Clean Room, comfortable beds and great towels! Within blocks of Rockefeller Center, Times Square and 5th Avenue! Who could ask for more? This was our first visit to NYC and the staff was so helpful and polite!

title: Convenient and great value
text: I booked a room at Radio City Apts for my stay while attending a conference in the City. The location was perfect and a short walk to everything I needed. Great restaurants within a short walk for dinner.The accommodations were very clean and included everything I needed and nothing I didn't. I would be happy to stay there again.

title: Good budget hotel
text:
The hotel is right in between Rockefeller Centre and Times Square - ideal for our festive trip.

We had a studio apartment which was actually quite spacious and the bathroom was very nice.

We had a nice kitchenette which helped us stick to our budget (very difficult to do in NYC!)

Whilst the location is great for the price, the noise from the radiator and construction outside was pretty bad so we didn't get much sleep. The room was not cleaned every day and, whilst the staff were professional, they were not the friendliest.

Overall a positive experience. My family stayed in a different hotel and wished they'd stayed at Radio City too so that's a good sign!

title: Good with great location
text:
Great location and big rooms.
Loved having kitchenette with Kettle, Microwave and full fridge.
Bed comfy and was not disturbed by road or construction noise although I was above construction site.
Centrally heated but no room control. One day was sweating another a bit chilly.
Old style keys with deadbolt doors.
Tidy but old.
Housekeepers not great, missing room on occasions and turning up at 530pm on other days, although cleaning cart was outside my room from 8am.
Garbage Bags of laundry seemed to lay about the halls for most of day.
Most of staff on front desk helpful and friendly.
Good for price so might stay again for location and kitchenette.

title: Appartamento in hotel perfetto.
text:
Siamo stati per 7 notti in questo hotel centralissimo. Vicinissino alla metropolitana, a due passi da Times Square e dal Rockefeller Center.
Appartamento comodo e pulito, cambio biancheria giornaliera, personale disponibile e accogliente.
Da consigliare.

title: Pay for what you get
text:
Centrally located if you're seeing broadway shows or taking in the Christmas sights around Rockefeller Center. We found our room to be clean, but incredibly dreary. No light came in and the street noise was LOUD. The noise from the radiator in the bedroom was outrageous. If you're a light sleeper, forget your budget and stay somewhere else because you won't sleep a wink.

Helpful staff though!

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: Our two bedroom apartment was clean comfortable.  All the staff went out of there way to be helpful and accommodating .  The location of the apartments is centrally located between Time Square and Rockefeller Center.

title: Great location!
text: We had the 2 bedroom apartment. Had a pull out couch in the living room, double bed in the first bedroom and 2 double beds in the second bedroom. This was perfect for us and our two teenage boys. Location was perfect, very close to Times Square and Rockefeller Center.

title: Highly recommended
text:
Stayed at these apartments for a long weekend. Clean and welcoming. Right in the heart of things but quiet and comfortable. Would definitely recommend.
Desk is manned 24 hours and nothing is too much trouble for them.

title: Great Location
text: Stayed here for 4 nights end of Nov and we couldn't have been happier. We were a family of 3 adults ,so opted for a one bedroom apartment, which had one bedroom with two double beds and a lounge with a double sofa bed ,more than enough room ! It came with a compact kitchenette , complete with cooker fridge and microwave , there was a coffee maker with coffee and tea provided and replaced every day . The room was serviced every day and clean white,fluffy towels provided daily,we really couldn't fault it for the price we paid ,OK it's not 5 star , but as a base it amazing .The location you won't get better ,you turned left out of the main entrance and you were in Times Sq, you turned right and you were at Radio City and Rockerfeller Centre. This was our first time in New York and we  will definitely stay here on our next visit to this amazing City . I will be recommending this Hotel to my family and friends.

title: Enjoyed our visit!
text: A diamond in the rough. This place could be perfect with a little effort. Great location. Need to improve the bedding. The bedspreads must be 30 years old. Tired and ugly. Good kitchen and tv.  the staff is great!! So kind and helpful.

title: Smack in the Middle
text: The hotel was clean and seemed to be well maintain.  The room was extremely comfortable and the kitchenette was unexpected pleasure.  Large refrigerator, Microwave, plates, bowel, utensil, etc. The price is a little steep, but reasonable for the location; smack in the middle of NY.  Perfect if you have kids.  I think we’ve found our “Go To” spot when visiting NY! They have real keys for the rooms...not cards.  No issues, just a little old school...just thought it was worth mentioning! :-)

title: Our stay in New York
text: The location is perfect for us and the price is very good.  However, the housekeeping could improve especially in the bathroom. The shelf above the sink was never cleaned and toothpaste stains remained the entire time.  Also they could supply small tubes of body lotion and resupply shampoo and conditioner.

title: Loved It
text:
Recommended by a friend. We found a great place that is a short walking distance to the subway, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and places to eat. 
Bed was comfortable, nice hot water shower with soft towels and kitchen. All the staff we spoke with were very nice. If you called the desk for ‘anything’ they were quick to respond. 
I loved it here.

title: Good midtown location and price.
text:
Fairly recently updated.  These are hotel/apartments with a kitchenette which we found useful.  A good size refrigerator small stove and dishes incase  you want to make a quick meal before heading out.  

Location: on 49th between 6th and 7th.  A block and a half from Rockefeller Center and there is a subway entrance on the corner of 49th and 7th.  Close to MOMA, Times Square and only about 20 minutes by subway to the East Village. 10 minute walk to Bryant Park.

We were here in December.  The room is heated by a radiator but I didn't see A/C which might be something to consider in the Summer.

Friendly, helpful staff and there is a great Italian restaurant next door at the street level with an entrance to the Hotel.  Order food to go or they can deliver.

title: Best location !
text:
Recently stayed here for 4 nights whilst visiting New York and these are in the most perfect location ! 
Quick and easy check in and same when checking out. 
Room cleaned every day with fresh towels. 
Turn left out of apartments and your at Times Square in 2 mins, turn right of apartments and your at Radio City and Rockefeller centre in 2 mins. 
Defiantly recommend and I would definitely stay again when I return.

title: 立地最高
text: タイムズスクエアへもロックフェラーセンターへも徒歩3分ほど、複数の地下鉄駅が近くにあり、とにかく立地最高。繁華街に近いのに静かで、スタッフも愛想よく親切で印象は良かったです。キッチン付きで部屋でゆっくり食事もできたので良かったです。ニューヨークではまたここに泊まりたいです。

title: Fantastic stay
text: This is almost the archetypal mid priced Manhattan hotel. Its stylish, but small - tiny elevator and kind of squashed room - but with a great atmosphere and super helpful staff. I loved every minute of my stay there and will be returning when next in New York.

title: Fantastic location, great room, friendly service.
text:
We stayed at Radio City Apartments for 6 nights.  The location was fantastic, only a block from Radio City Music Hall and a couple of blocks from Times Square.  There was a subway station in the same block and plenty of food places around.  
We had a one bedroom apartment with 2 double beds.  The room was spacious and clean with all of the facilities you need.  You can use the hotel laundry after 8pm for free.  When we were there, a cleaner was still doing some hotel laundry but we were still able to use the machines and it was free - so who's complaining!!
The elevators are a bit slow, but that's not a big deal,  The hotel is centrally heated so the room was nice and warm, although sometimes at night the heater was a bit loud, but we used earplugs so it didn't bother us.  New York is noisy!
We would absolutely stay here again and highly recommend it.

title: My Number One Choice for NY Accomodation
text: Not surprisingly it is always difficult to find availability at Radio City Apartments but that is a reflection of what they deliver. I love the location and the kitchenette means that you don't have to eat out every night meaning more money in your pocket to enjoy everything NY has to offer. This was the second time I have stayed here and it will be my number one choice next time NY

title: Plaisant
text: Endroit idéal .central .tout près de Time Square et Rockefeller Center .Très bien entretenu .Épicerie difficile à trouver par contre mais bcp de Market qui sont plus dispendieux .Il faut réserver bien d’avance pour y demeurer

title: Solid value property, convenient to Theaters and travel around Manhattan
text: Great value property right in midtown convenient to theaters and subways around Manhattan. Clean studios up to family size apartments for short or long term. Good value Pasta Lovers restaurant adjacent with good service and food.

title: I ❤️ Radio City Apartments
text: Excellent location. The place is within walking distance to a lot of iconic places in NYC like Radio City Music Hall, The Rock, Times Square, Hell’s Kitchen, St. Patrick’s Cathedral and Broadway, just to name a few. The building is a bit dated but well maintained. A couple of staff at the reception desk need to be more welcoming but overall, staying in Radio City Apartments was a wonderful experience for a first timer in New York like me. Would definitely go back.

title: ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato per 2 notti in questo Hotel e il giudizio è più che positivo per i seguenti motivi:
- posizione centralissima sulla 49th street vicinissimo a Time Square, Broadway, 
  Rockefeller center e fermata della metro
- camere strutturate simil appartamento con angolo di cottura, stoviglie, microonde e 
  macchina per caffè americano
- personale disponibile e professionale
- ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo se confrontato con altri hotel in zona
- WiFi veloce dappertutto

Consigliato!

title: New York City hotel
text: What a great find!  The size of the apartment is amazing for the price. The kitchen had all the necessities. Beds were comfortable. Employees were nice and helpful. The location was perfect. I’ll definitely stay here again!

title: Location, Location, Location
text: We stayed on Veteran's Day weekend to see the Radio City Xmas Spectacular. The price for the 2 bedroom apartment was very reasonable by NYC standards. Apartment was spacious and clean and had what we needed. The location was amazing - so close to Radio City, Times Square, Grand Central, and subway stations. We ate at the Pasta restaurant attached to the hotel and it was also a decent meal. Our only complaints were there was no visible way for us to control our own heating/ cooling and the windows were not well insulated, meaning you could hear every street noise from the 8th floor.  There is also a very large construction site next door, and the noise from that began at 6:30 a.m.

title: Location is excellent.
text:
I stayed here with my family for 5 nights over the weekend of the New York marathon. 

Rooms
Our room was for 5 adults (2 doubles and 1 sofa bed) The rooms were of a good size and the beds were very comfortable. The sofa bed however was very disappointing. In the end 4 of us shared the 2 queen sized beds. The bathroom was clean with a good shower. The apartment on the whole was a bit basic and I think we would have struggled to cook a meal in the kitchen but it was good to have the fridge for leftovers and wine! They also have free wifi throughout the hotel. Of course there is some noise (and we were on the 12th floor) at night but you are in the city that never sleeps

Staff
The staff were very friendly and welcoming and helped us with any questions that we had and helped us book a taxi back to the airport. We also had fresh towels and a daily maid service. 

Location
The location is fantastic and it is worth booking here just for the location. You are steps away from Times Square, the subway, places to eat, top of the Rock. It is absolutely ideal. 

Would I stay again?
Yes. Basic but the location is great and we were barely in our room.

title: Second time to historic flats in the heart of Manhatten
text: In New York for the marathon. These flats are good value in an expensive city! Second visit for me and although the rooms are small they are ok if you are out most of the time! Some useful items like fridge microwave and utensils in the room.

title: El mejor alojamiento en New York
text: Sin duda totalmente recomendable , su ubicación para llegar a todos lados a pie , la comodidad de los apartamentos , excelente limpieza ,camas muy cómodas , supermercados bien cerca , muy buena pizzería al lado , restaurantes en la misma cuadra , y un punto a destacar es su personal , todos absolutamente todo el personal amable , siempre una sonrisa , siempre dispuestos a ayudar , hablan español , te reciben paquetes sin costo , guardan tu equipaje , q mas puedo decir , todo perfecto ,,,viajo a N. Y bastante seguido y por supuesto que volveré , nos hospedamos con mi hija en la habitación 306 , q da a un Patio interior así q todo silencioso y perfecto para el descanso

title: Great Location
text:
Stayed here for 2 nights after the NYC marathon 2019. 

Stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment. 
Room was spacious enough but could have been a lot cleaner. Especially the bathroom. 
Room did not come with an AC and we had to call for one to be installed. This was quite interesting for us as we never had to call and request for an AC (airconditioning unit) before. AC worked well after installation. 

Staff were relatively friendly although two front desk staff just watched us struggle up the stairs to the lobby with our luggage without offering any help (they were not busy). 

Location was spot on. Very central, we could walk to most places. If not, the subway and bus stops were just at your doorstep. 

We wouldn't mind staying here again=)

title: NYC Marathon 2019
text: This was our second stay at the Radio City Apartments and would definitely return and recommend. Close to everything midtown without being in all the commotion. The apartment provides you with everything you need to have a comfortable stay without "breaking the bank." Comfy beds and pillows. Love that your apt has a doorbell and that you get a real door key!

title: Fabulous location
text: Stayed in 1 Bedroom apartment for 4 nights. Excellent location, very central could walk anywhere and subway station at end of street. Apartment was a great size for 3 adults with plenty of shopping. Very clean with daily maid service , & fresh towels daily. Reception very helpful in booking car to airport at very reasonable cost. Very efficient service.

title: What a great location
text: Great Character, helpful staff, and central to so much.... an easy walk to Central Park, MoMA, Top of the Rock, Times Square. Subway on the block ... 1 train to almost anywhere. Room is spacious, room for the kids to play without being underfoot, Kitchen,  Laundry downstairs, and a grocery store a block away.... we will be back !

title: Perfect place to Live for a week in the Big Apple!
text: Super close to everything we did. 49th street wasnt near as busy as some other streets with hotels. Loved being able to have a meal and bring leftovers 'home ' before heading out somewhere else. Also great to have a stove and fridge and was able to heat up some food as well. Beds were comfy enough and even though it was a small room, it was pretty good. Had a corner suite so we had 2 windows. Staff were great. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Love the location..  can walk anywhere, get food anytime, location is great.  Staff is extremely friendly and responsive..  hotel is dated..  walls paper thin, street noise very loud prob windows and insulation very weak..  and elevators very slow, and since no service elevator housekeeping and maintenance also use guest elevators.  but.. can't beat the location.

title: Bien
text:
Établissement bien situé à 2 pas de Time Square
Nous étions  au sixième étage, un peu bruyant très tôt le matin car un bulding en construction à proximité 
rapport qualité prix correct
Sympa d avoir une mini cuisine dans notre appart pour profiter d un peu de répit ( thé, café...) entre 2 sorties

title: Great location.....
text:
Radio City Apartments were very clean , and spacious for the 4 of us. Staff were friendly and the location couldn’t be any better. Highly recommend.
Everything that was needed is provided in apartment.

title: Comfortable, Spacious and SO close to Times Square
text:
Brilliant if you’re travelling with a family. The suite has a lounge, dining and kitchen area. A full-sized fridge and microwave make the jet lag hunger pangs easier. Comes with crockery, cutlery. I love the thought that went into making sure you had all you could need if you were home. 

Spotlessly clean. Two double beds, perfect for kids. A stroll into Times Square. Check-in is very efficient. Space to move around in the apartment. Loved our stay here.

title: Excelente ubicación y calidad de atención
text: Lugar super accesible, limpio, lo mejor la gente que trabaja en el lugar que hace muy agradable tu estadía. Si tenes problema con el idioma, hablan todo español. Nosotros estuvimos en un departamento en el piso 11 cómodo para 4-5 personas

title: Great location
text:
This apartment suited our needs very well. It's old and dated, as others have pointed out but the housekeeping is very efficient and our room was thoroughly cleaned every day. Having the kitchenette was useful - we ate breakfast in our room every morning, saving money and time. All the staff we had dealings with were helpful. It's just far enough away from Time's Square to be slightly less manic but still convenient for several subway stations.
The air con was noisy but we asked them to open a window instead which we kept open throughout our stay. The traffic noise was there of course but it didn't affect our sleep, we were tired after busy days sightseeing.
We would stay there again.

title: meh
text: Xavier on the front desk was a bit prickly and the building was fairly old. Don't be in a hurry when you want to use the elevators.   They are very slow and tiny.   It was an okay hotel but probably would not stay here again.  Ate at the pasta place downstairs and the waitress was high on coke.  Was very uncomfortable as she was moving around like a bat out of hell.  Was weird.

title: Great place
text: Definitely the most friendly and accommodating staff I’ve ever experienced in NYC! The rooms were huge and comfortable. I booked our next stay the day we left. Can’t wait to go back to this beautiful hotel with my family for the holidays.

title: Hotel bem localizado e agradável
text: O hotel é muito bem localizado, perto de várias atrações turísticas e diferentes estações de metrô. O apartamento é espaçoso e agradável. A cozinha permite a preparação de refeições. É uma ótima opção para se hospedar com a família e amigos, e se sentir em casa em Nova York.

title: A gem, and will stay here on my next visit to NYC
text: Our 8 night stay didn't start too well as the room was so noisy with single glazing and the aircon unit in the window which meant we heard every single sound from outside.  I'm not naive and have been to New York many times and know how noisy it is but I slept so badly....  Carlos on the front desk came to the rescue, finding us a really lovely quiet room (tip, 308!) which saved the day.  This accommodation could not be better placed, between Times Square and 5th Avenue with many subway stations to choose from.  There are lots of restaurants around but we chose to eat in the apartment most nights and found some great delis for take out.  Having a kitchenette in the room is a huge bonus as we could store drinks/salad etc.  When we reluctantly had to leave for JFK the front desk booked us a superb car, really roomy with sweets/water and the most wonderful driver.  Thanks for a great stay and hope to see you again!

title: Top notch!
text: Hotel was absolutely fabulous!  The location is wonderful.  You are within a block or two of Times Square.  Subway super accessible from here.  So many restaurants right out the door.  Five ladies stayed in the two bedroom suite.  The room was great.  Beds were comfortable.  Room was spacious even with 5 of us.  The front desk went above and beyond with any questions or requests that we had.  Only issue we had was at arrival, Liam the bellman, was not too enthused to help us out.  Other than that, our stay was wonderful and we would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone who will be visiting NYC!

title: Great stay at Radio City Apartments NYC.
text:
We stayed at Radio City Apartments NYC from Sept 4 for 5 nights , the room we stayed in was a one bedroom with a kitchenette . This was suitable for a family of 4 ( 2 adults and 2 children 9 12 & 10) , we purchased groceries from the food emporium on the corner of 49th and 8th street and was a fantastic shop to purchase all your needs. 
We were close enough to Times Square but far enough away not to hear the noise or see the lights and was also close enough to the Rockefeller Center and Radio City and the subway . The room met all our needs , however the beds are smaller and two large adults may find it slightly uncomfortable to sleep in the same bed, however there is a sofa bed which I utilized and had comfortable sleep. Overall a good stay

title: A+ Location!!!!!1!!!!!
text: This is the perfect location.  It is close to good restaurants, Times Square, and lots of interesting sites.  The rooms were clean, spacious, and well equipped.  The hotel staff was friendly and very professional.  The lobby had adequate seating plus several daily newspapers. We also ate at the attached restaurant. The service was prompt and the meal was delicious.  We will certainly plan to stay here on our next visit to New York City.

title: Hidden Gem- Fav hotel in Manhattan hands down
text: Fantastic location.. room was huge, super clean..cant find a single thing to complain about. ive stayed here at least 10 times and I recommend this place to anyone who ask for NY Hotel recommendations

title: Tired but welcoming
text:
Was once an apartment complex turned into hotel. You can see from the lobby that it was quite the building in its day.
We had a a two room apt, one with two queen beds, the other was the living room with a stove refrigerator, sofa be and tv , nice size
The furniture is a bit won, The apt was very clean.
There was one small bathroom but the shower was awesome.
This accommodation worked well for three older woman who were celebrating our annual friendcation

title: family trip
text: we had a fabulous 4 night stay here. the hotel is right by times square but surprisingly quiet. we had a one bedroom apartment on the 4th floor. room was perfect for the 4 of us. kitchenette was a godsend at 3am for coffee and toast due to jet lag. beds were very comfy. bathroom was good, a little on the small side but i didnt go to nyc to sit in the bathroom, no ventilation as the window didnt open but not a problem. we didnt hear any noise from other guests, no door banging, no chatting, nothing. there was a construction site outside the window but luckily they were not working the time we were there. the aircon was amazing as it was really warm when we were there. lovely pizza shop next door that sold slices of pizza.the staff are all friendly enough although we only saw the door staff on our trip. you can store your bags on departure day for free and they will organise a car for your return to the airport, slightly cheaper than a yellow cab for the 4 of us. all in all a fabulous stay. i would definately stay here again, its right between 6th ave and times square

title: An amazing place to stay centrally located. Clean and very helpful staff!!
text: Amazing place to stay - clean, centrally located and friendly helpful staff. Answered all questions and brought whatever extras we needed - pillows, toaster. Nice kitchenette and bathroom. Always cleaning lobby and steps. Daily fresh towels and toiletries.  Highly recommend!!

title: A bit small
text: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in September in a studio room. We found the room to be very very small, ok if you are only staying 1 or 2 nights but any more than that and I would recommend upgrading to a 1 or 2 bedroom suite. Apart from that we found the location great, housekeeping were very good and the staff very friendly.

title: Relaxed room in perfect location.
text:
As a family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers one boy one girl we needed a place with 4 beds at a sensible price. 
After months of searching we came across this place and it ticked all of our boxes. 
Compared to most NYC prices it was very competitively priced.

We arrived on a Sunday afternoon and greeted by friendly staff then taken to our 11th floor room. 

The room was cosy perfect amount of storage space and cute little kitchen and diner with everything we needed. 

We found a supermarket and got our food for the week as we knew we didn’t have the money to eat out all the time as a family of 4.

The location here is fantastic, walking distance to Times Square, Broadway shows, Marcus, Rocerfella centre, Central Park. We used the subway to get to the Wall St area which was simple and only $3 each.

We found the staff here lovely and would definitely come back. 

We loved NYC and found really useful tips from. You tuber called Sarah Funk. I feel that we saved a lot of money using her advice. 

One of the best weeks of all of our lives ❤️

title: Comfortable, Convenient, some improvement needed
text: We travelled to New York 18th-22nd September 2019. On arrival the staff were very friendly and attentive and kept our bags until we could check in. Convenient location! Apartment is a little outdated and some improvement needed on the windows due to the noise! Other than that the beds are very comfortable the apartments are a decent size and the shower is amazing! Perfect for what we needed apart from the noise coming from outside

title: Location and comfortable
text: Great location right near time square. Being from Australia it was a little hard to navigate the streets and parking for this property is off-site and around a corner behind us which meant we had to drive a couple of blocks back. Maybe a little more detail on website regarding parking and an address would be helpful so people don't have to backtrack but other than that rooms are neat and tidy and suit the style and age of the building. Bed while soft provided comfort and a restful sleep.

title: Beyond our expectations!
text: The 6 of us girlfriends were in NYC for 3 nights to celebrate a milestone birthday, and we stayed in 2 1-bedroom apartments, which were perfect for our needs. They were spacious, immaculate, and well-equipped, with comfortable beds, a great shower, and plush towels. All this close to the theater district, Rockefeller Center, the subway, restaurants, and a grocery store. And the front desk crew could not have been more helpful. We will be back!

title: Great value, great location
text: We booked 2 rooms, each with 2 double beds. Both rooms were spacious, clean and quiet, with good amenities - toiletries, hairdryer, lots of towels. Comfortable beds. Very nice Art Deco look to the building (built in 1906) and rooms. Staff were helpful and the location is unbeatable - 5 minutes walk to Times Square in one direction and Rockefeller Center in the other direction. Didn't really use the kitchenette except for the fridge which was good for milk, juice etc for breakfast. Definitely recommended.

title: New York New York
text:
close to everything we wanted to see, within walking distance of our venue for the stage show "Chicago".managed to walk to Central Park, do a bit of a tour and walk back again.
friendly staff, close to many varied eateries.

title: Awfull experience in our vacation in NYc!
text:
Horrible hotel ! Noise the hole first nigth, due to a tube next to the window’s room . 
In the next day we left air conditionig  ON, and when we came back a terrible kitchen oil smell spread in the room! Contaminating all of our cloth with its smell! 
No room available for exchange! I deeply recommend not to come this hotel , that sells room such as this! 
In the foto is a chamine of a kitchen that is noisy and contaminate rooms with fried oil!

title: Good amenities for a stay with kids
text: Compact room (twin studio)- but proper sized bathroom and the kitchenette was well stocked that really made for a more comfy and value for money stay with a 12 year old as we could bring in take out meals and have lots of cold drinks.  Housekeeping was good- room was very clean.  A little noisy as had room facing the street- but not unbearable.  Location between two central subways was perfect given how much walking we did!  Front desk staff were polite and efficient.  We both appreciated the good wifi. Not cheap - but location, wifi, fridge etc made it worth it for a family stay.

title: Location Location
text: The older style and compact room was more than compensated for by the hotel being close to transport hubs, theatres and Times Square vicininity. Excellent Italian food available in restaurant that can be accessed direct from the hotel - a saviour when under time pressure.

title: Nice little appartments in the middle of Manhattan !!
text:
Location is perfect : between Time Square and Central Park.
I got one of the penthouse on the 13th floor and wasn't disappointed.  A balcony, even small, is a rarity in a city wgere opening a window is a luxary...
The room is confortable, bathroom and kitchen are all good.
It is a little noisy due to the adjacent buildings air conditionning machinery even if the hotel in itself is very quiet.

title: Emplacement idéal mais bruyant
text:
Nous sommes restés 3 nuits (donc un samedi soir). L'emplacement de l'hotel est idéal : près de times square. Accessibles à pied : rock feller center, central park
bouche de métro au bout de la rue.
L'appartement était assez grand pour 5 (Appartement 1 chambre, 2 lits dans la chambre). Salle de bains petite mais fonctionnelle donc rien à redire.
Chambre propre, kitchenette bien équipée ce qui permet de ne pas manger tjs au resto.
Le seul défaut : le bruit. Incessant de la rue, et sur l'arrière de la climatisation. donc sensibles au bruit, s'abstenir

title: Ottimo
text: Abbiamo soggiornato una settimana in questo appartamento. La posizione è perfetta, per noi comodissima, in quanto abbiamo girato la città a piedi, la metro comunque si trova a 5 minuti da qui. Negli appartamenti si trovano le posate, piatti, bicchieri, tostapane, fornetto, gli asciugamani li cambiano tutti i giorni e vengono a rifare la stanza quotidianamente, più che un appartamento sembra un hotel, ha tutti i confort e costa meno. Perfetto per le famiglie!

title: Non potevamo sperare di meglio
text:
Otto giorni a New York in posizione centralissima, a due passi da Times Square. 
Il Radio City Apartments offre una soluzione ideale anche per chi non ha sempre voglia di mangiare fuori. Angolo cottura con tutto ciò che serve: stoviglie, fornelli, micronde, bollitore e macchina per il caffè americano (comprese le cialde), frigorifero con freezer. Subway a 2 minuti.
Il personale dell'hotel è molto professionale e disponibile. Il nostro soggiorno è stato perfetto. Lo consiglio vivamente e qualora dovessimo tornare a NY sceglieremmo ancora questa struttura,

title: Excelente ubicación pero aspectos a mejorar
text:
Positivo:
- Localización excelente 
- Muy buen trato por parte del personal del hotel

Negativo:
- El apartamento no se correspondió con las fotos mostradas en booking
- El somier del sofá-cama se hundia medio metro... Acabamos sacando el colchón y durmiendo en el suelo

title: Inexpensive and wonderful service!
text: They upgraded me to a pent house for free! Beautiful place, super welcoming reception and amazing service. One of the best experiences I've had at a hotel in the New York City. Would highly recommend!

title: Great apartment and stay
text:
I was a little apprehensive after reading some reviews but that was unfounded. Check in slick, lifts were working fine the whole trip and room was great. No construction noise at all, just NYC noise. Kept very clean, loads of towels, huge fridge freezer and very comfy beds and pillows. The plumbing isn’t great, our loo blocked 3 times but they were very prompt in fixing it.
We stayed for 6 nights and ate 3 times in the Italian below the restaurant - great food and happy hour. New York is very expensive for a family of four so we had breakfast in the room, made sandwiches and ate out at night. Very central to everything and I would definitely stay here again if and when we go back to NYC.
Only slight negative is I booked a deluxe 2 x double beds room for my mum and sister and there was no table and chairs in the room as shown in the pictures. This meant they had to sit on the bed to eat etc. Our 2x Queen 1 bedroom was great for our family. If you will be eating in the room I’m not sure I would book the deluxe 2x double here. 
Great for families.

title: A fantastic find!
text:
We discovered this on the internet and it is amazing!
The room was extremely well equipped with double bed, en suite bath/shower, fridge/freezer, microwave oven, 4-ring gas cooker and oven, cooking utensils, plates, cups, saucers, etc., a coffee maker and a table with 2 chairs, wardrobe, tv and air conditioning! Teabags and coffee included daily.
The location is very convenient to central NYC sights.
Friendly, helpful staff as well.
All at a great price!
Would really recommend this place.

title: Tourists exploring NYC
text:
This has being a very good find. The apartments are very well equipped for a short stay in the center of New York. It is very Central for the tourist activities of the day and the theatre fot the evening performance. 
The staff are very friendly and happy to help.

title: Comfortable and friendly
text: This is a place to stay if you really want to get to know Manhattan. A few meters from Times Square, very close to Broadway... gives you the chance to live simultaneously calm in the middle of the most noisy square in the world. Staff pleasant and kind. The room was exactly what we needed. Small, comfortable, hot as much as we wanted when outside was snowing.. A small problem with noises from other rooms but not to be mentioned. I definitely recommend especially with trips with friends or couples !

title: Great Place
text: Outstanding in every way:  location, cleanliness,  friendly staff, very accommodating, family friendly. Very close to Radio City Music Hall and all the Rockefeller Center Comples,  Times Square about  two blocks away.   Price surprisingly low.  But don't tell anybody.  Let it be our secret!!!!

title: Great location
text: We loved our stay here! Perfect location. One block from Times Square, about 2 blocks from everywhere! Our room had a kitchenette. We were able to get Big Bus tickets at a reduced rate from the desk. Close to Broadway and the theater district. It's the only place we will stay in New York from now on

title: Good location/ good price & servicej
text:
Awesome place to stay. Very friendly staff. Great location .  Walking distance to a lot of great sites Enjoyed our stay. 
Would definitely stay there again.the front desk staff really went above & beyond

title: Excellent location.
text: Great location, good price, everything was clean. Good Wi-Fi speed. Feels like you are sleeping in Times Square and at the Rockefellers at the same time. Kitchenette help us save money on breakfast. This was our second time staying here.

title: Hôtel pratique
text:
Emplacement génial a 2 pas de time square et le personnel et vraiment très serviable  . Prix assez élevé mais logique au vu de l emplacement  je conseille cette hôtel . 
Goûter les pizzas qui sont juste à côté  une merveille

title: Great location and helpful staff
text: Location is very useful to access most places in the City. The staff was very kind and helpful. The room was cleaned daily with care. We very much appreciated the possibility to use a gym close to the hotel.

title: I've been wanting to stay here for years but it's always booked up.
text: I finally booked it far enough ahead of time and got about the last king-size bedroom they had. We had our own apartment! It was old, but fantastic. I wish it wasn't so costly because I'd book it for a month! We had a bedroom, dining room/living room, kitchen and large bathroom. Lots of towels, dishes, everything you needed was there.

title: 最高の場所
text: タイムズスクエアからすぐのところにある割にはリーズナブルな価格です。キッチンがついているので簡単な調理ができます。以前はセントラルパーク近くのホテルに滞在していましたが、これからはここに決めました。

title: Posizione strepitosa a New York. Consigliato!
text:
Struttura datata ma pulita in una posizione centralissima a Manhattan, sulla 49th west, vicino a Times Square e Broadway.
Noi abbiamo Alloggiato in un appartamento accogliente, con doccia a muro e servizio pulizia giornaliero con cambio asciugamani.
Personale gentile e disponibile e ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo.
Ci tornerei.

title: Ottimo compromesso!
text:
Al mio primo viaggio a NYC ho organizzato tutto da sola e dopo aver scannerizzato le recensioni in base al mio budget e itinerario, ho scelto questa struttura e non me ne pento! La struttura è centralissima, ad un passo da Time Sq, ad un passo dalla metro, ad un passo da tantissime attrazioni...ok è un pò datata, ma tenuta benissimo ed il personale è molto cortese e disponibile. 
Quindi ottimo compromesso!!!

title: Apartment was sufficient but not outstanding
text:
Apartment was clean and suitable for our purposes. However our travel agent had asked if there were laundry facilities and the apart-hotel had said to them (and then it was passed onto us) that yes there were facilities. However, when we turned up it transpired that these facilities were only in the basement and we couldn't use them throughout the day and only after 9.00pm and only if the staff weren't using them. This was a disaster for us because we were travelling over the course of three weeks and needed one of the middle locations (of which New York was one) to have laundry facilities.
So we had to hand wash everything - and even finding a shop with a small bottle of tide washing liquid was a bit of a challenge in downtown Manhatten and it was even more of a challenge trying to get everything dry in time for our next location.

Also I'd warn you that the kitchen is VERY basic so you couldn't really cook a full meal there. AND though they knew there was 5 of us they only had 4 dining chairs.

title: I love this place
text: Close to everything.. minutes from the Today Show.  .Friendly great staff and reasonable priced. My family and I  rented a 2 Bedroom and I was able to save a little by cooking.  We did spoil ourselves by eating at the  restaurant in the hotel is good eats.

title: Tourist trip
text: Good location for a reasonable price.  Was nice to have kitchenette to please ourselves. Accommodation was very central, just a few minutes walk from Times Square. Accommodation was a bit dated and as there was no heating in the bathroom so it was freezing and there was ice on the inside of the bathroom window. There was building work next to hotel but did not find this to disturbing as we where up and out sight seeing each day. Hotels winning points where its location and price.

title: Un super Séjour
text:
Nous sommes restés 10 jours complets avec la suite cuisine et 2 chambres séparées : 1 chambre parents avec TV grand lit super matelas et suffisant de place pour ranger les vêtements + 1 chambre avec 2 lits taille moyenne TV et idem suffisamment de place pour les vêtements de 2 ados. Les WC sont dans la SDB mais cela ne dérange pas car un point d'eau et aménagé dans le couloir à la sortie d'une chambre. Étage 12. Le personnel de la réception ou du ménage est adorable. Tous prennent le temps de vous expliquer même quand on parle pas bien Anglais.
Nous recommandons réellement et si nous devons revenir nous séjournerons de nouveau dans cet hôtel. Emplacement idéal à 5min de Time Square et métro. Effectivement c'est bruyant mais toutes les rues le sont cela n'a rien à voir avec l'hôtel. C'est justement le charme de NY le bruit et les odeurs. Nous sommes sous le charme merci beaucoup aux membres de l'hôtel d'avoir participé à notre rêve Américain 👍👌

title: Best location, kind people
text: Have stayed here twice due to location and quality of stay.  Every employee is helpful and friendly.  Rooms are clean and kept in good condition.   Have had a 1 bedroom with 2 queen beds and a 1 bed suite.  Both had a central table and efficient kitchenette.

title: Great Location & Nice Place to Stay That is Affordable
text: Stayed here with my 16 year old along with my college roommate and her 16 year old.  It was a great location, close to subways, Time Square, Ellen’s Stardust and much more.  Staff was great, and when we had heavy rain they had umbrellas for us. It was comfortable, and we had room in fridge for leftovers & able to freeze water bottles for the hot days.  Loved the kitchenette - had everything we needed.  Got extra pillows from front desk brought to my room very quickly. We were there early, and they got us checked in as soon as they could - they have a locked room to hold the luggage until we got back and could check in

title: Safe, Clean, Affordable
text: Stayed here with my sixteen year old granddaughter for four nights as we explored NYC. Great location just one block from Times Square with easy access to Hop-on Hop-off tours, subway, and other transportation options. Room was clean and comfortable, with a full kitchenette for those who want to prepare meals. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

title: 45th Wedding Anniversary Trip
text: I was happy to return to Radio City Apartments with my husband in July.  I had stayed there many times before and love the hotel and the location.  It did not disappoint on this trip with my husband.  The staff, rooms and cleanliness of the hotel are great.  I would highly recommend this hotel and have recommended to many friends. Looking forward to returning in December.

title: PERFECT LOCATION , IDEAL FOR FAMILIES WITH TEENS
text:
I booked a 1 bed apartment for me , my partner and 2 teen boys here through booking.com after reading the reviews on this site!  This was perfect space for us to spend 5 nights in NYC!  Location 2 mins walk and your'e in the middle of times sq.  The sofa bed in the Living area was comfortable for my 6ft 2 15yr old.  My 17 yr old had one of the double beds in the bedroom and myself and partner were in the other.  The bedroom was a decent size with TV, Air con , hanging rail, iron /ironing board, dressing table with large drawers,   bedding clean, beds comfy!  small kitchen area which was enough for us to make cereal/tea coffee etc.  Decent fridge/freezer.  Bathroom was ample with the  best thick white soft towels, plenty of them, fab shower over the bath and complimentary toiletries!!   I would stay here again!  Reception staff very helpful & courteous, 

Only down side is the decor is a bit drab & dated - but this wouldn't stop us using this as our base again in NYC!  The apartment is so clean and was cleaned everyday.  If you can see past the dull decor in the room you wont be disappointed!

title: Chambre vieillottes, emplacement idéal
text:
Au vu des prix pratiqués, il est évident que l'on paye l'emplacement plus que le confort.. Ce dernier est assez limité, de part la taille des chambres, les équipements dont elles disposent et les SdB d'un "autre âge." 
L'hôtel n'en est pas moins agréable et l'équipe de réception fort serviable.
Pas le premier choux dans ce quartier, mais une option à considérer.

title: Fantastic location
text: These apartments are perfect for a short break. They are clean, well equipped and very comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We had a studio for two that was roomy enough for us and provided a great base for our 4 night break. The pizza place next door is fab. The kitchen has enough basic equipment to cater for yourself should you wish to. Front desk staff were really obliging 're storing luggage and getting a cab to JFK when we were going home.

title: Warning: they do not honor cancellation policy
text: This hotel pre-charges you $250 deposit, and do not honor their cancellation policy. Avoid at all costs if you don't wish to be charged for nights you do not use. The hotel is not helpful in resolving issues, is intransigent and avoids all responsibility.

title: Free use of washers & dryers in the basement was a bonus
text: Radio City Apartments are close to theatres and Times Square and great value. Some rooms are better than others. Ours was a bit dark and had our double bed in one corner, with room for only one bedside table and reading light, no room safe and no hot water in the afternoons. However, there was a safety deposit box available at Reception from the helpful staff and the free use (from 9pm till 8am) of washers & dryers in the basement was a bonus.

title: Small and clean
text:
Great location - New York is noisy but the higher floors were quieter.
Small rooms but great to have a small kitchen.
Immaculately clean.
Old property showing it's age a bit but the price reflects this.
The staff, when engaged, were very helpful and pleasant - just not 'overly' friendly and rarely looked up to say hello as we entered the hotel.
Bed was a bit bouncy for our liking but this seems to be  US problem!
We only had one bedside table - this was a pain - however some of the rooms are better than others so do ask...

title: Excellent Stay
text: We enjoyed our stay at Radio City Apartments.  The building had a lot of personality and it was very clean.  The setup with two bedrooms and three beds is perfect for a family of four with older kids that really don't want to share a bed.  A lot of everything for the cost!

title: Appartamento con tutti i confort! Comodo a tutti a tutti i servizi!
text: Sono stato per 6 notti in questa struttura.dal 29 giugno al 5 luglio. Un appartamento dotato di cucina attrezzata, con fornello, frigo, forno, forno microonde e tostapane. A 2 passi da Times Square e da Rockfeller center a Manhattan. Fermata della metro a 2 passi. Un appartamento strategico per visitare New York.

title: GREAT location & apartment!
text: We loved staying at Radio City Apartments.  Stayed in an 1 bedroom 11th floor room and had a small view of Times Square.  There were 2 adults and 2 teenagers, the apartment was spacious for a NYC hotel and having a kitchen was nice for leftovers, coffee or snacks.  The room is slightly dated but considering the reasonable price ($275 per night) it didn't bother me in the slightest.  The hotel and our room was clean and the staff were super helpful.  We didn't hear any of the construction noise mentioned in earlier posts and we stayed Tuesday thru Friday.  The BEST thing about Radio City Apartments is their location.  Close to many subway locations (various lines) Times Square, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center  were all in minutes to the hotel.  It was extremely hot while we were there and being in close proximity to everything helped keep us cool.  Would definitely recommend staying here and I would come back for sure - a GEM in NYC!!

title: Great location-- 10 minute walk to Broadway theaters! 1/2 block to subway.
text: Great value for apartment with kitchenette in Manhattan.  Modern, quiet, AC worked well. Lots of restaurants, but no grocery stores in this neighborhood. Duane Reade drugstore inside and downstairs in an office building on the same block as hotel has a reasonable selection of milk, juice, TV dinners, etc. Also Pret-a-Manger restaurant in the same building for soup and sandwiches.

title: Great location and very comfortable
text: We found this hotel to be very centrally located and within easy walking distance to several subway stations and many iconic New York City attractions.  As for the hotel itself, the facilities were very comfortable, from the queen size bed to the bathroom and the kitchenette facilities.  We were on the ninth floor with a room facing the street, so some may find it noisy, but this is New York City and it is noisy so, if you want a quiet sedate room, then perhaps NYC isn’t the place for you.

title: Great Location
text:
Stayed Two nights. Fantastic location. Close to everything you would want to do in Midtown Manhattan 
Stayed in a two double bed apartment which completely suited our needs
Rooms were clean and of ever wanted towels in your room, this is the place to be  
Staff were always polite
The petty reviews people make amuse me especially reading  them  after my stay

title: Love this location
text: Our family absolutely love the Radio City Apartments!  For a family of five the 2bedroom apartment had more than enough space!  We were at the center of everything!  Literally everything was either a walk or subway ride away. Time Square was around the corner!  Some of the best restaurants and the LOL Comedy club was within walking distance!  The only draw back for our children was the small “cereal” bowls. 😂. Would definitely recommend this location for singles and families. We felt very safe with the great staff here.

title: Ideal central Manhattan location
text: This is ideally located in Central Manhattan and well equipped for self catering if staying a while. Noise from street construction some nights but goes with the territory! Would definitely stay here next trip to New York.

title: Idéalement situé!
text: L'endroit était propre, relativement bien équipé, nettoyé quotidiennement, avec une situation très sympa! Un rapport qualité prix qui était correcte pour NY! Voyage avec ma compagne et ma filleule de 23 ans! Nous avons bcp aimé et y retournerions

title: Just what we needed
text: This was an excellent choice for our family of five.  Walking distance to theaters, Times Square and Grand Central Station.  It's not free, but obviously nothing in New York City is.  We had the two bedroom unit.  It was not huge, but was so much better than the typical hotel room if you plan on spending any time at all hanging out in the room.  I'd probably look here first if we come back to the city.

title: Best Stay Ever!
text:
We spent the weekend here on June 22/23 and booked the two bedroom apartment. 5 of us were travelling and this apartment was absolutely perfect! We loved the location, cleanliness of the hotel, customer service of front desk staff and comfort of the beds.

The only glitch was early morning construction so we got woken up quite early but that is out of control of the hotel. Each of our rooms had a tv which was a nice bonus although I don't think we even turned them on. We did tons of walking and it was nice to come back to a cold drink sitting in the fridge. Lots of markets are close by if you want to buy a bottle of wine. We also brought back leftovers from a restaurant so that was a nice feature. The coffee maker worked great so mornings were relaxing.

We will definitely be back!

title: Love This Place!
text: We loved everything about staying at Radio City Apartments. It was clean, spacious for NYC, and the perfect location for everything in the Big Apple! You won't be sorry staying here. I wish we'd known about here the past 2 times we've visited!

title: GREAT
text:
Stayed in a one bedroom with 3 adults/2 kids. Plenty of space. We had a room on the 5th floor. It was updated. A window in the bedroom, living room & bathroom. 
A\C worked well but the units were loud.
Street noise could be heard but I expect that in NYC!
Location was great. There is a good pizza place next door. A good salad/sandwich place 2 doors down.
The staff were all friendly & very welcoming. 
I’d 100% stay here again!!

title: Best location
text:
Located between 6th and 7th Ave on W49St this is a short walk to Times Square and to the theatre district. FOX news broadcasts one block away. The McGraw water tunnel is right next door and the theatre district about three blocks away.
Hotel is surrounded by great restaurants- from breakfast at Toasties, snack at Radio City Pizza, Pasta, and kiosks. The hotel offers a wide variety of suites. Our group had the double suite, the queen suite, and the suite with two queen beds. All were equipped with cutlery and plates, and a range of kitchens from microwave/mini fridge to full size fridge and gas stove. Bathrooms were modern, marble, and supplied with an abundance of towels.

title: 常宿
text: 10年ほど前にも泊まったが、タイムズスクエアに近く、地下鉄も色々な路線が利用できるので、とても便利なため、リピートした。10年経ったが設備の古さは感じたものの、清掃されているので快適に過ごせた。便座が冷たいので、もしかしたら冬場はつらい？のかも。ドアの鍵が2か所あるので、部屋に入るのにちょっとコツがいる。これからも常宿になると思う。

title: Spacious 1 bedroom Apartment just off times square
text: Convenient and clean apartment. Walking distance from Whole Foods by Bryant Park. 5-10 min walk to most theaters and Rockefeller Center. 2 min walk to Magnolia Cafe. Close to several subway entrances. Definitely would use for our next trip to NYC.

title: Great Hotel Great Location
text: We stayed there for 2 nights and really enjoyed it.  The rooms are modern with a small yet full kitchen.  The beds a are comfy and the bathroom is very nice.  The location is close to times square and the theater district.  This place is a great find for NYC and we highly recommend it.  We visit several times a year and this is now our go to place.

title: Perfect "base of operations"
text:
This hotel not only met, but well exceeded my expectations. The staff is super friendly and helped my wife get our luggage from the curb to our room while I parked the car (more on that later). We had a one-bedroom apartment, which had a fridge, oven, and microwave. Everything is clean; they provide the standard stuff in the kitchen, such as utensils, pots, pans, plates, etc.

For cruisers, this is a great spot if you want to spend a night or two before heading out on your cruise. We left from Bayonne/Cape Liberty on Royal Caribbean and spend 3 nights at Radio City. Since we had the car, we were able to pack breakfast, lunch, and dinner in order to save some significant money. Given the location, we were able to head back to the hotel every night for dinner and then back out again for activities. We packed lunch, water, and snacks in backpacks.

TIPS:
1. Parking: I parked at a garage 2 blocks away heading west on 49th street. I had never driven into Manhattan before and was a bit apprehensive, so I used the ParkWhiz app to secure a spot at 225 West 49th Street. It's less than a 5 minute walk and the car is pointing in the right direction after you drop off passengers and luggage at the hotel. I would highly recommend this garage.
2. Subway: We purchased the unlimited weekly pass for $34/person. It's just easier that way. We found the 50th & Broadway station to be the easiest to use, especially since most of our itinerary was to the south.
3. Drop off/loading: There is no loading/unloading area, but the street in front of the hotel is very wide. Again, as a first time driver into the city, this worried me, but it turned out to be nothing to worry about.

With all that, I spent a lot of time in advance researching hotels in the city. This one turned out to be a real find. Go ahead and book it!

title: Great location
text:
This is a great hotel so close to all sightseeing in and around New York.
It’s walking distance to subway, Times Square, Broadway and Rockerfeller centre.
Comfortable apartments with fridge, microwave and stove so you don’t have to eat out all the time.
