Staff are friendly ,helpful and courteous to make your stay enjoyable.
A reasonably  ,priced clean  and handy hotel it’s definitely worth it we enjoyed our stay.

title: Central spot
text: Good location between Times Square and Radio City. Most useful if you prepare your own meals (and aren't hosting anyone for dinner). Air conditioning is a window unit; it can be noisy during rain, when drips hit the unit. Space for luggage is limited. But room is comfortable and clean.

title: Great for the price
text:
I booked this place blind in one of those mystery hotel deals. I was actually kind of nervous by how cheap it was but I was very happy. Rooms are normal Manhattan size (ie small). Maybe seem even smaller but I think it is because there is all the kitchen stuff taking up space as well. If you are just looking for a room to sleep in, it’s great. 

Good: 
Location: terrific. Tucked away a little bit from the insane number of people in Times Square, but still close enough that you could walk there in just a couple minutes. There are lots of subways stops in the area as well so no matter where you are going you can probably get to the right spot in 5-10 minute walk max. 
Price: Obviously this is going fluctuate, but they seem a lot cheaper than most in the area. 
Kitchen: small but has everything you could need
Staff: friendly and helpful

Bad:
Noise: Not as bad as some reviewers make it out to be but there is construction inside and out. Earplugs help, especially if you’re a light sleeper. 
Cleanliness: it wasn’t terrible, but it wasn’t great either. The room would benefit from a really good deep clean but was overall acceptable.

title: Home again, Home again, Jiggety-jog.
text: My most recent visit was June 2019, but I stay here often.  My last visit was Nov 15, 2018. When I can find a good reason to return I will be making another reservation. I choose this location over any other for price, helpful and friendly staff and free internet access.  Proximity to the theatre district and uptown / downtown MTA access is another plus.  According to John Lennon and I agree, "Today America is the Roman Empire and New York is Rome itself.”

title: Radio City Apartments - WOW!
text:
After receiving several recommendations for Radio City Apartments from friends and co-workers & reading several positive reviews, we decided to book our stay here and I honestly don't know if we could have picked a better spot.

The hotel is located right in midtown-Manhattan with tons of great dining & shopping nearby.  Times Square & Rockefeller Center are both within a 5-10 minute walk, all the Broadway theaters are within a 10-15 minute walk and Central Park is about a 40-45 minute walk away.

There are multiple Subway Stations within a short radius of the hotel, meaning easy access to get wherever you need to go; we were able to use the Subway to get to Yankee Stadium, the World Trade Center/9-11 Museum & Memorial and Battery Park where we took the Staten Island Ferry.

As for the hotel itself, it was great.  We had a Queen room which featured a queen bed (obviously), a small kitchenette (fridge, microwave and small gas stove) and a private bath.  To be fair, the room was small but that's what we were expecting; the room was more like what you'd find in Europe than what you'd find in one of the big chain hotels and some people might be put off by that.  

Having kitchen facilities in the room was nice as we were able to grab some groceries (there's a spot called "Food Emporium" just down the street, about a 10 minute walk away) so we were able to have breakfasts and snacks in the room.

The only real negative that I came across was the noise from the street below but that was really only an issue for the first night.  Car horns honking, the occasional sirens wailing and loud music from speakers attached to the pizza restaurant all echoed up between the buildings but truthfully, by the second night we were there, I didn't even notice it anymore.

The staff were super-friendly, the room was clean and comfortable and we heard zero noise from any of the neighbors.  We will gladly recommend Radio City Apartments to anyone planning an NYC trip.

title: Great location
text: The apartments are perfectly situated a few metres away from a metro stop and Times Square. Cleaners do a good job and rooms are of a good size. I would suggest that windows have extra insulation though as noise pollution in NY is real.

title: Great stay- great location
text: Was a little shocked when we first arrived to see stairs to carry our bags up but a staff member came down straight away to meet us and took our bags up fir us. Check in was easy. Only 2 lifts and the property is being renovated but we didn’t care we were in NYC! Our room had a bedroom with 2 large beds, a lounge area with a fold out, a kitchenette and a bathroom. I was on the 9th floor and was amazed I could hear the traffic outside but after a full day of exploring I didn’t care! Located amongst it all we enjoyed our stay immensely and would def stay again!

title: The good, the bad & the ugly
text:
Like many of you I spent time trawling TripAdvisor to gain in insight into this accommodation in an effort to see if we should stay here during our recent trip and putting to one side the many reviews by people with 1 review to their name, we took the plunge and booked four nights.
 
In general he reviews are accurate and here are my thoughts.
 
Location is brilliant and can’t be faulted.
 
Front desk staff are generally miserable and only a few would acknowledge you when returning or leaving. I found this very unusual for America but nonetheless,  I can’t say it really impacted our stay.
 
Our 2 bedroom apartment was adequate in terms of space, especially for new York standards. The amenities in the room were of a good standard and the towels were very soft/fluffy.
The sofa bed in the lounge wasn’t made up and we had to do this ourselves, having arrived late in the evening.
 
On a number of occasions there was no hot water which I reported back on check out, which I understand is due to them having only one boiler. Apparently I should have called the front desk to ask for hot water, which I found insulting. Having spent a lot of money I don’t see why it’s my responsibility to request hot water, but perhaps I’m wrong.
 
Overall I’m happy with the choice we made, a little bit insulted by the surly attitude of the front desk (especially when it comes to hot water) but as a base its absolutely fine.
 
Ordered take out from the Chinese along the street which was nice and I’d recommend this.
 
Finally, we were woken at 6:20 by the building site behind our room which is still not out the ground, so there is still a long way to go. I don’t remember being advised of this by the hotel prior to booking so please bare this in mind if you want a lie in.

title: Great location
text: Great location just minutes from time square. Very clean and large rooms. Just wished I was not disturbed at 6:45 in the morning by construction in the street. NY, please don't do this so early and Radio Apartments get sound proofing. with that said it was a great bargain and I would stay again.

title: Tired but ok
text:
Apartment was booked through Trailfinders and read some reviews before departure. All looked and sounded good. Arrived mid afternoon after a long journey from Washington DC and was looking forward to unpacking and resting up for our longer stay of our trip. We were met by some really friendly staff on arrival and checking in was swift. Reception area is small but manageable with a small seated area for resting. Lifts up to the floors are a little shaky and tired, our floor was floor 11. Our room given was apartment 1111 and on entering the room the apartment I was taken back on how tired and dark the room felt. (I felt that any minute now, Cagney & Lacey or Kojak, would bust right in looking for a suspect.) 😀 Dated, dark brown walls, dull dark carpets and small room with two double beds pushed into a room with only the centre part between them for access. No wardrobe only a hanging rail and a small twin draw set. No security safe and a small kitchen unit set in the lounge area. The look on my wife’s face was shear gutting and she was about to cry! 😢😢Back down to reception and spoke to Carlos, who was very understanding he showed me a similar size room on a lower floor. The room was slightly bigger with better bed access, wardrobe, safe and lounge area but decoration was still the same. Think it must be all the way through. The rooms were cleaned daily and new towels issued everyday. 

I would give this 4/5 stars if the rooms were given some serious updating, new brighter decoration making it more fresher an appealing. 
We stayed here for 4 nights and it was pretty much only for sleeping. We did use the kitchen area for breakfast to save some money as eating out can be very expensive. You are given a small leaflet for local info like mini markets, tickets and directions to various attractions and the location is pretty spot in for what you need. Literally 5 min walk from apartment to Time square, 10 min walk to Rockefeller tower, 20 min walk to the Empire State Building, 34th street and about 30 mins to Central Park. Once we sorted our bearings to locations, attractions etc,  we were visiting loads. 

Overall we enjoyed our stay and the staff were great, especially Carlos. Thank you. 

Just seriously need to brighten up and make the rooms more appealing.

title: SOLID CHOICE!
text: For our group of 5 adults, the 2 bedroom apartment was an excellent choice. Reasonably spacious, clean, and although slightly dated (gold/maroon/beige), it was in good condition. The kitchen had dishes, cookware/toaster, dish soap, coffee, etc. The price was reasonable considering the location. We arrived mid-morning and were able to check-in early after a 15 minute wait. We had no issues with any of the staff. The only small negative was the curtain rod fell down when I went to close the curtain the morning we were leaving, but I assume it was fixed on our departure. There is construction next to the hotel, but it didn't annoy us and after walking 9-13 miles a day, we fell into a sound sleep nightly. I recommend this property!!

title: Great little hotel in convenient location
text:
If you want a great place to stay where you can walk to Times Square, central
Park and the theatre district all within minutes, this is a good find. We had a small room with a little kitchen with fridge, stove, microwave and coffee maker. It was clean and the service was very good. Nice friendly staff...Great value!!!

title: muy bueno
text: Excelente ubicación, muy buena atención del personal, todos hablan en español. Buen tamaño de los ambientes, muy luminoso, No entiendo por que tengo que escribir 200 caracteres sino no me acepta la opinión,.

title: Super Hotel in Top Lage!
text: Sehr empfehlenswert! Unser Apartment war außerordentlich sauber und das Personal hilfsbereit und freundlich. Die Lage ist super, direkt am Time Square. Würde dieses Hotel, beim nächsten Besuch in Manhattan, auf jeden Fall wieder wählen.

title: GREAT LOCATION and VALUE for sure!
text:
Just got back from our week in NYC.  Radio City apartments were terrific.  We had a 1 bedroom king suite for 4 of us, two parents in the bed (with a nice tempurpedic mattress) and the two kids on the pull out couch.  I WILL say, though, that the pull out couch was terrible -- I laid on it briefly a few times and it bowed up on the sides and had many metal "pokey" parts jabbing into the thin mattress.  Thank God the kids were always so exhausted they slept anyway!
However, the accommodations were roomy for New York, and there was nothing better than rolling out of bed right into Times Square!  After a daytime activity, we'd come "home" around 4pm for a rest, and then go out again at night where there was nightlife, restaurants, stores open late, and Broadway Shows within walking distance.
Lastly, we heard NO construction noise!  Granted our floor was way up at the top, so that helped.  But I don't think they're doing the "jackhammering" phase of the construction anymore that was reported a few months back.  We did hear a little traffic noise here or there, but nothing too bad.  GREAT to have the fridge, oven, toaster, microwave to save money on meals too.  Would highly recommend!

title: hotel room
text: it is very conveniently located for the theater district, MOMa and subway access. Have been coming to this hotel for the last 20 + years. I like the studio with  a queen size bed. I also like the from view rooms higher up but it could be a bit noisy.

title: Convenient and safe
text: If you're going to the theatre in New York, there's no better place to stay. Radio City Apartments are clean and comfortable and right in the middle of the theatre district.  Having a kitchen makes it easy to have a meal around your theatre schedule. I can't remember the number of times I've stayed here, but I've been coming back for over 20 years.

title: OMG AVOID THIS HOTEL LIKE THE PLAGUE
text:
I have never stayed at such a filthy place such as this,
Reception staff -3 men -rude - argumentative - aggressive - what a frightening experience.  Toilets were absolutely disgusting and we refused to check in after being spoken to, or should i say shouted at, on arrival.  Did not understand what the issue was but i preceived them as racist with a couldnt care less attitude- left without checking in - thank god we left !!!!
On checking in to another hotel they were so apologetic for our experience at this hotel and were absolutely amazing -not the first complaint i believe about radio city apartments -LEAVE WELL ALONE AND BE SAFE!!!

title: DO NOT STAY HERE
text: We arrived in New York after being on a cruise for 12 nights. We had one night in the city before flying home the next day.  We had a wonderful holiday until we arrived at this horrendous hotel. I was travelling with my family and upon arrival we were faced with the most rude, aggressive reception staff. Three men which obviously seemed to have a problem with us from the minute we walked through the door, which I can only put down to us being British. The place was filthy dirty, toilets were absolutely disgusting which I won’t go into detail. We were spoken to so aggressively and felt extremely threatened to the point my 64yr old mother was in tears feeling very unsafe. I immediately booked another hotel for us to go to just around the corner even though we had already paid to stay in Radio city, I could not let this hotel ruin our last night in New York after having a fabulous family holiday so far. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE, AVOID THIS HOTEL LIKE THE PLAGUE. It should not even be advertised as fit for tourists with such racist aggressive staff.

title: Perfect
text:
We had shared transport to/from the airport and had a studio apartment, we stayed for 7 nights, the decor is a little dark in the bedroom but it appeared to have been freshly decorated, everything looked brand new and the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was bright and again everything looked new with thick, white fluffy clean towels every day.

The Food Emporium at the end of the road (5 minutes away) had an amazing selection of food, beer etc. reception gave us an information sheet detailing shops, chemists etc. on arrival.  

We did not hear any noise from building work as our room was at the front of the building, the traffic calmed down at night and do not disturb us, there was no noise at all from neighbouring rooms either.

Everything we requested was supplied without any fuss.  On the last day our transport to the airport collected us at 4.00pm but we had to check out of the room in the morning, the hotel kindly kept our luggage locked away in a secure location whilst we spent our last day in New York.

I would not hesitate to stay here again.

We found the 7 day New York card (purchased online) and 7 day Metro card really useful (you will need approx $68 cash if you want to buy your Metro card from a member of staff at the information desk).  If you want to go into the Crown at the Statue of Liberty tickets must be purchased online months in advance, it is worth visiting the popular attractions early to avoid the queues (Empire State Building and Top of the Rock open at 8am).

title: Muy buena opción para familias
text:
Ubicacion inmejorable cerca de Times Square, Central Park y 5 av. 
Cuenta con una pequeña cocina con mesa y sillas. 
Proceso de check in muy rápido.
Hay varios mercados cerca para comprar comida y algunos restaurantes con take away

title: best location
text: we were so near everything...theaters, NBC studio, restaurants, subway stop, Central Park, etc. The rooms are a little dated but really quite large and comfortable. Three of us had our own beds with the sofa bed. Great value for the price, especially since we weren't spending a lot of time in the room. I would definitely go there again.

title: Great value for NYC
text: Really didn't know what to expect with the name Radio City Apartments, but we basically had a small hotel suite that could have slept 6.  Cost was less than most single rooms in no-name hotels in NYC.  They were in the process of doing some minor remodeling, but it caused no problems or inconvenience.  Refrigerator, microwave, fold-out couch, dining table, FILLED ice cube trays in freezer... (very much appreciated).  Convenient location.  Great find!

title: First Impressions can be Deceiving
text:
When we first arrived into  studio room 1208 we were both disappointed. The room was dark with old furniture. I likened it to staying in a relative’s spare room!  We stayed here for 10 days.
But on closer inspection, the room good enough, with big comfortable beds and lots of clean towels. And a window which you could open. 
Beware the website pictures show their best rooms. Our room didn’t have a kitchen area as shown on the web. The cutlery was stored in the bathroom. We had to wash dishes in the bathroom hand basin, the hand basin was very small with low water pressure and nowhere to drain the dishes. We had a boxed in pipe in the bedroom and you could hear water running when the other rooms had a shower or flushed the loo.
There was no surface to eat a meal on in the room. The room had full size fridge freezer. not sure about the freezer being of a lot of use. There was a microwave oven in the room and a very useful coffee/tea making machine. The hotel provided the coffee, tea and so on for the coffee/tea machine. I think you would be hard pressed to heat up a meal in the room because of the lack of surfaces. I have done a lot of camping in my time and am used to getting by and I wouldn’t have fancied making a hot meal in the room. We only used the fridge for drinks cold meats and cheese. We ate a takeout meal in the room once or twice but had to eat it on the bed.
Okay negatives out of the way. The good points: the location of the hotel for the price is amazing. 5 mins walk from Times Square, A subway 2 mins away. For a city a relatively quiet room. Everything worked in the room, good shower, free wifi, clean room, friendly helpful staff. Free use of a safe in reception. ‘Halal Guys’ street food on 49th street corner, very tasty. A supermarket a few blocks away, you can eat hot food there, bit like UK ‘Wholefoods’ supermarkets. A ‘Toasties’ deli diner 2 doors away, good for breakfast.

title: Enamorado de este hotel
text:
Debo confesar que soy bastante estricto con las cosas y enseguida encuentro algo negativo, pero este hotel es perfecto. Es justo, con las cosas necesarias, y excelentemente decorado. Me paso varias veces que no sabia donde estaba la llave de luz pero donde ponia la mano estaba ahi, un genio el arquitecto.
Tipico lugar neoyorquino, me sentia dentro de una serie estadounidense. 
100% recomendable, lo unico negativo los dos ascensores que tienen no dan a basto para la cantidad de trafico de gente.
Los empleados 10 puntos y la ubicación inmejorable.

title: Comfortable hotel with a kitchen
text:
We stayed here 5 nights. Perfect location: close to Times Square, but in a quite place. Kitchen in the apartment helped as to save time and money. My fears that this is an old hotel with shabby and worn furniture turned out to be in vain. Everything was clean and comfortable. 
Friendly and caring staff, proximity to several subway lines and 24 hour check in. 
Taking into account how expensive are NYC hotels, this place is very fairly priced.

title: Great location
text: Service from staff is excellent. They cater to all requests. Free use of laundry facilities is very handy. We rented a 2BR apartment as we were 5 adults  and while this hotel is quite old and have squeaky floors, it was still good value for NYC. The air conditioner can be a bit noisy when turned on initially and being close to Times Square, street noise can be heard. The best part of this hotel is the location - walking distance to broadway shows and Times Square, 5th Avenue shopping area and very close to subway stations too. Kitchen facility is very good with a coffee machine and microwave, oven and stove  so we saved money making our own breakfast and other meals every day. Concierge is very helpful. They have umbrellas we can use when it rains (it did rain for a few days when we were in NYC). There are a lot of restaurants in the area - our fave is the Chinese restaurant downstairs which was not too expensive at all and various food trucks along the street during the day. We went to a few broadway shows which were all walking distance. All staff were very helpful which makes for a great experience.

title: Un buon hotel
text: Considerando l'ottima posizione in centro a Manhattan il prezzo non è eccessivo e le camere sono abbastanza pulite e sufficientemente grandi. Abbiamo scelto una camera con due letti queen size molto confortevoli.

title: Nice location
text:
It is near time square 
Good location for 31st December 
You can stay with kids and close to new year eve event
It is walking distance and security will allow you to go at 11:30 pm also 
You May go with the family

title: Una buena alternativa para familias numerosas y que quieran alojarse en el corazón de Manhattan
text: Somos familia numerosa lo que implica que cuando viajamos fuera o cogemos 2 habitaciones de hotel o un apartamento y la verdad es que los Radio City son estupendos por su ubicación y por su equipación. Además el personal es muy amable. Tuvimos un problema con una instalación y lo solventaron al momento.

title: Super funky hotel that has it all - in the heart of Times Square
text:
Stayed here with my family for 5 nights.  Hotel was perfect for our family of 5.  The room (2 bedroom unit) had 3 beds (2 beds in 1 bedroom, 1 in the other), plus a pull out couch in the living room.  A full kitchen and bathroom.  We had about 800 square feet of living space and a view that was not too bad.  

Hotel staff were friendly.  Front desk staff were friendly and helpful.  We didn't use chambermaid service but it was available every day.

Hotel amenities:  I am not sure what, if any amenities they have.  I.e., I don't think they have a pool or fitness center.  They did let us use their laundry facilities for free, which was super nice of them.  

The location is very hard to beat. It is around the corner from Times Square -- just 1 block away.  Not too noisy.

One word of caution, there is a large construction site right next to the hotel.  We were right beside it.  We were up and out early in the morning so it wasn't a problem, but would have been had we wanted to sleep in.  It might be worth trying to ask for a room away from any construction.

Overall, a great experience and I'd be happy to stay here again.

title: Super emplacement
text:
Idéalement placé, chambre très spacieuse ce qui est rare à Manhattan. L'hôtel est assez vétuste malgré les rénovation en cour.
Il y a un énorme chantier mitoyen ce qui fait énormément de bruit, je n'y suis resté qu'une nuit cela ne m'a pas dérangé mais sur du long terme cela doit être fatigant. 
En résumé bon emplacement car pour le prix on ne trouve rie de mieux dans le coin.
Service de bagagerie pratique pour les vols tardifs.

title: Muy buena opción, ubicación perfecta
text: Uno de los puntos principales a favor es la excelente ubicación, a poca distancia del Rockefeller Center, la Quinta Avenida, Times Square (sin estar en medio del ruido), Central Park y el metro, para moverse hacia cualquier lado. Las habitaciones están bien. Las alfombras son un poco antiguas, pero quedamos muy contentos en general con el cuarto One Bedroom Apartment que ocupamos tres personas.

title: Back again
text: I have lost count of the number of times I have stayed at RCA and already have another 2 visits booked. Perfect location especially for a theatre fan, spotlessly clean, lovely staff, very useful kitchen facilities in the room. Subway 1 minute away, surrounded by good places to eat and buy food to take out should you wish. Directly opposite is Hale and Hearty which does great soups, sandwiches and salads all made fresh. Food Emporium on 8th Ave and 50th Street for massive selection of food and groceries. Great diner on 7th Avenue at 50th street called Majestic if you want a proper full breakfast. Delis next door. Also good pasta restaurant also next door. Fantastic in all respects. I love it and it really is my home from home.

title: AMOS
text:
We have been here 4 nights. The location was very good, the hotel is placed in the center of all the most interesting places for NY's visitors. we got a room at the upper floor were we could see a beautiful view from the window, the room was big and clean and the service was very good especially from the reception.
finely we would like to thanks Mrs. Tina for her assistance at the hotel , thank you!
we wish coming back to this hotel soon

title: Scelta azzeccata
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo Hotel per 5 notti. Avevamo preso una camera con due letti queen e senza cucina totale circa 1300 $. Se si cerca vicino a Times Square è una delle soluzioni con rapporto qualità prezzo migliore (e io consiglio questa zona per vivere al meglio la città). La camere era al decimo piano (abbastanza silenziosa x essere in pieno centro), spaziosa , pulita, con tv, macchina caffè per caffè americano compreso, aria condizionata (un pò rumorosa), frigobar, phon, ferro da stiro con asse, cassetta di sicurezza a richiesta alla reception, forno a microonde e presenza di posate e tazze/bicchieri e di detersivo x lavarli. Il mobiglio molto spartano, una scrivania con 4 cassetti e al posto dell armadio un bastone con appendiabiti. Wifi velocissimo e gratuito. La posizione è ottima , 200-300 m e si è a Times Square, 200 m a Rockefeller Center, fermata della metro gialla praticamente sotto l'Hotel, e le linee della metro blu/arancio/rossa sono comunque vicinissime. Le camere vengono rifatte solo nel primo pomeriggio. Check-in veloce, personale di poche parole, viene trattenuta una caparra sulla carta di credito di 250$ che poi viene restituita alla partenza. Disponibli gratuitamente alla reception cartina della citte e dei bus/metro. Lo consiglio vivamente

title: Fantastic
text:
We had 4 nights at the Radio City Apartments. We booked a 2 bedroom apartment as we had an 18 yr old with us who needed their own space. Check in was great, lovely guy on the desk. The apartment was really spacious, two bedrooms, one with a double bed and the other with two double beds in. 

Kitchenette was really useful, fitted with gas oven and hob, microwave, coffee percolator, kettle, fridge freezer and sink. Washing up liquid, dish sponge, kitchen roll and tea towel all provided. Along with complimentary coffee and tea.

The main living area had a sofa and a dining table. TV’s in every room.

Although the apartment is somewhat dated, it was spotlessly clean and very comfortable.  The beds were great, very comfortable.

The location is perfect. It is literally just around the corner from Times Square. There is a subway very close by and also the stop for the Hop on Hop off bus is about 2 minutes walk away.

For breakfast we either cooked something in the apartment or went next door to Toasties which is a great little diner.  

Overall, we had a fabulous time at Radio City, it’s peaceful (as much as it can be...you’re in NYC!!), clean and comfortable.  We wouldn’t hesitate to return.

title: Perfect location for Midtown NYC visit.
text: Everything was great, or perfect. If you want to stay in a Midtown hotel and be within walking distance of all major attractions, this is it. Friendly staff, charming building, reasonable rates, and a great location.

title: Honest review
text: If you are going to site see... you will not get a better location than this! It is so close to Times Sq, 5th Ave, Central Park etc. The apartment has a fantastic kitchenette which we used for breakfast only. The front reception staff are really friendly and helpful. Fresh towels everyday. Only negative is that it could have been cleaner, the sink and shower area was quite dirty by the end of our stay. We had no noise at all in apartment 1004, did not hear any construction.

title: It's worth braving the construction site noise ..
text:
I am staying here until tomorrow with my daughter and three children .I am the only one in our group who is woken before 7 with the noise. The building work starts at 7 but they can have deliveries of heavy metal goods from 4.30 a.m. presumably because a huge truck would never get through the New York traffic during the day.Having said that I am asleep by 9 p.m.because of our sightseeing during the day so I am getting plenty of sleep. Not a sound from inside the appartment block.
The two bedroom apartment has been perfect, clean and comfortable. A toilet blockage was dealt with within fifteen minutes . Plenty of good quality towels .
As everyone else has said it's unbelievably central to so many sights . Just bring ear plugs and it will all be worth it !
The photo is a view from apartment window .

title: Perfect stay
text: We had a wonderful 8 night stay in radio city apartments over Christmas 2018. We are a family of 4 (2 Adults, 2 teenagers) and the one bedroom apartment was perfect. It was great to have a kitchenette for breakfasts and snacks.  The location is fantastic, close to the subway and easy to walk to most places.  The laundry is free to use and is located in the basement.  However it can only be used after 8:00pm.  The staff are extremely helpful and friendly.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location
text: Absolutely the best location you can walk everywhere or catch the subway. Room was comfortable. Beds very comfortable   Slept with the window open 2 nights. Hotel stafff friendly. Love their soap. Very quiet inside.  Some noise with windows open. Good pizza place next door.

title: Great location
text: Just got back from a stay in NewYork staying at Radio City Apartments. My sister, daughter and I shared a 1bedroom apartment with 2 queen beds. The accommodation was great . I was worried about reports of noise from building work outside and although it did wake us up at 6am one morning it was a great alarm call for getting us up and out! The apartment was comfortable and had everything we needed. The best thing is the location it's just round the corner from the Rockefellar Centre and Time Square. Central Park is a 15 minute walk away. Just outside the building is Juniors a diner specialising in cheesecake so of course we had to go there for breakfast. I would recommend Radio City and would stay here again

title: Comfortable and Conveniently Located
text: The apartments are very conveniently located on 49th Street very close to Times Square and the Rockefeller Buildings (take the 1 line from Penn Station and get off at the 50th and Broadway stop; it is only a couple of hundred metres away and very easy to find). The rooms are small and there is a little traffic noise but they have a very well equiped kitchen with a full size fridge and a gas stove (very welcome after previous hotels that did not have refrigerators or microwaves) as well as a table and chairs at which to eat. If you do not feel like cooking there is a truly excellent Chinese restaurant out the from door and 30 metre to your left - but they seem to get ready to close about 9.30). The takeaway pizza place just next door also seems to be good (we saw two staff from the hotel buying takeaway there for lunch the day we left).

title: We will absolutely stay again!
text: We stayed for 4 nights...my husband, myself, and our 3 kids. The staff was all very friendly and helpful. The suite was very clean and had everything we needed! If there was anything that we wish was different, we wish we knew that the hotel switches the AC units for heaters during the winters months. We asked if they could put our AC unit back in since it was very warm in the room upon checking in. The maintenance man told us no. But it was cold outside and we were able to open the windows and had no issues. When we checked out the gentlemen at the front desk informed us that they could have changed out the heater for an AC unit for us if we needed. We were fine though and glad to know for future reference. The hotel was the perfect location...close to Times Square and theaters but we didn’t hear any street noise from our suite. We will definitely stay here again!

title: Great Stay
text:
We booked a queen studio for one night.  The front desk staff were friendly and answered our questions.  They offer luggage storage which allowed us to maximize our time in the city.  The bed was comfortable.  
This hotel is close to everything. There is construction nearby but all the city noise just added to the experience for us.  Our room was very warm, the only way to cool down was to open the windows. 
I would stay here again.

title: Fantastic location
text: Excellent accommodation - really spacious apartments and very well situated in the heart of Manhattan.  Subway station right beside and lots of buses available close by. Very quiet at night considering how central it is. Thoroughly recommend a stay here.

title: Perfect location!!
text:
The perfect location to stay in New York. Right next to Times Square and to the subway, in walking distance to the Central Park as well as most of the attractions. 
The hotel was very nice with a very comfortable bed and a very friendly staff. 
It would certainly be my choice whenever I come back!!

title: 2nd New York visit
text: So central. Was upgraded from bedsits to apartment on arrival. On top floor with balcony all round the  building. Could see times square from the window. Furniture old style but everything clean. Comfy sofa and massive bed with comfortable mattress. Decorating hallways at the time but no bother. Staff pleasant and helpful. A bit of construction going on but not in most of the day so didn't really notice. Only thing was when we ordered taxi to airport they used private cars not yellow taxi so was abit pricey. Comfortable though.

title: Dissapointed
text: Location was perfect but the staying in this hotel was not nice. First they put us in a room close to constraction site, we woke up at 5.30am to a terrible noise. From second room we had to leave because there were renovation in the hallway. And they did not inform this, just front desk guy said that we have to been out of our room for couple of hours, and finally it took 7 hours and then the next day we could not go to our room at all, so we had to change room. It was very inconvenient and the compensation for all of this was ridicolous. Not a pleasant stay! Would book another hotel next time.

title: just everything
text: good location for Times square and surrounding areas. well equipped and comfortable. bit noisy with the pipes creaking and if you open the windows noisy outside but it is in a central location. great to have a fridge and hob top and iron!!

title: Muy bueno
text: Personal muy amable y servicial, hablan en ingles y en español, siempre muy predispuestos para todo. Habitaciones comodas y limpias. Cocina funcional. Wifi funciona muy bien. Excelente ubicacion. Estacion de subte en la esquina. Mejor, imposible.

title: Super Aufenthalt - kommen wieder
text:
Geniale Lage - Broadway, Shops und Metro vor der Tür
Ruhig am Abend und in der Nacht
Sauberes Zimmer - alles wurde immer wieder Aufgefüllt
Bequemes Bett
Super Ausstatung inkl. Küche
Taxiservice zum Flughafen

title: Casi perfecto
text: Hola estuve alojado del 21 al 27 de febrero son departamentos con servicio de hotel muy cómodos y a una cuadra del time square la verdad muy lindo y limpio hablan todos español y nunca una queja bien decorado tiene un restaurante italiano que se comen buenas pastas al retirarnos nuestro transporte comprado  por despegar nunca nos vinieron a buscar nos dejaron plantado con 3 niños en pleno Manhattan los chicos nos ayudaron y llamaron a otra empresa y nos mandaron una limusina increíble y nos cobraron como un transporte común lo re contra recomiendo

title: Great theater district location!
text: For less than $200.00 per night, we found a large, clean apartment in the theater district with two double beds and a comfy sofa bed— perfect for me and my twin, teenage sons. My boys gave the WiFi two thumbs up!

title: Certainly OK for a night
text: The location is great.  It can be noisy, as prior reviews stated, and staff could be friendlier (though they were not rude).  Was everything clean and did things work as they should? Pretty much, yes, but our room was very tiny. Dings for the room locks -- old fashion keys are not terribly secure. We would stay here again if in the area.

title: Great apartments, fantastic location
text: Nice clean apartment, very comfy bed, staff very professional and friendly and Times Square just round the corner. Great few days in the city. Nice Pizza place next door. Very near to Rockafeller Centre and Broadway. Plenty of places to eat/drink nearby. I didnt use the laundry facilities however they did have washer you could use for a small charge and free dryer. I would not hesitate to recommend these apartments.

title: NY
text: Excelente ubicación, limpio y completo. Todo funciona correctamente, proveen de los elementos necesario para cocinar, higiene y muy buena conexión de internet. Solo haría que la habitación tenga colores mas claros para dar sensación de amplitud.

title: Noisy!
text:
I booked a room at this apartment for one night while visiting New York City.  I was trying to book an express deal with Priceline for a 3.5 star hotel and ended up with this hotel/apartment.
The apartment itself is very neat and clean. Two types of rooms available 2 beds and 1 full bed - all of them are studio style apartments . 
The price is also great definitely cheaper than other hotels where u end up paying resort fee, etc. 
The downside of this place is that it is very noisy. If you are a light sleeper this place is not for you. This place is in the heart of city and every tourist place is in walking distance but you are in the city which never sleeps - so you constantly hear cop sirens, trucks honking , people talking loudly . All this in the middle of the night.
may be the windows are not properly insulated, because I never had this issue with any other hotel stays in the past.

I would recommend this hotel for the price and location also neat and clean . But do not recommend if you are a light sleeper- you will not get a good nights sleep

title: Very good
text: Very clean hotel 'historic' in an excellent location near to Times Square and Broadway theatres.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Good wifi.  Facilities include a cooker with oven if you don't want to eat out.

title: Lovely Place in the Heart of NYC
text: This was our second stay at the Radio City Apartments. The location is fantastic - right off Times Square. However, inside the building is calm and quiet, so it provides a great respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. Our apartment had a full kitchen (oven, stove, refrigerator & microwave) and a large dining table. The beds were comfortable and the noise from the city outside was minimal. The staff members were very friendly and helpful. All in all a fantastic weekend at the Radio City Apartments!

title: emplacement idéal pour une première visite à NYC
text:
L'emplacement est juste parfait. A 2 pas de Time Square et du métro 47-50 st, en plein 'theater district'. Idéal pour une première visite. Notre appartement est composé de deux pièces: un salon-kitchennette et une chambre avec deux lits de 140*190 , déco un peu vieillotte, mais on apprécie la moquette en plein hiver.... . Il est équipé de : gazinière, four, micro-onde, frigo, grille-pain, cafetière, une salle de bain (avec baignoire-douche)...Chaque jour, on vous fourni en café et thé... le bémol, c'est le bruit des travaux de 7h du matin à 17h. Nous étions au 3e étage coté 48th st, et les marteaux piqueurs sont incessants du lundi au samedi (inclus) pour construire un bâtiment dont la fin de la construction est prévue en 2021. Pour l'heure , ils en sont encore aux fondations. 
On apprécie la possibilité de laver son linge de 8pm à 8am... On y retournera malgré le bruit et le travaux

title: Hotel con la mejor ubicación!
text:
Este hotel nos sorprendió gratamente, en principio teniendo en cuenta que Manhattan es una zona muy cara este hotel tiene un muy buen precio ya que esta alojado en la calle 49 y 6ta a una cuadra del Rockefeller Center, a dos de la 5ta avenida, a tres de Times Square, además cuenta con una linea de subte en la esquina y dos lineas mas a menos de 3 cuadras por lo que es la opción ideal para recorrer Mahattan no solo en metro sino a pie ya que esta a medio camino de todo.
Otro punto a favor es que cuenta con kichinett totalmente completa (cocina con anafe y horno, pileta, heladera, tostadora, microonda, cafetera) estuvimos en 9 días en un studio queen y tenia vajillas para tres personas, servilletas y reposición diaria de cafe, te y azucar. A dos cuadras hay un supermercado "Food Emporium" 49 y 8va donde se puede encontrar absolutamente de todo.
La limpieza excelente y aprovecho para destacar la gran cordialidad del front desk donde siempre estuvieron a disposición, el ultimo día solicitamos un vehiculo privado para trasladarnos al aeropuerto, lo reservaron desde recepción y gratamente nos vinieron a buscar en Limusine a un precio casi igual al que pagamos al haber viajado a la ida en un shuttle compartido.
La unica observación que puedo llegar a tener es el ruido de reformas, pero es NYC no se puede esperar tranquilidad, pero nada que incomodara.
En un futuro viaje a NYC sin dudas volvería a este hotel.

title: Muy bueno
text: Son habitaciones muy comodas, estilo departementos, cocina completa, muy cerca de todo. Tienen laundry gratis y el servicio y trato de todo el personal es excelente, la mayoria hablan ingles y español

title: Good value, great location
text: Overall very good experience at this hotel.  It is an excellent value.  Since it is an apartment format so the rooms have kitchenettes, adding value.  All the amenities of an Airbnb option with none of the risks.  The hallways are  bit dreary but the rooms very serviceable.  Unfortunately there was a major and very noisy construction project was not disclosed at time of booking.  Had we not been there on the weekend (when the construction was no happening) that would have ruined the experience and left use feeling duped.

title: Opción cercana a lo ideal
text:
Radio City Apartments es, a mi entender, la mejor opción en Manhattan. Por qué no lo califico cómo excelente? Porque tiene detalles que no se pueden soslayar.
Empiezo por lo mejor: la ubicación. Está en 49th entre la 6ta y la 7ma, o sea literalmente a metros del Rockefeller Center, de Times Square, de Broadway y del acceso a varias líneas de subte que lo llevaran a cuatro de los cinco distritos que componen la ciudad. Excepto los barrios del sur, todo se puede recorrer caminado desde aquí.
Otro punto alto es la amabilidad del personal tanto de frontdesk como de limpieza.
Fuimos con mi esposa y reservamos una habitación Studio Queen. Pequeña pero impecable. Cocina equipadísima con café de cortesía todos los días y en exceso. Es una opción que permite ahorrar, en una ciudad a la que noté exageradamente cara independientemente de nuestra devaluación. Calefacción segura con los viejos radiadores de vapor regulable. Afuera 11 bajo cero, adentro un placer.
El wifi, de los mejores. Hicimos videoconferencias por WhatsApp de muy buena calidad. Cuenta también con caja de seguridad, secador de pelo y plancha.
Despues de las 20:00 hs. dejan utilizar las lavadoras y secadoras industriales que están en el sótano. Y sin costo.
El precio no es económico pero si puedo decir que es muy difícil conseguir algo mas barato en Manhattan. Para pagar menos hay que buscar en Brooklyn, Queens o New Jersey y luego vivir viajando.
Entre las cosas malas y que difícilmente puedan corregir está la insonorización de la habitación. Hay que tener en cuenta que es un edificio antiquísimo al que mantienen muy bien pero que estructuralmente poco se puede cambiar.
Estuvimos en el 5to. piso, al frente. Manhattan es ruidosa las 24 hs. pero especialmente de madrugada donde camiones de todo tipo realizan sus servicios. Tener la ventana abierta o cerrada era lo mismo. Creo que logramos dormir por el trajín del día. Además se escucha todo (literalmente) de las habitaciones contiguas.
Volveremos, tratando de explorar otras opciones de habitación.

title: Stor leilighet svært nær Times Square
text: Vi hadde en leilighet med fantastisk størrelse, soverom med 2 queen beds, oppholdsrom og stort bad. Litt slitt, og mye tepper på gulvene. Litt trege heiser, og vi var avhengige av dem ettersom vi bodde i 11. etasje. Det var bygningsarbeider (spunsing) på tomta ved siden av, dette var veldig plagsomt på dagtid, og de startet før kl 7 om morgenen. Usikkert når disse arbeidene er ferdigstilte. Sønnen min og jeg var på en ukes hockey-tur, og var først på et annet hotell i NY. Vi dro til Pittsburgh i helgen for å se et par kamper, og fikk ikke lagre bagasje på Radio City Apartments mens vi var borte, selv om vi skulle sjekke inn et par dager senere. Da vi sjekket ut var det imidlertid ikke noe problem å få oppbevare bagasjen frem til avreise senere på dagen.

title: Bel hôtel très bien placé
text:
L’hôtel a une belle façade traditionnelle new-yorkaise ce qui lui donne un charme. Nous étions au 9eme étage pendant le séjour. Donnant sur la rue. Pour les plus sensibles prévoyez des boules quies. L’hôtel est tout proche de Times square et du métro c’est tellement pratique. Malgré tout nous avons réussi à bien dormir.
Nous n’avons pas eu froid. La literie est confortable. Les équipements de la chambre sont très bien. Cela permet d’être tranquille pour dîner le soir quand on a fait une journée de marche à travers la ville et que l’on aspire à un peu plus de calme qu’une salle de restaurant. Et en plus cela permet de maîtriser son budget et donc de s’offrir un beau restaurant pendant son séjour.
Le Rockefeller est tout proche. Vous trouverez magnolia bakery whole food market ou une pharmacy (genre d’épicerie chez nous) très pratique en rentrant le soir.
Pour un séjour où l’on passe la plupart de son temps à sillonner la ville cet hôtel est parfait. Il est simple mais Satisfaisant.
Vous disposez d’un espace laverie dans l’hôtel.
Le personnel semble de prime abord plutôt froid, mais si vous avez une demande ils y répondront. Un personnel de l’accueil s’est montré très professionnel lorsque nous lui avons demandé s’il pouvait appeler pour nous afin de réserver l’an navette retour vers jfk.
Nous conseillons donc cet établissement et si nous revenons en famille nous prendrons certainement à nouveau une suite dans cet établissement !

Enjoy !

title: Don't do it.
text: Just checked in after a long flight. All the reviews on here of the noise. OMG it's bad. Having been in the room 2 mins I ask to move. No rooms available I'm to go to reception tomorrow. The constant noise Jack hammer noise. Can't here the videos on my phone over it. I'm now looking for another hotel for the next 3 nights after tonight. All the receptionist could say the noise finishes at 5pm. Great the only person this place suits is the hard of hearing. Don't be tempted to chance it like i foolishly was trust all the reviews on here.

title: Bonne situation, prix correct, mais...
text:
Idéalement situé, a deux pas d'une bouche de métro et de Time square. Décoration vieillotte, mais propre. Tarif correct pour un petit appartement à New York a cette emplacement.
Mais le prix attractif et la situation ne font pas tout. Travaux à coté de l'hôtel, literie juste correcte. Chauffage par chauffage central extrêmement bruyant, m'empêchant de dormir la première nuit...problème signalé à l'accueil. La solution trouvé pour qu'il n'y ait plus de bruit à été de me couper le chauffage!

title: Good appartments with services
text:
Great location between Times Square and Rockefeller Plaza. 
Multiple subway lines close to the apartments.

Radiators are a little noisy but the staff changed our room to make our stay more comfortable and provided electric radiators for our convenience.

Great staff, great location. 
Many restaurants nearby but expansive because of Times Square.

title: Convenient location and great apartment
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Radio City Apartments. The apartment was smaller than it appeared in the photos but it was still spacious enough for our family of 4. What we liked the most: It was really nice to have the separate bedroom and small kitchen and eating area. It allowed us to easily prepare and eat breakfast in our room, and for some family members to watch TV while others slept. Location was fantastic. So easy to get to the places that we wanted to go! What we liked the least: The brown/orange decor, but it was really fine. Overall, we would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to others.

title: Perfect for us
text:
We stayed here on recommendation and were not disappointed. We booked the 2 bedroomed apartment which was spacious and spotlessly clean. 
Great facilities suited us as a family of four adults perfectly. The kitchenette and dining room was very useful.
Situated very close to Times Square and Rockafeller Center.
Highly recommended for a midtown location, would recommend it to anyone.
Our 3rd time in NYC and first as a family, the extra space we got here was perfect.

title: We loved it!
text: What a great find. Our one-bedroom suite was clean, comfortable, and spacious.  The staff was accommodating and friendly. The construction going on next door could be a problem for those who might want to sleep in, but we were up and going by the crew's 7:00 a.m. starting time and returned after they had quit for the day. Loved having a small kitchenette. Restaurant\ bar downstairs was a plus. Did I mention the perfect location? We will most definitely be back!

title: Central but quiet.
text: Five of us shared a two bedroomed apartment. We loved being so central. The apartment was basic but met all our needs and we were comfortable. Having the kitchenette was good for preparing drinks and snacks. Would say this it’s perfect for families looking for no frills accommodation.

title: Great hotel
text: My daughter and I stayed here in a queen studio apartment which was great, room had a kitchenette so we could cook toast before we left and dinner at night, it has a large fridge oven, cooktop and microwave, pots pans dishes and a kettle, a large bathroom with lovely products supplied and dining setting. You can use the laundry in basement and I recommend doing that after 7 pm as housekeeping use this too they are very helpful. The hotel is practically in time square with the subway entrance on the corner, easy walking distance to supermarkets and plenty of eating places around..hotel staff are accomodating and helpful there's even umbrellas u can use at front door. We found it a bit noisey but with traffic outside but this is no reflection on the hotel it's just New York we would stay here again and highly recommend staying here

title: Weekend before Xmas
text: What a great find. We booked a 1 bedroom apartment and we were shocked at how spacious it was. Yes it is a lil dated but it is spotless.  We arrived early and they were accepted our luggage early with no hesitation. Had to call maintenance for a small issue and they were at out room in 5 minutes. We had no problem with noise or anything we will definitely book here again.

title: good value for lodation
text: Perfect location...we stayed 4 nights and overall this is a good value.  Really good staff, but the elevators were sub par, and the beds not very comfortable...However, this is an older hotel and i would recommend it.

title: Pequeno, mas bem equipado com cozinha e banheira
text: Quarto pequeno, porém funcional (como precisamos de berço, não havia lugar para deixar as malas acessíveis). Cozinha razoavelmente bem equipada, banheiro amplo e com banheira (para nós que viajamos com bebê foi fundamental). Limpeza adequada, ambiente silencioso. Cama confortável, sinal de wi-fi excelente. Localização excepcional (ao lado da Times Square, estação de metrô a 20 m, mercado e farmácias a menos de 300 m). Equipe muito profissional, mas não gostam muito de papo.

title: Ótima Localização para Primeira Viagem
text:
Muito bem localizado, próximo a Times Square e com ponto de metrô na esquina. Para quem vai pela primeira vez e quer fazer os passeios clássicos e ficar na muvuca é ideal!
As janelas não vedam bem e acaba entrando barulho, mas para quem passeia o dia todo e dorme bem, não atrapalha em nada. Possui uma mini cozinha que permite pequenas refeições. Adorei o custo-benefício.

title: Best Place to stay in NYC
text: Every year I go to NYC, and always stay at RCA. The apartment lay out allows for cooking and spending time with other guests. The staff are always professional, friendly and helpful. Will continue to stay there in the future

title: Great Hotel
text: This hotel has the perfect location. It is right at Times Square, very close to multiple Subway stations m, and in walking distance to the Broadway plays. They were also very accommodating. They let us check in early and late. The staff was very friendly. We loved it. It was old timey and adorable!

title: Great location!!
text: We stayed last weekend at Radio City Apartments and were very happy with the accommodations.  The location was perfect - right between Times Square area and Rockefeller Center.  We had a one bedroom for 3 people - and it was very roomy - which is unusual for a NYC stay!  Our unit had a nice kitchenette - stove, microwave, sink, fridge, and coffeemaker - which was all we needed.  It was stocked with cups, plates, etc as well.  Beds were comfortable - even the couch sofa bed.  Bathroom was roomy as well - the water temperature was a little hard to control - you either had warm or steaming hot water, but it was fine.  The front desk staff was pleasant and helpful - and our rooms were cleaned each day to our satisfaction.  My only complaint (as many have written about) was the noise from the construction that is happening.  We were on the 12th Floor - and I think the renovations were happening right above us - so we had some smell in the hallways of paint (but never smelled it in our room).  They are updating it - which is needed - but it is a perfect place for a stay!  I would highly recommend it!

title: A Hidden Gem Right In The Open
text: This hotel has everything one could want! An excellent staff, a great location, value for the money and an apartment like feel with a fridge, microwave, coffee maker and mini range! They even provide free wifi and your choice of newspaper too.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: This was a great place for our family to stay and expierence Times Square. Loved being so close to everything with the convience of having a kitchenette. We could early go back to the room to eat. Plan on staying here again in the future!

title: Affordable accommodation in a top location
text: We (husband and I, sister and niece) stayed in a two bedroom apartment and it was great. Location was very close to everything including subway station. Apartment was clean and tidy, it worked very well for the four of us. Highly recommend.

title: Going back!
text: Perfect place to stay, close to all the attractions, can’t wait to go back!! The housekeeping staff is awesome and very helpful as well as the front desk. Love the history of the building and rooms were really clean.

title: Muy recomendable.
text:
Nos alojamos durante 8 días para la época de Navidad y estuvo todo excelente.

Destacó la atención de toda la gente del hotel y especialmente de la gente de recepción que es más que amable y te ayudan en todo lo que necesites.

Fuimos a un estudio. Llegamos antes de la hora de ingreso, 4 horas antes, y sin ningún problema nos ingresaron.
El primer estudio justo daba a una obra en construcción con un ruido infernal y sin ningún problema son cambiaron.

El estudio es tal cual las fotos. Tiene todo lo necesario e incluso te dejan te, café y crema en polvo.

La calefacción y el agua caliente perfecta. Incluso  hacia calor es el lugar.

La ubicación es inmejorable. Creo que es  de los mejores alojamientos de la zona en cuanto precio calidad.

Volvería sin dudarlo!

title: Fab location & price!!
text: Stayed here with my mom before Christmas and couldn’t fault the place! The location was ideal, the staff were really accommodating and the rooms had everything you’d need! Will definitely be back and would recommend it to anyone!

title: Idéal emplacement
text:
Hôtel charmant 
Vieillot au niveau de l’agencement mais on s’en fiche à New York on vit dehors !
Personnel super sympa 
Réservé sur booking pas de règlement avant le jour J !!!
Contrairement à d’autres commentaires très propre 
On ne peut jamais contenté tout le monde !
Et quel emplacement :
Nous y sommes allés avec 2 ados le top !!!!
A côté de Times square, Rockefeller , 5th avenue .... bref le top 

Bruyant oui c’est vrai mais il y a des travaux donc l’hôtel n’y peut rien !les américains commencent  a 7h ! Nous ne sommes pas en France !!!
Donc c’est momentané 

J’y retournerai c’est sûr pour avoir fait qq voyages ....

title: Affordable, family friendly apartment hotel in great location
text:
Our family of 5 stayed here for 6 nights in a 2 bedroom apartment.  It was great having 2 separate sleeping areas for the kids as well as a small kitchen and dining area.  The bathroom was very small.  The hotel is in a fantastic location. Less than 5 minute walk to 2 subway stations, Times Square, Rockefeller centre, hop on hop off bus and 20 minute walk to Central Park. 
We walked most places.
There was also a supermarket a couple of blocks away which was great for self catering.
There was a pizza shop next door and a bar and Italian restaurant attached to the hotel. 
We were also able to use the hotel's laundry facilities in the basement of a night which was great.
The only negatives were the rooms were dated and the staircase a very long drop and quite dangerous for children who might like climbing.

title: Perfect position
text:
This place really is in a great location; subway within 100 yards, 5mins walk to times Square and near some of New Yorks must dos. Next door there is a great little place for breakfast that's cheap and clean. 
As for the apartments, what can I say. Art Deco interior, very helpful staff, reasonable price, clean and tidy. Without a doubt would definitely stay here again.

title: Tolle Lage, aber...
text: Das Hotel liegt wunderbar zentral, weitere Pluspunkte sind die Apartmentgröße und die Freundlichkeit+Hilfsbereitschaft des Personals. Der gute Eindruck wurde jedoch durch die Tatsache getrübt, dass sich direkt hinter dem Hotel eine Baustelle befindet, sodass ab 7 Uhr morgens an Schlaf nicht mehr zu denken war. Auch der durch die Fenster dringende Essensgeruch war etwas sehr deftig.

title: Great location...
text: Location is great, however there was construction going on next door and excavators were breaking ground rocks, so it was very noisy from ~7.00am until 5.00pm, no need for a sleep in as you are in NYC baby!! Room was very dated, the rooms were very hot, so needed them to adjust the temperature. Kitchenette was well appointed and grocery stores close by if you are wanting something simple or have breakfast before you visit the sites of NYC. Subway close to take the red line down to Chambers Street if wanting to visit Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty. Make sure if you are wanting to visit the Crown, you book well in advance as they sell out months prior particularly for tours of the festive season. I would also recommend booking the tour online from the official site, as this will save you a few dollars.

title: Great Apartment in a great location
text:
We stayed at these apartments for 5 nights in mid December. We had booked a queen studio which had everything we needed for our stay. The rooms are spotless, plenty of towels in the bathroom.  Your provided with washing liquid, sponge and tea towel in the kitchen area and everything else you could need for a short stay. Oh and the bed was really comfy.
The location is great.  Just around the corner from Times Square in one direction and the Rockefeller Centre in an other.  There is a Subway stop less than a minute walk from the apartments and plenty of places to eat and drink within a couple of minutes walk.
I would definitely recommend this place and would stay here again if I'm lucky enough to visit New York a second time.

title: Best Location to explore New York
text:
We wanted to be close to times square so booked this studio apartment for 3 nights.
Easy to get from JFK airport by metro , walking distance to port authority terminal for newark express bus, helpful staff, close to many metro stations to get around new york attractions , many food joints nearby and decent clean rooms.
We paid $250 cash deposit on check in which was returned on check out.

They  provide blankets which are not very comfortable. Hope they replace it with quilts.Rest everything was fine.

title: Best Location in mid-Manhattan
text: Stayed here 3 days week after Thanksgiving. Close to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and numerous theaters. Two-room apartment with double beds and TV in one room and small kitchenette, sofa, and TV in the other. Free laundry available in basement. Numerous options for dining in the lower floor of Rockefeller Center, which is not advertised. Very good Italian restaurant adjacent to lobby. Very desirable place to stay.

title: Overnight stay
text: We live in South Jersey and stayed overnight after a show.  Our family of three stayed in a one bedroom with double beds.  Rooms are spacious, clean, and include a kitchenette with basic kitchenware, a great bonus. There is construction directly behind the hotel that begins around 7am and goes well into the evening. We're early risers so it wasn't much of an issue for us but don't plan on sleeping in if you stay here. Location and price can't be beat. We would stay here again, would just bring earplugs next time.

title: Great Location
text:
Have just returned from a visit to Radio City Apartment. Walking distance to a lot of locations, ie Cental Park,  Time Square and Rockafella Centre.
The 2 bedroom apartment has 2 single bed, 1 double bed also a pull down sofa in living room.
Construction is being done through the week, not on weekends.
I would recommend the apartments for 2or3 nights.
Toasties is a great place for breakfast, 2 doors away.

title: Perfect place
text: This is now my go to location for every NYC trip.  The proximity to Time Square is what enticed me but I’ll return for the cleanliness and friendliness.  Front desk was very helpful.  Room itself was spacious and just what we needed.  Love the extra mirror in the living area so that the bathroom wasn’t the only location to get ready.  While there were no views out our units window the location to the action more than made up for it.

title: So much noise
text: Great room for price and great spot but the noise of construction made it impossible to sleep and they started early plus the heaters in the room make this annoying loud popping sounds every time they come on.  No sleep!

title: Perfeito para uma família!
text: Ótima localização, equipe atenciosa. Cafeteira, fogão e utensílios no quarto permitem fazer pequenas refeições, tornando a viagem mais econômica e agradável. Cama confortável, bom chuveiro. Adorei! Recomendo!

title: Great Stay
text: Centrally located, two bedroom one bath apartment with kitchenette, living area and pull out couch.  Walking distance to a lot of locations close to the hop on hop off bus, nice staff.  Stayed for three nights in December.

title: Great location, good apartment, everything you need!
text:
Fantastic location right at Times Square. Close to all the shops, restaurants, subway.
We had a one bedroom apartment for a family of four adults and there was enough room for us and our luggage. Full size bathroom and compact kitchen.

title: Perfect location
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights in December and it was great place to stay. You could practically walk to most places. We just used google maps so never got lost. Staff are really helpful. Our room was on the 5 th floor and there were two lifts. 
A king bed with bedside cabinet each side chest of drawers and a rail to hang clothes, also had a 2 seater table which was by a window. Kitchen had everything, cooker, fridge, toaster, microwave, iron and ironing board . Cutlery and crockery. Bathroom with a bath and shower and the water was Lovely and hot. 
The carpet and decor was dated but that was really irrelevant for a short stay. Yes there is Building work but nothing to do with this apartment and work only started in the morning and to be honest I loved the noise of New York . 
The people of New York were fantastic and we loved every minute. Would recommend these apartments and would definitely return .  Sorry no photos can’t believe I forgot to take some. Place was nice and clean. Thank you

title: Location, Price, Charm - RCA has it all!
text: Just stayed again last week - second time this year. First time was a double twin room, this time was a one bedroom apartment (2 doubles and a sleeper sofa). The location can't be beat (steps away from everything!), the staff is friendly, funny, and super helpful, the rooms are immaculate, and the price is the best bargain going in the Times Square area. There is a charm to this place you just don't get from modern hotels - sure, the decor is a little dated compared to the chain properties, but seriously, who cares?! If you stay anywhere else you're staying in the wrong place!

title: Best Times Square Value!
text: Radio City Apartments is located right between Rockefeller Center and Times Square on 49th St. Short walk to theater and shopping. We always get a room with a kitchen to allow for easy breakfasts and lunch. It's great to have a place to stop between shopping, dinner and theater. This is the perfect spot!

title: Ottima scelta!
text: Posizione centralissima a due passi da Time Square e la 5th Ave. Servizi essenziali ma impeccabili. Ottimo rapporto qualità/ prezzo se confrontato con altre strutture della zona. Vengono forniti ombrelli gratuitamente, servizio molto utile per chi come noi ne era sprovvisto!

title: Just fab!
text: We had a lovely stay in the 2 bedroom apartment recently. There where 5 of us. It was Very spacious and comfortable. Only downside would be the noise from construction work outside but that can’t be helped. Very central and convenient for subways. Will definitely return.

title: Family stay to see the Christmas lights
text: Hotel is in an excellent location, minutes from some of the best tourist areas, we have visited NY on many occasions and this along with the price was the selling point. BIG PROBLEM though, they are building right outside the property and at 7:01 this morning all hell broke out, absolutely no chance, even with ear plugs of sleeping through it. The building work continues for 10 hours!. Would say give the hotel a miss for 12 months or so as this work is only going to get louder

title: Very Clean and quiet
text: Would definitely stay here again.  Very Clean and comfortable.  Great location.  Very quiet.  Could not hear anything around us.  Linens were clean and well-stocked.  There were five in our party, and we were very comfortable.  Didn’t use the kitchen but that was clean and well-stocked too.

title: Em casa longe de casa
text:
ja fiquei algumas vezes nesse agradavel apart no coracao de manhattan.  e de verdade nao o trocaria por um hotel luxuoso. os funcionarios mais antigos ficam felizes em te rever. e eu tambem ao reve-los envelhecendo junto comigo me sinto bemvinda e acolhida.
em especial o Carlos da recepcao que so ve solucao onde poderia haver algum problema. e quando meu voo foi cancelado passei uma noite de rainha num quarto chic mesmo tendo chegado de surpresa.
os apartamentos sao simples mas tem cozinha o que e uma delicia para quem gosta de beliscar de noite.
localizacao perfeita com TUDO PERTO. 
ja encontrei com alguns famosos brasileiros por ali. aqueles espertos que preferem ficar no anonimato e ter privacidade
se fizer check out e o voo for tarde eles guardam tudo com seguranca.
atencao para as escadas que poderiam estar em um filme de hitchcock
camareiras simpaticas e discretas
nunca vi nenhum ponto negativo
muitas vezes vou com meu irmao mas as vezes com meu filho ou sozinha. todos adoramos

title: ロックフェラー　センターの近く、中心地です。
text: EWR空港から公共バスでBryant Park、そこから、徒歩10分位で、荷物があっても苦にならない距離です。夜も安心して歩けます。簡単な食事は作れるので、近くのスーパーマーケットにも行き、ニューヨーカー気分でした。

title: City break
text: Apartments very well located. Apartments very clean. Room was cleaned every day and we were there for 5 days. Gas cooker,microwave, fridge, iron and a hair dryer are all in the room.staff so helpful and mannerly all the time.we had a fantastic stay in these apartments and I would highly recommende them to anyone going to new York city.

title: Location, Location....
text:
Stayed here for 6 nights on the 6th floor. Room 603 gave us a view across W49th St to the adjacent office workers; it gave us traffic and sirens most of the time; it had heating and cooling issues most of the time and the whole apartment measured about 6.5m by 4.5m BUT I loved being there.
5 wminutes walk to Times Square, 5 minutes to the subway, 10 paces to the nearest deli and across the street from the front door to ‘Hale and Hearty’ for lunch of delicious soups and about 30 paces to a variety of food carts. Radio City and Top of the Rock entrance about 10 minutes walk. 10-15 minutes walk to many Broadway theatres and did I mention 5 minutes walk to non-stop activity in Times Square.
Apartment had good refrigerator, microwave, stove that appeared never to have been used, a good coffee machine with coffee restocked every day, TV etc. Everything worked. Check-in and out was efficient and reception were always helpful and friendly.
Lifts/ elevators are slow but walking the stairs is good for you. Guest Services on the 2nd floor have a computer and printer free of charge allowing guests to print tickets etc and a vending machine for soft drinks. Receptions has printed sheets for directions to nearest pharmacy/ doctor/ liquor store etc.
Great place to stay for my first visit to NYC.

title: Perfecte locatie
text:
Prijs/kwaliteit heel goed. Goed metrostation op de hoek, broodjes/salades naast de deur. Pizza daarnaast. Perfect. 
Appartement is proper, personeel vriendelijk. En dat op een topplek vlakbij times square. 
Aanrader.

title: We keep coming back
text:
This is our third visit and we will come back again. Fantastic location 1 block from Times Square and 2 blocks from Radio Music Hall and most Broadway shows. Very reasonable price and has a kitchette!! 
 Good for couples or larger units for family or groups.

title: Perfect perfect hotel
text: Best location for the city's top attractions. Walked to Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and subway. Very old time NY 12 story building. Very elegant n nestled between tall building all around. Room has 2 queen size very comfortable beds n a spacious well appointed bathroom. The room was not spacious but adequate. My daughter n I n her 8 and 10 year old daughters found it so comfortable n pristine!! We came from a cruise, left our luggage at the hotel at 10am, parked our car at One Rockefeller parking garage (the one they reccomend) and walked the city in leisure. Came back at 1:30 n they gave us our room. The next morning after check out @11am they graciously kept our luggage while we went to breakfast. Staff could not of been more pleasant n helpful. I will go here again n again. From  Marriott member..I will say u will NOT be disappointed.!!

title: Great stay
text: We stayed in the one bedroom apartment on 7th floor for 3 nights in early november 2018. Location is excellent , lots of restaurants / food carts nearby to eat , the apartment was quiet n looks even better in real than in photos , apartment n bath were absolutlely clean , the housekeeping does a good job.  V good toiletteries n fluffy new towels were provided.  The front desk guys Allan  and Carlos  are  a genuinely warm ,polite , helpful  n courteous guys.Theapartment has a kitchenette with a cooktop/ oven  , microwave , tea coffee sachets , creamer suger all provided. Wi fi works well , we had a comfortable stay n would love to come back here again.

title: NEW YORK
text: It is a good hotel/flat and its location is great!!! Close to Times Square and the Theater District. The rooms has a complete kitchen that allows you to cook anything you want. Basically you just have the breakfast there because on the rest of the day you are visiting the wonderful NYC!!

title: Good and well situated for central Manhattan
text:
The Radio city apartments are just around the corner from Times Square and Radio City itself.  Ideal location for tourists.
The apartment was spacious and had a cooker, fridge freezer microwave, tea coffee making and free WiFi. A good sized lounge,the  bedroom had two double beds - so no shortage of space. 
I would certainly stay again.

title: Perfect location for a short stay
text: These Apartments are QB for a short stay. Location is incredible, staff is nice. Apartments are clean and confortable but need a bit remodeling as furniture is old. But I do recomend the spot as it has a nice price quanlity relations.

title: Excelente
text: Estupenda ubicacion,a media cuadra del metro ,cercano madison SG,biblioteca,estacion central,RKC,restaurantes y tiendas,para caminar y deslumbrase con las luces de la cuidad,personal muy amable,hablan español,habitaciones muy comodas,limpias,no tan amplias pero cumplen con la funcion de un reparador descanso despues de recorrer la ciudad.

title: Mediocre quality rooms in excellent location
text: We stayed here for one night ahead of a tour of NYC.  We are a family of four so we booked a one bedroom we apartment with two queen beds and a sofa bed. It was very expensive for poor to average quality accommodation. The location is excellent, it is literally two minutes walk from Times Square, so is right in the thick of all the action. The room has a reasonably well equipped kitchenette with microwave, fridge, sink etc which was useful. The sofa bed is extremely uncomfortable and has only basic bedding provided. The windows are single glazed so the room is very noisy (and yes I know it’s NY). There is major construction immediately behind the hotel and incredibly noisy digging began at seven am on the dot. I wasn’t impressed and would not recommend, even for families, look elsewhere.

title: Review
text: After discovering Radio City, it has become my go-to place in NYC.  The people are great and the location is hard to beat.  The kitchenettes are terrific as are the living rooms in the one and two bedroom apartments.  It is so much better than the typical cramped hotel rooms you usually fine.  I always recommend it.

title: Idéal pour un séjour au cœur de Manhattan
text: Hôtel appartement situé à deux pas de Time Square et pourtant permettant de bien dormir (nous étions au dernier étage : PHA). La cuisine permet de gérer si on le souhaite des repas dans l’appartement. À noter en vrac  : proximité stations métro, réactivité du personnel et qualité du couchage (excellent pour le lit king size un peu moins bien pour le canapé-lit)

title: Direct @Times Square
text:
pros: location (10/10 actually direct @Times Square), cleanliness (10/10 honestly), enough space for 3-4 adults in the one-bedroom-apartment (except bathroom), comfortable beds
cons: staff could be bit friendlier, very-very noisy (no soundproofing)

title: Excellent location, too noisy
text: We stayed in a two-bedroom apartment on the 8th floor. The apartment was large, with a living-room and kitchen. The bathroom was a little small, but with a bath. The hotel location is absolutely great - a few minutes walk from Time Square and Rockefeller Center. The problem with the hotel is the noise in the room - all connected to the A/C. The old A/C units are noisy, they were installed without proper insulation, and when it rains the rain drops make a terrible noise when they hit the metal plate on the top of the A/C. All these problems could easily be fixed - it would make this hotel a real value!

title: Excellent Location and Stay
text: We stayed here for 3 nights.  This is the perfect location for a city visit.  You can walk to Times Square, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center, and to the subway.  Each unit has a studio sized kitchen.  The rooms are small but comfortable.  There is a small deli right out the door that serves great bagels and breakfast at a reasonable price.  The desk staff at this hotel is very friendly and helpful, as were the cleaning staff.  And all of this is economical compared to other NYC hotels.  Our room was approx $329 per night.  If we return. This will be our home base again....its a gem!

title: Great Location
text: Radio City Aprtments are located 1 block from Times Square and 1 block from Rockefeller center.  Subways were also very close.  Room were very clean and spacious for a NYC room.  The kitchen was an added plus. The staff was friendly and helpful.  There was construction right next door that started in the morning but there always seems to be construction in NYC.  We were generally up anyway as we got an early start so we could explore the city all day.  We have been to NYC several times and never stayed at the same place twice but will definitely stay here again and would definitely recommend it. We booked several rooms at the hotel as our cousins from California and Arizona were meetin us there for 5 days. They had never been to NYC before and were very impressed with the hotel.  The price was also not too high for the location.

title: Absolutely terrible, combative management
text: We were placed in a room we did not book. Then we were woken up to construction at 7am. There was no prior warning by staff or management that we will be woken up while at vacation by construction. We approached management for a refund after our horrible experience. We had to call the manager as he wouldn’t even come downstairs to speak with us.
