The manager was not willing to give us a refund, basically said the construction is not their problem, became combative, swore at us, and even pushed my husband out of his office. We will not recommend this place to any one. This staff and management need to re-evaluate how to properly treat guests. We will be reporting this hotel to bbb.

title: Todo correcto
text:
Ubicación perfecta. Muy cerca de Times square y del metro.
Atención correcta.
Habitaciones cómodas y bien equipadas. 
La opción de apartamento es muy cómoda en Nueva York ya que te da mucha flexibilidad.

title: Top Lage - für Städtetrip ideal
text: Wir haben als Familie (2 Erw./1 Kind) 4 Nächte in einer 1 Bedroom-Suite verbracht. Diese war wohl etwas in die Jahre gekommen, jedoch gross, sauber und gut ausgestattet. Für den Preis an dieser Lage war das Hotel absolut OK und idealer Ausgangspunkt um das Gebiet um den Times Square zu Fuss zu erkunden. Wir würden diese Unterkunft auch ein zweites Mal buchen.

title: A-1  Hotel
text: Couldn't believe how wonderful the Radio City Apts.are. This will always be our go-to spot for lodging in New York. Location is perfect for walking to almost every place you'll want to visit. Room was cleaned every day, bath soap, shampoo, etc. A-1 as were the towels - so soft and absorbent. Loved the kitchen, full size refrigerator, micro, stove w/oven. The in-room safe was a plus along with the ironing board that I NEVER used but it was nice to have just in case. Short walk to Broadway theaters, fantastic restaurants, Radio City Music Hall 1 block away, etc. Price was right also.

title: Hidden Gem
text: Loved my stay here. Friendly, efficient, courteous staff. And one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in all my travels! Safe and comfortable, the self catering facilities in room are immaculate and a welcome luxury you won’t find anywhere else so close to Times Square. Won’t hesitate to stay here again and can’t recommend it enough.

title: What A Find
text: So pleased I booked our family of 5 here for a week.It was perfect for us.Spacious apartment with well stocked kitchen.Housekeeping did a great job.Staff on desk polite and informative.Great location.Loved the sweeties at reception🍬

title: Can't wait to stay here again!
text: The location and beauty of these rooms is excellent. Checking in and out was simple and the front desk workers are friendly. I will be staying here again the next time I travel to New York City. Thanks!

title: Location
text:
Can't lie - I had a good stay here.  Am searching for bad things to say about the place so that it doesn't get overrun by yuppies and so that most of us don't get priced out - lol.  I paid about $100 a night, which is a bargain for the area.

The positives and the negatives about this place are summed up by the word "location".  While six blocks away from 42nd Street, this place is still a block away from the Times Square strip.  If you stay here, you will want to take the subway to 50th Street or find some other way that doesn't take you through Times Square.  Traversing packed Times Square with luggage is not a good idea.  The location also puts you a block from Radio City Music Hall and the NBC Studios.  Other parts of Rockefeller Center as well as MoMA and NY City Center are also not far.

An old, interesting building.  My guess is that it was formerly a condominium and there is a mix of residents and hotel guests presently.  I'm unsure though.

Easy check-in and the hotel staff are very nice.  They answer the phone promptly when you call the front desk too.  Very nice people and I can't say enough good things about the staff.

The room was equipped with a fairly full kitchen and basic cookware/utensils - full size frig, oven/stove, and microwave all provided.  There was a table with two chairs.  TV with HBO.  Bed was comfortable.  A small set of drawers.  Pretty normal bathroom.  No in-room safe but decent deadbolt on the front door of the room.  Everything was clean.  Decor is inoffensive and not trendy.

I'm unsure that this property has an exercise room but I was able to use a location of my gym chain.  (Plus, it's NYC.  Who worries about exercise after walking around the city all day?)

I would stay here again.

title: Good value for midtown Manhattan
text: Nice place to stay if you need apartment like facilities and want to be in midtown. Although dark the rooms are comfortable. I have stayed two times and would consider staying again. Its worth the money compared to other midtown hotel rooms.

title: Great but not during construction
text: This place isn’t flash but it’s location is fantastic, as is the extra room compared to a hotel room. But be warned if you’re staying on a weekday as there is massive construction going on next door, the  noise starts by 7am every morning and it’s incredibly loud, jackhammers etc. Several times we were yelling at each other to be heard. Combined with the super noisy air conditioners. Not very restful or relaxing way to start the day I’m afraid. Wish I’d have known beforehand.

title: Great Location, Great Price
text: recent stay at Radio City Apartments was quite nice....the location is perfect near Times Square and Public transit...easy walks to central park and other attractions. Room was clean and had Fridge, Stove and Sink to help save and reheat meals after dining out...room was small but so are many other rooms in NYC....main selling features were price and cleanliness. Front desk was also very helpful when needed

title: מלון נהדר
text:
התארחנו במלון 12 לילות בחודש ספטמבר. מיקום המלון מרכזי מאוד, קרוב להרבה אטרקציות ולקווי סבוואי שונים. המבנה די ישן אך מתוחזק טוב. חדרים מרווחים ונוחים וכוללים מטבח מלא. היינו בדירה של חדר שינה וסלון. המיטות היו טובות, מטבח נוח, חדר רחצה נקי. כל יום מנקים את החדר, מסדרים מיטות, מחליפים פחים. מגבות בשפע, מחליפים כל יום. בקומה תחתונה יש מכונות כביסה ומייבש שניתן להשתמש בהם. בדלפק הקבלה נחמדים ושרותיים מאוד. 
אני ממליצה על המלון, במיוחד נוח למשפחות.

title: Good location and good configuration for our family
text: I chose the Radio City Apartments primarily for their location next to 1221 Avenue of the Americas, where I had a business meeting. The rooms are not fancy but they're a sufficient size. Because the living room/kitchenette was separate from the bedroom, we were able to put our toddler in a crib in the living room. The window-unit A/C was kinda noisy, as was the active construction site behind the hotel. Overall, this is probably a good hotel for budget travelers, especially people traveling in groups and those who would make use of the kitchenette.

title: Great place to stay.
text: Radio City Apartments is centrally located in Times Square close to many of the main tourist attractions. A 10 mins walk to 8th Ave where you will find great restaurants to eat, as well as around the hotel. The kitchenette is well appointed with everything you need to cook a meal. The bathroom has wonderful really hot water, which after a long day of sight seeing is greatly appreciated. The bed is very comfortable also. The only thing I don’t like is the air conditioner is very loud. As we couldn’t open a window this had to be left running, and disturbed our sleep.

title: Excellent location of Times Square
text: Stayed in a two bedroom apartment, all beds were double with three in total. Air conditioning was great, plenty of towels that were changed on a daily basis and good hairdryer. Kitchen had everything you needed (kettle, toaster, microwave, cooker). No safe in the room but safe deposit box which was accessed by a key held by you and another held by reception. Location was perfect, only a short walk to Times Square but the location meant you were not disturbed by noise or traffic. Would highly recommend.

title: Impecable
text: A solo media cuadra de la 7ma Av., a mts del Times Square es el mejor lugar para quedarse en NYC si no conocés la ciudad. A metros del subte y cercano a la 5th. Av., a una cuadra del Rockefeller Center...lugar ideal. Radio City es un edificio un tanto antiguo pero siempre con gente con buena onda y una de las cosas más importantes es el espacio de los departamentos, son muy cómodos, disponen de kitchinet con comedor / living, cómodo. A pesar de los años q tiene está muy bien mantenido y con empleados muy cordiales y resolutivos. Ideal para quien no conoce la city y quiere estar en el medio de todo. También pese a la ubicación es silencioso.

title: Location, location, location!
text:
Couldn't have been better! 1 bedroom apt with 2 double beds in bedroom and double sofa bed in other room. Kitchen, bathroom - all spotlessly clean, fresh towels and toiletries. Lovely friendly staff.  Yes, the decor is old and dated but who cares - it's clean and so convenient.

Great breakfast place and pizza place next door. Couldn't ask for better location. Building site beside us - after three very early 'morning calls', managed to sleep through the noise for the rest of the holiday!

So glad I chose Radio City Apartments.  We'll be back.

title: 設備が古いけどそれ以外は最高
text:
8月に2名ツインルームに3泊しました。総じてまた泊まりたいと思いました。
☆よかったところ
好立地、外の騒音なし、広い、レンジ冷蔵庫がある（この後にとまったホテルにはなかった）、バスタブあり、テーブルもあって食事しやすい、これでなら料金は安いと思う、深夜限定で洗濯機＆乾燥機が使える（意外に使えるホテルやコインランドリーは少ないです）
☆悪かったところ
設備がすべて古い（初日からドライヤーから焦げるにおいがして連絡するとすぐに交換してくれました、ドアの鍵は口コミどおり難しい…）エアコンがすごい音でした（ほとんどつけなかったので問題なかったけど猛暑だとつらいかも）
おいてあった石鹸は洗い流してもぬるぬるして使えない…、流しから熱湯しかでなくて皿が洗えない
マイナスコメントが多くなってしまいましたが、なんだかんだでよかったです。

title: New lodging option in NYC
text: We visit NYC annually and our standard lodging was booked and found Radio City Apts thru Trip Advisor. We were very pleased with this property. It is situated in the middle of everything. We were able to visit Mid town and also walk to the Village as well as Central Park. The property is very well maintained and very affordable. And their is a kitchenette in the rooms. Plus they offer discounted parking at nearby garages. This is an excellent option for NYC visitors.

title: Great Stay in NYC
text: We were a travelling party of 4 adults who booked an Apartment for 7 days. We found the Staff to be friendly and helpful and the apartments were great.. not large but adequate for our needs. We were able to have our breakfasts in our Apartments before heading out on a full day of sight seeing. We found the location of  Radio City to be ideal...walking distance to lots of places. The Apartment was serviced every day with an abundance of fresh towels.We would not hesitate to reccomend staying here whilst in New YOrk.

title: Excelente ubicación y muy cómodos
text:
me hospede en el mes de Agosto. Primero había contratado un studio queen, que si bien estaba super equipado nos pareció excesivamente pequeño. Gracias a la amabilidad del encargado Javier, nos cambiaron al día siguiente a un departamento con una habitación y un living comedor con cocina. Excelente! muy amplio, cómodo, equipado y funcional. La atencion siempre excelente, todos muy bien dispuestos y ademas reciben los paquetes de compras x internet sin cargo. 
La ubicación del hotel es inmejorable: a dos cuadras de times square, a 2 de la quinta avenida y a 5 o 6 del central park. hay todo tipo de restaurants y negocios de comida al paso, así como un supermercado muy cerca. Excelente relación calidad precio. Para tener en cuenta!

title: 2’ tappa NY City
text: Hotel/apartments nel senso che le camere sono in pratica dei monolocali con angolo cottura con elettrodomestici praticamente nuovi e pulitissimi. Posizione perfetta, Times Square dietro l’angolo. Bus station sulla 44’ raggiungibile a piedi con trolley in 10’. Stazione metro sotto l’hotel. Pulizia buona. Rapporto qualità prezzo buono. Camere silenziosi (unico ns. inconveniente un vicino cantiere che si avviava alle 7,30 in punto un po’ rumoroso. Per il resto tutto ok e consigliatissimo.

title: Good Value for the Money
text: Room was more than adequate. Plenty of towels. Everything clean. Kitchenette was useful. The only thing I would change is the noise outside. We were on the eighth floor and construction outside started at 7AM. Parking was a relative bargain, by NYC standards.

title: Unbelievable great 👍👍👍
text: Front desk staff was overly friendly helpful and quick to get our room. The room was beautiful the view was beautiful from the hotel room. Seconds to walk to time square restaurants and bars everything you want to do is right there. I can’t say how great the staff was in words. Jaime Javier Tim.  Those are the names I remember. But holy cow I’ve been to the city many many times and this was by far the best hotel experience I’ve ever had

title: quattro passi a manhattan
text: Piacevole soggiorno presso questa struttura, dotata dei confort di un albergo ma con la comodita' di un piccolo appartamento da gestire  ... e poi proprio nel cuore di Manhattan, a due passi da TIMES SQUARE !

title: Very nice place to stay!
text:
Very nice place to stay. It’s affordable and perfect location. Definitely a place to stay again and 100% recommend to all friends. 
Friendly Staff, perfect location, clean rooms, nice kitchen... overall a great place!

title: Perfect location...and very helpful...helped me avoid a massive disaster!!
text:
So first of all I owe the staff here a massive thank you...I left my driving licence here and was due to be hiring a car in Chicago to drive Route 66!!! They have been really helpful forwarding it to me to avoid a total disaster!! 

The location is pretty much perfect for a short break in NYC...5 minutes walk and you are in the middle of Times Square! Perfect! 

As long as you remember that because of where you are it’s unavoidably a little noisy...you won’t be disappointed. 

As a budget option in the centre of NYC...I think you would struggle to find better.

title: Great location
text: Spacious 2 bed apartment in a fantastic central location. Comfortable beds and clean. Only issue is the noisy air conditioning unit but at least this blocked out the road noise! Small bathroom but functional

title: Excellent location, very spacious and comfortable
text: We were a group of 5 - 4 adults and 1 child and we stayed in the 1 bed room apartment. It had 2 queen beds in the bed room and a sofa bed in the living room. The kitchenette was very useful and the actual apartment was really spacious considering it is NYC. I have stayed other popular places near Times square before for more money and less space. Service was good and the staff were polite and helped us out a lot. Its a 2 minute walk to Times Square and a 5 minute walk to Rockefeller centre. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to my friends.

title: Major construction / demolition work at back of the hotel
text: Don’t book this hotel, construction work started before 7am and went on till about 6pm every day. The noise in our apartment was unbearable it was so bad that we could not hear each other talk. We complained on the day of arrival but they could not move us till the following day which is an unacceptable inconvenience for a short city break. We spoke to the manager who offered us a 10% discount and was extremely rude to us when we did not immediately accept this. Apart from that the apartment was very basic, dated and in need of major renovation.

title: L emplacement et uniquement cela
text: Je mets médiocre car hormis l emplacement qui est juste parfait le reste bas y'a rien.  Le personnel peu aimable peu serviable....la chambre au 2eme étage face à des travaux de construction.  Réveil tout les jours au son du marteau piqueur...a 7h. Pas de double vitrage....  La propreté comment dire bas c est pas ça. J ai découvert des cheveux des précédents occupants de la chambre encore sur les murs de la douche, chambre très poussiéreuse.  Bon voilà je n y retournerai pas et je recommande pas. Vraiment moyen

title: Great location, comfortable hotel.
text:
I booked online and really had no idea what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised to find a well established, convenient hotel. 
I am traveling with my hubby & 3 kids so it can be quite difficult to find suitable accommodation for the 5 of us. 
Room was all we needed. Two double beds and a sofa bed plus kitchen. Housekeeping provided every day.
Only disappointment was the construction site right outside the window. Soooo loud from 7am.

title: Holiday stay
text: Just what we needed.  It’s right in the centre of Manhattan so it’s easy and quick to get to virtually everywhere.  The staff were most helpful and the apartment both clean and comfortable.  The air con is a most in August!

title: Great Place to stay!
text: Just returned from a one week stay in a two queen bed with sofa bed kitchen unit. It was perfect for our family of four including our teenagers. The beds were firm but we found them comfortable. The bathroom is accessible through the bedroom. Towels were plentiful. I read reviews that the hotel was dated however I think it was updated but kept the brownish/rust colored furnishings of older times. Housekeeping kept our room clean however they did not do the dishes. I would have washed the dishes prior to using them had I known this.  Kitchen soap, sponge and towel were provided. The air conditioner in the bedroom was loud but it managed to drown out the noise of the city streets. The living room area had a separate air conditioner that was quiet so the outside noises could be heard throughout the night. There  was a full size refrigerator/freezer, small oven/cooktop, microwave, and  coffee maker. The hotel provided umbrellas for the brief showers were encountered. I did a load of laundry in the basement ($1.75 I think, bring your quarters!) The housekeepers use the dryers and they kindly removed the towels so I could dry my load. All the staff were very pleasant. We ate a very reasonably priced (for NYC) breakfast at Toasties two doors down. Be sure and check this place out. It was always busy with local business workers. Subway station was on the corner, Times Square around the corner, Rockefeller Plaza two blocks down. We enjoyed having two rooms to spread out and was well worth the added expense.

title: Attention à votre réservation
text:
Arrivée à l'hôtel, on nous fait payer une 2ème fois notre séjour de 9 nuits alors que tout était soldé à l'agence de voyage 1 mois avant le départ ! Pas un mot de français de la part du personnel....
Ils nous disent ne pas avoir reçu l'argent de la part de l'agence de voyage....
Un conseil : augmenter le plafond de votre carte bleu avant le départ sinon vous risquez d'être bloqués à New-York sans argent ! L'agence nous a remboursé , des désagréments dont on se passerai bien !

title: Hôtel très bien situé mais bruyant
text: Nous sommes restés 4 nuits dans cet appartement 2 adultes et 3 enfants. La chambre est bien équipée par contre la climatisation est tres bruyante . Même éteinte il y avait celle de dehors une soufflerie en permanence. Les lits sont très mous du coup si vous dormez à deux si l'un bouge vous réveillez l'autre! L'hôtel est très bien situé à deux pas du métro en plein Time square.

title: Great location
text:
I recently returned from a 7 night stay at Radio City apartments. It's in a great location, around the corner from Times Square & on the same street as the Rockafeller centre, everything is easily within walking distance, except downtown obviously! Staff are friendly & helpful. I stayed in a deluxe double room, as staying with my son, on the 2nd floor. The decor is dated but fits in with the style of the hotel. The room was clean & the room was cleaned every day that we stayed.
The only niggle I had with the room was that when the air conditioning was switched off, I could still hear a fan running, which was noisy. I don't know if the hotel can do anything with the windows, as it sounded like a window was permanently open (which it wasn't).
There is also a construction site directly behind the hotel, I know this isn't the hotels fault, but they start work at 7.00am, so no chance of a lie in during the week!

title: Presque parfait mais bruyant
text:
Nous avons été agréablement surpris par la taille de l’appartement en plein time square. L’appartement était très propre et le ménage est fait tous les jours. Les employés sont très gentils et disponibles.
Le métro et plusieurs supérettes (je vous conseille morton williams dans la 57ave)sont juste à côté de l’appartement .
Le point négatif était le bruit ( un chantier juste sous nos fenêtres qui commence à 7h tous les matins )

title: 立地は抜群です
text:
2018年8月に宿泊しました。スタッフは特に親切でもなく普通です。高級ホテルでないので多くは期待できません。立地はすごく便利なところで、ブロードウェイ、タイムズスクエア、五番街など徒歩10分程度です。
玄関前の49通りを左に進んで8番街に当たる交差点（徒歩７分位）にFood Emporiumという比較的大きなスーパーがあり、そこで食材やら雑貨を買い込みました。日本食コーナーもあってお寿司も売ってます。
部屋の窓からの景色は期待しない方が良いです（隣のビルの壁とかでした）。
熱いお湯が豊富に出て浴槽は浅いですが、ゆっくり入浴できました。台所用品も新しいのが揃っていて、
持参したインスタントラーメン、レトルト食品で食事ができました。

title: bad hotel
text:
מלון גרוע ישן  מלוכלך המון רעש ריח רע בכל המלון מזגן מרעיש  בשעה 8 בבוקר כבר מתעוררים מרעש של העבודות ברחוב התמונות ממש לא דומות למציאות  לא מצדיק את המחיר החדרים הבודדים הם ממש קטנים 
לא מומלץ לא להתקרב למלון יש הרבה מלונות יןתר טובים באזור באותו המחיר זה אפילו לא רמה של מוטל
היתרון היחידי הוא הקרבה לטימס סקוור

title: Honest Review of our Wonderful Visit
text:
I was a little hesitant reading some of the iffy reviews but decided to book anyway and see what happens.  We had a two bedroom apartment and it was NOT dated.  Beautiful sofa and furniture with comfortable beds and pillows.  Everything was exceptionally clean.  Many towels and toiletries in the bathroom. We ate many takeout meals around the table and if you want to use it they have a modern spotless kitchen.  
The location can not be beat.  Just a hop skip and jump to anywhere!
The front desk personnel were friendly, polite and helpful.  
We asked for a room away from the construction noise we had read about.  We were toward the front but as others have stated it starts at 7AM and even with ear plugs and white noise machine you will hear it.  We were usually tired so we went to bed early and did not mind too much as the Radio City Apartments were an excellent choice. 
Be sure to try Toasties for breakfast or lunch as well as the Radio City Pizza that sells by the slice.
Don't hesitate to stay here, you will love it!

title: Quirky older building
text: Being an older building in the middle of NYC and Time Squares modern city vibe was all part of my experience as a first timer in NY. The building is beautiful inside and out. Location is excellent and close to a subway and bus station to take you most places. It is a serviced apartment building not a motel so has full cooking facilities. Loved it.

title: Cerca de todo, muy recomendable.
text: Deptos totalmente equipados, vajilla y elementos de cocina, baño amplio, muy còmodo con todo lo necesario. las camas muy confortables. Nos alojamos en un depto con dos camas matrimoniales, vista contrafrente lo cual facilitò el silencio para poder descansar bien. Esta a 2 cuadras de Times Square y a 1 de Broadway. en la misma cuadra hay restaurantes y casas de comida para todos los gustos. en la esquina esà el metro. Mejor imposible! ademà tiene servicio de limpieza todos los dìas y si necesitàs lavar ropa en el subsuelo lo podes hacer por pocos dolares.El personal es muy amable y bien predispuesto. los días de lluvia ofrecen paraguas gratis a todos los huéspedes. Buena relaciòpn precio calidad, ubicaciòn inmejorable teniendo en cuenta los precios para alojarse en Manhattan.

title: Dated but clean and great location.
text:
Chose the accommodation for its location and its price. We had a 1 bed apartment which slept our party of 5 . There is a small kitchen with full size fridge with a freezer compartment which we used but didn't use the rest of the kitchen. There's TV in the main room and in the bedroom The bathroom is tiny but clean and functional. The whole appearance of the apartment was a little dated but were were pleased with everything We found the hairdryer wasn't working and a maintenance guy had it replaced immediately,
The location was perfect- just a 5 minute walk to Times Square and the Rockefeller centre. Would I stay there again ? - Yes definitely.

title: Ideal
text:
Fue mi primer viaje sola y este hotel es ideal para ir a ver obras ya que está muy cerca de los teatros. Es muy céntrico y era excelente poder contar con heladera y microondas. La habitación muy grande. 
Muy buena base para recorrer Nueva York. 
Terminaba de ver las obras a la noche y me volvía caminando. Tiene un supermercado a dos cuadras y durante mi estadía recibieron los paquetes que me llevaban súper bien.
Gracias por todo!!

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: Radio City Apartments is in a convenient location to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Broadway plays, restaurants and subways.  We had a queen bed suite and it had a kitchenette that included a refrigerator, microwave, coffee and tea pots, stove/oven and cooking/eating utensils.  This is an older hotel, but is kept up nicely and our room was clean and comfortable.  The front desk was very helpful in answering any questions and also in scheduling a car to take us to JFK.  Our friends booked a room there also and they gave us rooms near each other on the same floor. Our friends had booked a larger 1 bedroom suite. I would stay there again.

title: Good central base for a week
text:
We stayed in a two bedroom apartment. We enjoyed having the space that gave us as a family. The apartment was very clean. We had a blocked toilet on arrival. When we phoned reception someone came straight up. It didn’t solve it though so we had to have a second visit the next day, this time Felice (sorry if spelled wrong) left us the plunger, which we did have to use as it blocked with little encouragement. The filter coffee machine was also broken, but Felice found me another one. On two days out of six our apartment wasn’t serviced. The day after the first time I mentioned this to reception, only as we were heading out then and to make sure they did it that day. The guy on the desk immediately phoned housekeeping and told me it’s because the sign on the door said do not disturb. This wasn’t the case, but he was brusque and having none of it. I didn’t bother mentioning the second time. We were out between 10 and 4, so there should have been ample time. When the rooms were serviced, they did a good job making the place very clean and tidy. 

We were very glad of the location, it made it as easy as possible to get around with a choice of nearby subway stations and plenty within walking distance. The location does mean there is a lot of noise. The apartments are not well sound-proofed to the street noises. The air-con consists of units embedded in the lower part of each window in each room. They cool effectively but destroy the integrity of the double glazing so sound proofing is minimal. We were on the 9th floor and glad we were no lower. There is also building work going on nearby which starts at 7am until about 5pm. It is intrusively loud during those hours. It would be wise to check before booking whether it will be finished before your trip. 

The apartment was just as it looked in the pictures, but I agree with other reviewers who have commented on the need for an update. The decor didn’t bother me, but I think the place needs maintenance so it all works as it should. 

Beds were comfy, sofa not so much. My kids called it the whoopee cushion sofa due to the noises it made when you sat down on it. Big fridge with freezer, which was great. Kettle on a gas hob. Good lighting options in each room. Shower over bath, didn’t try a bath but it was very shallow. Shower was effective although seemed to be not much hot water last thing at night, although plentiful in the mornings. 

Front desk were helpful in booking us a cab for the airport although wouldn’t let me pay the bill the night before our early start.

title: Like at home
text: Excellent location. They are small apartments with everything one may need. It gives the possibility of eating there Ideal for groups or families. Very friendly staff and always willing to solve any inconvenient. Always thinking about the guest .. One day it rained and there were umbrellas for each one. A few meters from T Square and Rockefeller Center. In the corner the subway takes you to any part of the city.

title: Old apartment, but, great location. No major complaint
text:
Among very pricey NY hotels, this place offers a reasonable price at the great location near Times Square. This is one of old hotels standing in many decades, therefore, its facility is definitely old and its style is nothing more than utility type. 

But location and price - that is what matters to many tourists visiting NY. 
No major complaint. 

Do I come back again? Hmmm, maybe, if there is no other good options.

title: Good location near Time Square
text: The hotel is lterally a block away from the Time Square. It's in a walking distance from the Rockefeller center as well. The hotel room was quite large for NYC. It had a refrigerator, stove, toaster, some pots and pans, utensils, iron  board. The sheets looked yellow and old. The room itself was outdated. The carpet looked old and dirty. You get what you pay for. It's a good room if you don't have high expectations.

title: EXCELENTE LOCALIZACAO
text: O Hotel e pequeno, mas bem cuidado e com excelente acomodação , o local e bem perto da Time square, 5 minutos a pe , ao lado do Top of the Rock. Tem varios lugares ao redor para comer e tomar cafe . Para quem quer pagar pouco pelo cafe no quarto e so ir na times square  que tem um Walgrens com bons precos

title: Physical Brawl between Hotel Staff in the Lobby NOT Acceptable
text: We have stayed here before, and were pleased with our prior experiences enough to come back; however after witnessing a physical altercation between hotel staff in the lobby around midnight on 21 July, I can’t imagine how this hotel could justify our return.  My teenage son walked into the lobby first, in time to witness the desk clerk in a headlock.  Seconds later, I literally had to jump out of the way as the desk clerk was thrown to the ground.  At first I thought the desk clerk was being attacked by someone off the street, but then I realized his opponent was an employee also.  In addition to my family, the altercation was witnessed by a group of young ladies who were terrified to enter the lobby while trying to get to their room.  After the altercation turned into a finger-poking, face-to-face screaming match, our two groups managed to slip by to the elevator, seemingly unnoticed by the two employees still shouting at each other.  Other than the fight our stay was good, so hopefully this hotel resolves their staff anger management issues before it escalates.  The rooms were decent size for NYC, and clean.  No issues there.  Location is excellent.  Other than the midnight brawl the staff was very helpful.

title: Ideal location for NYC mini-break.
text:
After TripAdvisor and personal recommendations, I was very happy we booked Radio City Appartments for a long anticipated sisters' mini-break to NYC. Location is fanatic, right in the heart of midtown and in walking distance of most of the must see sights. Hotel itself is charming, good value in comparison to nearby hotels and our room was surprisingly big by NYC standards. It was great having the living area space for all our luggage and shopping, as well as the kitchenette for breakfast/water etc. Staff are very friendly. 

Only negative is that at checkout they had already processed our bill on the card we provided for security, which they said wouldn't happen and we had planned to use a prepaid credit card we shared for our visit. But we were then informed they don't accept prepaid credit cards, which was very inconvenient, especially as we had been able to use it everywhere else throughout the city. Luckily we had an alternative card to use, but thought it best to add this to the review in case someone else gets caught out.

title: Excellent Apartment
text: We really enjoyed our stay in this clean, well equipped, and immaculately maintained apartment. The location was brilliant for exploring all of Manhattan, close to Times Square with easy access to a subway station.

title: Om de hoek is time square
text:
Perfecte locatie en niet duur voor het ruime appartement. 
Wel bijzonder dat wc papier niet mag worden doorgespoeld anders, raakt wc verstopt. Dicht bij de metro op 75 meter en veel restaurants dichtbij. 
Ook vlak bij de rockefeller toren,wat echt een aanrader is.

title: 可怕的经历
text: 酒店门口在夜间施工状态，巨大的钻机吵得心脏吃不消。如果一定要住记得带耳塞。最糟糕的一次住宿经历，如果提前知道有施工肯定不会定。

title: Great place to stay in New York city
text: Love this place, clean and central to the downtown area.  Attractions, tours, hop on hop off all so close and countless places to eat. A definite gem.  The staff are great and the room are clean. Love the little kitchenette for morning snacks and a quick bit

title: Excelente
text:
Hotel espectacular por las comodidades que brinda. Departamentos con cocina completa, baños , comedor y zona de estar muy amplios en el corazón de NYC. Muy luminoso, tranquilo y limpios.  Muchas ventanas, camas muy cómodas. ,
Todos hablan español.

title: Good as always but noisy
text:
This is the third time I stay at Radio City. Is very convenient and reasonably priced, a bit too close to Time Square and all the crowds. The walkway has been repaired and there are not so many street sellers by the hotel. As there are always constructions nearby at 6 am I woke up due to the noise.
Would return for all the pros, specially you can fix yourself breakfast or a light meal

title: Great location
text: Location was the best . We walked to everything we wanted to see . Only used the Subway once .  Service was great . Room had everything we needed . Hotel could use some updating . Would stay again with my family .

title: We always stay here
text:
It’s reasonably priced and close to everything - 5th Ave shopping, Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, and lots of subways.  

Fairly busy area but we always feel safe, lots of food options.  

The lobby is amazing, well lit, fresh flowers give a pleasant aroma. 

The rooms are decent but not updated.  Still clean but this is definitely not fancy if you require white walls and new mattresses.  The elevator is small and slow so we ended up taking the stairs up and down a lot.  The staff are very friendly as well!

Definitely stay again!!

title: Excelente lugar
text: Un lugar ideal, cerca del subte, limpio, seguro, hablan español, precio accesible, amables y cordiales. Si tenes que elegir un lugar donde poder descansar, ser asesorado y bien tratado, no dudes del Radio City.

title: Excelente ubicacion
text:
Sin dudas es una excelente opción para aquellos que quieren estar en pleno corazón de Time Square.
Segunda estadia y repetiria una y mil veces mas.
Practico para conectar con el subte, ya que en ambas esquinas pasan varias lineas.
Nada de lujos, pero muy confortable, buena cama, ducha y la kitchenette que es indispensable para aquellos que buscan algo más descontracturado que un hotel.

title: Nice position, nice apartment
text:
We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment here and the apartment is nicely furnished and even the pull out bed was very comfortable. Very well located just a block back from Times Square and within walking distance to all Broadway theatres and all attractions in central Manhattan. There was construction going on immediately outside our window and upon request we were immediately moved to another apartment which was great. 
Overall really great, would highly recommend, just thought there would be a fraction more “polish” given the cost.

title: Ideal para familias.
text: Excelente ubicación, muy buenas instalaciones sobre todo los penthouse. Edificio antiguo pero confortable a pasos de Times Square. Encontramos nuestro lugar en NYC. 2 cosas para revertir, los recepcionistas correctos pero con poca disposición, y los ascensores solo 2 y con largas esperas. El resto 10/10

title: The best hotel in NY
text:
The service is awesome, people at the front desk are always helping, the speak english and spanish. The rooms have enough space and very clean. 
They are in the middle of everything, great hotel!! Very close to Times Square, Rockefeller, central park.

title: Radio City Apartments
text: Convenient downtown location in walking distance of amenities and attractions. Afforded opportunity for girlfriends to share a space together. Friendly, accommodating staff. Reasonably priced. Older building, the two elevators are slow and small.

title: Historical Hotel in Close Proximity to Times Square
text: Not a great option for Parking - but you  have options. If you park at the Rockefeller Centre - ensure you retrieve documentation from front desk BEFORE you leave. Otherwise that's $60USD a night my friends. The room was small but relatively clean. They actually use real keys! And the elevator...oh man this place is ancient BUT that's what makes it special. My only qualm was the scent in the hallway. Otherwise, it was the less costly of the other options and I have no regrets.

title: Great location, nice staff, good choice for NYC hotel
text: I did a lot of research before choosing Radio City Apartments, checking out hotels on multiple websites and reading reviews.  Radio City Apartments got good reviews and had very competitive rates, so I went with it and it was a great choice.  Rooms were very clean, and the kitchenettes were nicely stocked with cups, silverware, glasses, etc.  Front desk people were super nice and helpful.  The first room I was given was over a pretty loud street, so I asked for a quieter room and was immediately given one that was much quieter, and with windows that open, which I really like for a bit of fresh air.  The Apartments are located a few blocks from subway lines, and a 5-minute walk from Times Square.  Easy to walk all over NYC from the location, or grab the subway back.  Highly recommend Radio City Apartments!

title: Two Star Motel
text:
I was super excited to stay directly in Times Square and this hotel had great reviews for a decent price but it did not reach any of my expectations.  When we got there the outside looked charming and check-in was a breeze.  We entered the elevator which wasn't air conditioned and then walked to our room through a non-air-conditioned hallway.  Our room looked like something out of a scary movie.  My husband thought it just looked old but I was nervous to even spend the night.  For the extra $100 I would have stayed at a much nicer hotel to enjoy the city.  There was no closet to hang our nice clothes from a wedding we just attended.  The bathroom was so small with no place for a hair straightener or even a toothbrush.  The bedding appears to be 30 plus years old and the carpets were even older.  

We used the Rockefeller Garage and the guys at the front desk gave us the wrong voucher at check out after confirming the specific garage we were parked at.  My husband then had to walk back to the hotel once the garage folks let us know that the voucher we had wasn't valid there. When my husband ran back to the front desk, the guys acknowledged the mistake but didn't want to walk to the office to get the correct voucher which saved us $25.  After some pushing they grabbed the voucher for us.  

Great location but I honestly wouldn't stay here again.

title: Ideal con familia
text: Un hotel ideal si viajas con familia especialmente con niños pequeños, muy cerca a times square, y cerca a todo, el departamento con todo lo necesario, una cocina completa, limpio todo, muy útil, lo unico para mi fue que no funcionaba correctamente el aire acondicionado del living...

title: Loved this Place will stay again
text: So close to everything.  Very safe!  Hotel staff very helpful and accommodating.  The maid service was spot on.  The apartment was very very clean!! (My favorite part).  We had a suite (2 queens and sofa).  It was more than enough room for the three of us.  I would stay here again and again.

title: Recomendable
text: Cerca de todo a pasos de Times Square, cómodo , limpio , con wifi gratuito y caja de seguridad en la habitación , cocina completa y buen precio. Recomiendo reservar con bastante tiempo ya que es muy buscado

title: Convenient and nice place to stay
text: Recently stayed here for a short stay over one night only. The staff we encountered were very pleasant and accommodating. I like the fact that they took our luggage so that we did not need to carry it around the city all day as our room was not ready when we arrive. The room is just as I expected based on the reviews. It was a bit older decor  but was very clean and roomy. My only complaint was the window air conditioner was very noisy so in order to hear the TV you had to have the volume high . Although we did not use the kitchen it was well stocked with dishes/pot/toaster/ microwave and full stove. The location was excellent which is one reason we decided on staying there .

title: Second stay as great as the first.
text: First off, you can not beat this location; steps away from time square, 5th Ave, and Central park.  Next, the accommodations are spacious, clean, and comfortable.  I made a reservation through booking.com months before our stay and called to verify the room two days prior; no issues.  We were able to check into one of our two rooms early to store our bags and the staff was very welcoming.  I will be back again....

title: Overbooking during a long weekend!
text:
We made a reservation at Radio City apartments for the 25 - 28 May through booking.com two months before our stay. Following our first reservation we made a phone call to Radio City apartments, which confirmed that the reservation was correct. Two days before our stay we send an e-mail through booking.com specifying our arrival time. Radio City apartments confirmed the e-mail and the reservation. 

The same Friday, 25 May 2018, at 4 p.m. when we were already in a bus arriving to NY we got an e-mail from booking mentioning that our reservation was cancelled due to overbooking of Radio City Apartments.

We called the hotel and asked us to avoid going to their hotel (they were already not counting on us since they were already fully booked) and far from apologizing for this situation they just hanged up the phone  and put us through booking.com. They said only they had an IT issue, which seemed strange after having confirmed previously by phone and e-mail our reservation. Booking.com confirmed that the reason was due to overbooking.
 
We are a family with 3 small kids, and we failed to understand how can we only be contacted on the very same day of our arrival with the news that our initial reservation is cancelled due to overbooking.  Unfortunately, we ended up having to find the accommodation ourselves. 

We want to explain our situation so other travelers do not have the same experience. I read in some other comments that we are not the first ones having this experience with this hotel (due to overbooking). Please note that hotels that overbook (like this one) usually  provide their rooms on a first come first serve basis , so far we are still waiting them to provide us a compensation or even to apologize. Terrible service!

title: Quaint
text:
Spend a few days here, staff friendly, rooms not massive and decor a bit dark, but nice new bathrooms, spotlessly clean and central for everything.
Adjoining Italian restaurant if you don't want to vemture far for food. 

Highly recommended.

title: Times Square!
text: My family and I are currently here at Radio City Apartments and we are absolutely loving it. We are so close to everything, especially Times Square. We are staying in  a 2 BR 2 BT apt. It’s very updated and clean. The staff is awesome!.

title: Love this place
text: Excellent location, very reasonable.  And it's really nice to have an apartment to spread out in.  I've stayed her many times.  Not fancy, but very comfortable, and it has all the amenities you need.  A great place.

title: My new favorite place to stay in NYC!
text: I have been to NYC three times before this trip and always stay in a hotel.  6 of my family members decided to travel to NYC this time, and a hotel room for each of us was out of budget. We ended up choosing Radio City Apartments because of the high ratings on TripAdvisor. This is my new favorite place to stay in NYC now! It was within walking distance to Times Square, Broadway shows, Central Park, several restaurants & the subway. In addition, prices are reasonable, the rooms are very clean and large, and customer service was outstanding!

title: Excellent hotel in a good location, would definately recommend!
text:
This is my second stay at radio city apartments and I was even more impressed than the first time I stayed here. The apartments are in a superb location just off times square. I stayed in a one bedroom apartment with three others. The apartment had a spacious seperate dinner/seating area and bathroom. Fresh towels every day if you wanted which was great as it was very warm in NY and we tended to shower at least twice daily. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I have no hesitation in recommending these apartments and will definately book them again!

The decour although new is quite dated and the lifts to the upper floors is not for the faint hearted but honestly I'm just nit picking.

title: Loved it here!
text: We loved our stay at the Radio City Apartments, and will definitely consider staying there next time. #1  location... we were there for Broadway shows and to attend the Tony Awards, and it was conveniently located between Times Square and Radio City Music Hall (and Rockefeller and MoMa and the subway and Central Park, etc) With 3 ladies we got the 1 bedroom apartment, 2 of us each got our own bed in the bedroom and 1 of us took the sleeper sofa in the living area. Plenty of room for all of us. Pretty spacious for NY standards I think. It was great having the  kitchenette with a full size frig (for water and leftovers) and a microwave.  The bathroom is small with only a pedestal sink, which meant 3 women had to be creative getting ready in the morning, but there was a big mirror in the bedroom above the dresser and a big full size mirror just outside the bathroom. Also a kitchen sink to brush teeth, etc. We were supplied with plenty of towels and blankets. Lots of food nearby... Toasties, for a great breakfast. A quick, 'grab a piece of pizza' attached, and Pasta Lovers, a nicer sit down place attached also. And food trucks up and down the street, with the best Philly Cheese steak sandwich at midnight after the Tonys.  We even had a view of the city with this room, but don't know how long that will last...looks like they just tore a building down and are going to be building something there...probably something that will block that view. I can't think of a reason not to stay there.

title: Excellent Location
text: Very convenient location in NY city center.  Walkable distances to Times Square, 5th Avenue, M&M’s World, MoMA Museum, Top of the Rock / Rockefeller Plaza, Broadway theatre, so can enjoy NYC day & night by foot!!

title: Location Location
text:
Great compact accommodation you could hardly beleive that a room so small could be practical but it works  full kitchen great amenities extremly pleasant staff, every thing works well, but the real value is the location  smack bang in the heart of it.
My only tip is that you ask for a room not subject to thr noise omitted from an exhaust fan outside your window.

title: Emplacement idéal
text: Hotel très bien entretenu , chambre petite mais fonctionnelle ,très bonne literie , salle de bain avec baignoire , serviettes utilisées remplacées tout les jours , cuisine complète parfaite pour 2( frigo/congélateur/cuisinière /micro onde ), nécessaire pour faire un café renouvelé également tout les jours , personnel sympa et serviable , nous y retournerons

title: Ottimo!!
text: Vado spesso a New York con la mia famiglia e devo dire che è stata una bella scoperta...centralissimo,ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo...consiglio camera con salotto,personale cordiale e pulizia buona,consiglio soprattutto a chi va per la prima volta

title: Centre of the action
text:
Needed somewhere for 4 adults and one teenager and wanted to stay near the centre of the city. Found these apartments and they were a gem of a discovery. Affordable but right at the heart of Times Square. We stayed in a two bed apartment with a sofa bed in the living area. One bedroom had one double bed and the other bedroom had two doubles. The sofa bed is a double with a good mattress as far as sofa beds go and our 6ft son was happy there for six nights.
There is only one bathroom. There is also a kitchenette area in the main living room but we didn’t use this much as ate out all the time. There are good TVs in both bedrooms and the living area. 
The air con is effective but as they are window units this does allow outside noise to enter the apartment - as we were on the 12th floor this was bearable though. 
There are only two lifts which are quite slow so be prepared to be patient waiting for these. 
The apartment was clean but the decor of the whole place is a little tired. 
The staff on the front desk always acknowledged us when coming or going and provided umbrellas to borrow in the rain (a nice touch).
Overall, we were very happy with our stay here and would happily stay again in the future.

title: What a gem in an amazing location
text: Was travelling to NYC for a family vacation and needed a place where we could try to have my family of 6 in one room.  We found this hotel and were amazed at how reasonable it is. Clean rooms.  Friendly staff.  Perfect spot for my family.  We will definitely book again on future trips to NYC.

title: Encantados con el hotel!!! Para repetir sin dudarlo...
text: Apartamentos en una zona inmejorable... a 2 calles de Times Square y 2 calles del Rockefeller Center... Habitacion espaciosa, con un baño completo con bañera y una mini cocina con todos los servicios; nevera, cocina, horno, microondas, fregadero y el menaje necesario para poder desayunar o cenar en el hotel, lo que supone un gran ahorro a la hora de visitar NY. Todos los dias hacian limpieza de la habitacion y en recepcion siempre encontramos recepcionistas de habla hispana. Sin duda lo recomiendo al 100%... Cando vuelva a la ciudad, repetiré!!!

title: First class
text: Great location, great service, hold bags securely if you arrive early, or on checking out if you have later flight. Will book taxis. Clean tidy habitable. Good a/c. Good facilities. Machine on floor two, follow the signs. Super market and dunkin donuts, left and left again. Pizza place next door great, Chinese next door super fab, Italian next great, Indian restaurant next door also, but not tried. handy for times sq, Rockefeller, central library, Grand central station. Metro handy. Plaza cross the road for sitting out. Beyond that more foodie places. Cannot fault this place :)

title: As always---PERFECTION!
text: I have been lucky enough to stay in Radio City Apartments several times.  Just last week I returned from a 7 night stay.  Again, the room was spacious, clean, had all amenities needed!  The housekeeping ladies were so kind, courteous and sweet!  This is a great location ---close to Times Square but not the noise and close to Rock Center!  This will always be my "go to" place to stay.  Thank you Tina and Radio City Apt. for another great visit---hope to be able to come again!

title: Short stay, great experience!
text: Arrived early and was upgraded to penthouse apartment since it was available and this is how Radio City Apartments could provide me with early check-in. Just goes to show how well they try to care for their guests. Great apartment, great location, great service, great value. Only stayed 1 night but overall great experience and will come back next time in NY.

title: Mi casa en Manhattan
text: Es un lugar al que voy hace mas de diez años. Tiene todo para una buena estancia. Ubicacion excelente. Cerca de todo y del supermercado food emporium.  Ademas de todos los negocios cerca y sitios para comer. Los departamentos son amplios, comodos, permiten desayunar ya que tienen vajilla, cocina y heladera. Y microondas. La atencion de su personal es excelente. Y se pueden hacer envios de comprar sin que se cobre un extra por cada paquete. Cada vez que vuelvo s nueva york me hospedo alli.  De elegir, los,one bedroom con dos camas queen. Son mas grandes y los mejores los de la calle o del fndo. No los del medio que son los,oscuros.  En primer piso maquina con latas de bebidas y en subsuelo maquinas para lavar y secar ropa.  Completo alojamiento

title: Very good considering the location
text: I did a lot of research before selecting this hotel. I couldn’t afford a lot of the higher end hotels in the area. This hotel had it all. No extra frills, but clean, reliable, and very conveniently located. Staff is super friendly, kitchenettes are a very economical way to see New York, and you can do your own laundry for $1.75 in the basement. You cannot go wrong with this hotel. Walk to everything!

title: Excelente estadia y cerca de todo
text:
Excelente eleccion para visitar Manhattan, a  una cuadra de Rockefeller Centre, dos de Time Square, en el distrito de los teatros, con el subte en la esquina.
El personal super atento, si bien el studio era chico, estabamos comodos y tenia de todo, 10 en la limpieza, los toallonesy toallas , que cambiaban todos los dias, dejaban siempre abundante cafe, te y azucar. Sin dudas lo volveria a elegir

title: BELLA SORPRESA
text:
Buona collocazione in questo mini appartamento dotato di tutti i confort e soprattutto vicino a Times Square e Rockefeller Center.
Pulito , personale disponibile.
Non troppo caro per essere in centro .
Consigliato

title: Read the entire review- do not just look at the stars I gave and there is good reason
text: There are plusses and minuses. The plusses: If you want to be near to the Broadway theaters, this is a good option. The price is better, for the most part, if you are needing 3 or more beds. Window Acs work well. The kitchen supplies were adequate. It is next door to Radio City Pizza, so you can grab a bite before or after your daily activities. Nice at the front desk. As we stayed there 10 years ago, I was not expecting anything other than an older building with older rooms, but there were significant renovations that were surprisingly nice. I know other reviewers said it is old and needs renovations, and I suppose I could have said that, but there were positive renovations since our last visit. Minuses: Now this is extremely important to me -  cleanliness. The cleaning during our stay was completely inadequate. Might as well have kept the do not disturb sign and let no one in. The only thing that was done daily - clean linens, fresh coffee supplies, beds made up. Floors were never cleaned. Toilet paper roll was empty and not a new one placed. Bathroom definitely not cleaned. The in-room bathroom amenities - I usually leave my items at home and use hotel's-I do not recommend that here - only small shampoos, no conditioner, no lotions. Soap fresh, so-so. I really did not drop the stars to where it really should go, because this place is still a good option, as long as you bring your own bath amenities and either are OK with poor housekeeping or you complain and get it corrected. I just don't like to argue a point with management during my stay.

title: Great location, poor accommodation
text:
On the plus side, the “hotel” is very well located, between Rockefeller Center and Times Square. The staff is also extremely friendly and truly do their best to make your stay pleasant. We had a problem with the TV and they promptly sent someone. Staff st reception was helpful too.
On the negative side, the room was in badly need of renovation, was minuscule, even by New York standards (we had booked a Queen). The pictures on the hotel website are very exaggerated compared to reality! This was the size of a closet and the constant noise from undergoing work was not helping. There appears to be better deals if you agree to live in a pod! That said, if you’re happy to co promise, the location is really terrific.

title: 4 1/2 out of 5. Great for a budget hotel
text:
We stayed a couple of nights and it worked out perfectly. We are fairly experienced travelers and were worried about the price for the location, but the 2 bedroom unit fit our travel needs, So we gave it a shot. Very glad we did.
Our room was clean, the sheets were clean and it had a good small kitchenette and was stocked. The location is fabulous, central to everything. Service was very good. They're a grocery store just a couple of blocks away, a good place for breakfast next door and a hundred choice to eat and see just in the neighboring few blocks.
The hallways could have been a bit cleaner and the hotel could do with some updating, but when you book at this price you know you are not staying at the crown plaza. It more than met our needs and expectations.

title: Ideal familias
text: Lo mejor sin duda la ubicación, estás en pleno times square al lado de roçkefeler y a 15 min andando de central park. Amplios y limpios con todo el menaje y una pizzería de precios baratos para lo que es NY. Puntos para mejorar el personal de recepción es bastante antipático, sin embargo la gente de mantenimiento que trabaja en el hotel son muy agradables. El aire de la habitación tiraba frío por las noches y no pudimos pararlo. El ruido de la calle se filtra mucho en la habitación. Calidad/precio ideal.

title: Presque parfait
text:
Nous avons réservé en août 2017 3 nuits pour 4 personnes.
pièce séjour, cuisine, salon de taille très convenable avec une cuisinière et grand frigo pour cuisiner les repas du petit déjeuner et du soir tres pratique après des journees trepidantes. Cafetière et café fourni. Vaisselle suffisante pour des repas simples. 
Décoration américaine , meuble neuf et papier peint récent : c'est propre et bien entretenu.
chambre à part pas très grande avec 2 grands lits double confortable et possibilité de dormir dans le canapé lit dans le salon si besoin. Salle de bains agréable.

Un accueil un peu froid à notre arrivée.

Le seul défaut est la climatisation qui est un vroumissement continuel et on ne peut pas l'arrêter : boules quiès indispensable et même avec c'est un peu limite.

title: Comodo, muy bien ubicado, sencillo y muy bien atendido
text:
Estuve en este apart 9 noches.
Camas muy comodas. cocina mb equipada, limpio.
Con cafetera y cafe de cortesia que renovaban cada mañana.
Cerca de Times Square, en la esquina esta el subte. En verdad cerca de todo. me resulto muy facil manejarme caminando desde alli a los diferentes puntos de NY
El personal habla castellano lo que me hizo mas facil la estadia.

Sin dudas volveria a alojarme en el

title: Beware of high ratings - Unclean and outdated...
text:
I booked this apartment after reading positive reviews.
But think twice if you do care about cleanliness as a first priority.

1. OLD YELLOW pillows - as soon as you enter the room, you will see yellow pillow on your bed. Maybe you will wonder if its original colors are yellow, but absolutely not. This might remind you of your childhood memory visiting grandpa and grandma house.
I thought about buying substitution pillows from RiteAid or Walgreen, but ended up using my sweaters.

2. Mysterious old elevator - most of the elevator buttons don't light up when you pressed them in the elevator car, or to go down from your floor. You can't even know where the elevator is coming from since there is absolutely no display on each floor. This will be very annoying if you are a busy person or on a business trip.

3. Smell of the room - hard to describe. But it was not a good experience.

title: Great stay!
text: This hotel is very clean with great staff. Reasonable rates. Room was quiet and comfortable. The hotels is centrally located to many sightseeing destinations. Staff was great too! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the city.

title: Theater trip
text: I was a little skeptical that this place was too good to be true but...Booked it anyway when I saw reviews. I am so glad we did! Perfect location for our 2 shows in 3 days. Kitchen was a plus as we had limited time and so many places to see. Easy walking but It's also close to subway, clean, quiet, friendly. And the price was right. Perfect for our short trip! Thanks to all the friendly staff.

title: Un hotel en plein coeur de la ville, emplacement idéal pour les visites. 2 minutes de Times square,4 de Rockfeller et 15
text:
J'ai loué un appartement avec une chambre de 2 grands lits plus un canapé lit dans le sejour cuisine. Appartement 305.Parfaitement situé, chambre au calme sur cour. La literie est tres confortable dans la chambre , par contre pour le canapé lit prévoyez d'y coucher une seule personne sinon peu confortable.Cuisine parfaitement équipée . Ménage réalisé chaque jour avec changement des serviettes et ajout de savon et produits de toilettes.Personnel très aimable et réactif si besoin.Empiruim food sur la 8eme a 5 minutes a pied pour les courses et le traiteur.
Pizza en bas .bref tout pour un séjour de reve!

title: Best location for everything you want to visit
text: We had a two bedroom apartment for two couples.  The apartments are small and have only one bathroom/toilet.  But the location definitely made up for it.  So close to time square and the theatre district.  It was also where the hop on/hop off buses left from that took you to everything you needed to visit. Location made this place perfect.

title: rien à redire sauf le bruit
text:
Notre studio était plutôt 'grand' pour sa situation géographique (Time Square), la kitchenette très pratique et une toute petite salle de bain mais suffisante pour nous. Un petit bémol cependant, les boules Quies sont obligatoires pour pouvoir dormir. Etant donné la situation géographique de l'hôtel (superbement bien placé) mais avec probablement des fenêtres sans double vitrage, le bruit est très mais très présent. 
Si vous supportez les boules Quies pour dormir, allez-y sans hésiter.

title: A great central place to stay.
text: We stayed in a studio apartment for 7 nights from April 3rd. The apartment consisted of  a big double bed, table and 2 chairs, kitchenette and bathroom. It was really clean, with towels and bedlinen changed daily, and sachets of coffee, creamer, sugar and tea bags refrshed daily too. There was a kettle and a coffee maker, cutlery and crockery, plus full cooker, microwave, fridge freezer and a sink. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times, even providing umbrellas to guests on rainy days! The hotel is right in the heart of the theatre district, with 2 subway stops within 5 - 10 minutes walk. (49th street and 50th street stations.) Theres a Whole Foods Market 15 minutes walk away, they do the best chocolate covered pretzels! So many diners nearby, and Times Square right around the corner! Great pizza place next door, and a great breakfast place next door to that. I would definitely recommend, and would definitely stay there again.

title: Fantastic location with olde world charm
text:
Clean room close to everything. It is on a fairly quiet part of the street given Its central location in New York 

Rooms are quite olde world but service is great.  Concierges were excellent in providing tips on trains, taxis etc

Our room did have a safe. 

Rooms cleaned and linen replaced daily, it has a full size fridge and stove with oven plus microwave. Tea and coffee provided. 

Only downside of our room was the noisy aircon ..but saying that it works well.

title: Affordable accommodation in the heart of the action!
text: We have visited NYC many times but this was our first stay at the Radio City Apartments. Clean, comfortable , affordable accommodation in a well-known maintained older building just steps from Times Square and the theatre district. Small kitchenette facilities are a bonus. We will stay here again!

title: Great stay!
text: My family of 4 recently stayed here for 5 nights in April.  Everything was very clean and comfortable.  The location is right next to Times Square and Broadway and steps to the subway.  This is a very central location and perfect for seeing all the sights.  There was also a lot of quick coffee and pastry breakfast places within a block to start the day including Le Pain Quotidien, Pret a Manger, Au Bon Pain, Dunkin Donuts, and Tim Hortons.  There's a plaza shortcut between the blocks to cut through to either 48th or 50th streets to get there easily.  My only complaint is the elevators are small and slow.  If you have a room on a lower floor, just take the stairs.

title: Un parfait sejour
text:
Nous avons passé un excellent séjour en famille dans cet appart hôtel. Le ménage est fait tous les jours, les serviettes changées tous les jours.
Le coin cuisine est très pratique pour se restaurer dans l'appartement. L'accueil est cordial et l'emplacement est au top, a deux pas de times square. Super séjour !

title: Perfect 3 day getaway
text:
Went to see Lion King and needed a hotel in Times Square, this place was perfect. Easy to get to from Grand Central Station and super easy to get to Times Square and Rockefeller Plaza. Very clean and quiet but not a lot of hot water. However that is
 my only complaint!

title: Great location, Comfortable and well equipped
text:
I almost would like to keep this one to myself .    Located just a few steps away from the crowd madness of Times Square you can have a reasonably priced pied a terre. The "studio" is actually a very cleverly designed room that includes a breakfast nook, a fully equipped kitchen and a serviceable bath.  There was a real radiator in the room instead of a noisy air handler.   The room was very clean and all the materials were of good quality. There was traffic noise during busy hours and  intermittent construction clamor during the night but that is part of the New York experience. 
Friendly staff and very easy check in- check out.

title: COMO EN CASA
text: La verdad, nos llevamos una muy buena experiencia con el hotel. La atencion, excelente, siempre predispuestos a nuestros requerimientos y sobre todo en espanol. Cercano a todo, a metros del Times square. El edificio es antiguo pero muy bien mantenido. La habitacion confortable con todos los elementos de cocina elementales. Con caja fuerte en la habitacion. Siempre el servicio de habitacion nos dejaba todo impecable.La relacion costo-beneficio es excelente. Seguramente habra otros hoteles mejores, pero tambine muchisimo mas caros. Por eso, si no quieres pagar tanto y estar bien en NY, este es tu lugar.En definitiva, vayan tranquilos.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Brilliant location and great facilities in the room. Staff were very friendly and helpful especially when our flight home got cancelled and we needed to extend our stay, they didn't use it as an opportunity to take advantage by hiking up the prices. I would really recommend this hotel and I'll definitely be booking it again.

title: Excellent location, super clean apartment and awesome bed.
text:
We stayed for a night in a two bedroom apartment on 8th floor. The apartment was super clean, unexpectedly large and had everything in it. The kitchen was fully equipped with decent dishware and even had trays with ice cubes and bottle openers. In addition, we haven't heard any sound from neighboring apartments which is nice.  
But the main reason I am writing this review is the bed! I slept on a queen bed and the mattress was awesome. My first reaction was fear that I would get shoulder pain in the morning cause mattress is pretty firm (i have a thoracic outlet syndrome and pretty cranky about pillows and mattresses). Next morning I was super fresh and even felt better than after sleeping in my own bed. 
After a while, I contacted the apartments and, to my big surprise, reservation manager Tina got back to me with information about the mattress and even provided the manufacturer phone number. Great service!
I recommend this place to everyone and will definitely get back myself.

title: Ótimo custo benefício
text: Se quer ficar perto de tudo, e não se importa com luxo, é uma boa opção. Ideal pra quem anda o dia todo e só aparece no hotel pra tomar banho e dormir. Não é sofisticado mas bem confortável. Muito perto da Times Square. Fomos à pé até o Chelsea Market pra um lado, e Central Park pro outro. A localização é tão boa que dispensa até o metrô, pra quem tem disposição.

title: Highly Recommend!
text: My friend and I recently stayed at these apartments and were very pleased with our stay - great location and lovely room (we stayed in a studio apartment with 2 twin beds). Rooms were very clean and were cleaned each day with fresh towels supplied. The room also contained a kitchenette which had a stove, hob, microwave, kettle, coffee maker etc. Staff were very nice and helpful. Our flight home was unexpectedly cancelled due to weather conditions and the staff were very helpful to us, allowing us to stay on at the apartment for as long as we needed, at a very reasonable rate. I would highly recommend these apartments and will definitely be staying here again  on my next trip to NYC!

title: Excelente relación precio calidad. Excelente ubicación.
text: El hotel está super bien ubicado, a dos o tres cuadras de Times Square y a 50 mts. del metro y a dos cuadras del Rockefeller Center. Un montón de lugares para comer cerca y para comprar comida (ej. whole foods a tres cuadras). Tiene todo lo necesario y es super limpio. Cocina con horno microondas, café y te de cortesía, utensillos completos, ollas para cocinar, heladera, pava y hasta destapador, todo lo que necesitas para tu estadía. No es de lujo pero está muy muy bien. La gente de recepción es muy amable y en general hablan español. Estuvimos en el piso 7 en un deluxe studio y estaba totalmente renovado a nuevo. Baño completo con ropa blanca excelente, muy buena calefacción, secador de pelo etc., lavavajilla y todo lo que necesitas para tu estadía. La relación precio calidad es muy buena, teniendo en cuenta los precios de nueva york. Especial para ir en familia con niños. Tenía incluso dos plasmas, uno en la habitación y otro en la cocina/living.. Volvería sin dudarlo.

title: Would book here again!
text:
My mom (in her 60s) and I shared a double room on the 11th floor.  (1106)  my biggest fear, after reading reviews, was not being able to control the room's temp/ not having a thermostat.  I nearly cancelled my reservation out of that fear....true story.  BUT---we had a window a/c unit that we had on at all times....never felt uncomfortable with the room's temp!  And both of us normally use a sound machine to sleep at night, so the a/c worked as white noise.  It pretty much drowned out noise from the street as wee as surrounding rooms, as well.  (**Just an FYI: I learned that ALL NYC building from before 1980 have steam heat, thus lack any duct work.  The only option on those buildings is window unit a/c.  Even Jackie O had window units, living in her park ave apartment.   This building is super old and historic, so it too has steam heat/ window units.  )

The beds are a little hard, but i never woke up achey.....have definitely slept on worse.  We had a hairdryer, iron, ironing board, microwave, mini fridge, dishes, utensils, paper towels and dishsoap.  Oh, and a coffee pot....though we bought ours at all the cafes in the area.

This was my 3rd trip to Manhattan but my first time staying in the Times Square/ theatre district.  #1, i think i may have to ALWAYS stay in this area.  If you are planning on seeing a show (or 2!) every day, it is wonderful being at a hotel where you can run back to for a 15 min break before heading to the theatre a block away.  #2 this hotel is the MOST CONVENIENTLY located, affordable hotel.  It is like 2 or 3 blocks straight down 7th avenue to the "red steps" at Times Square.  All 3 of our shows were within 1 block.  And Rockefeller Center is 1 block east down 49th.  It is steps to everything Midtown! 

I would give this place 5 stars if it did 1 thing (or does this count as 3 things?): update the bed spread, bed skirt, and curtains.  Sooooooo not a big deal to me, but the REST of it is updated.  If those 3 things didn't scream 1990's, it would feel extremely high end. (And they'd probably charge more!) But i would absolutely stay here again.

title: Thank you
text: Great place. My  79yr old mum (with the flu) and I arrived from  the Uk,  with friends from the mid-west and Australia due to arrive the next day. We had booked a 2 bed apartment with 4 separate beds, but the travel agent had messed up the booking, booked a studio, and although they'd taken payment for the upgrade hadn't ever got confirmation from radio city. However, Radio city were brilliant, put  us in a 2 bed apartment the first night so we could recover from a long journey. Then the following day, went out of their way to sort it out for us, moved people around and found a way of letting us stay where we were. Staff were delightful. It's a great location, and having a tiny kitchenette is great, because central New York is sooooo expensive. So thank you to the staff on the front desk, you were first class.

title: Solo la ubicación es muy buena
text:
Como todo en NYC sea un lugar carísimo para las condiciones que ofrece. 
Es tipo departamento y con una mini cocina que te permite preñar cosas básicas si viajas con familia. 
Los pasillos y la decoración en general es deprimente   Todo con colores oscuros y una alfombra de dudosa higiene 
La ubicación es increíble. De lo mejor en Nueva York 
El personal de recepción es amable sobre todo el de los turnos nocturnos.

title: Nel cuore di Manhattan
text: Ho soggiornato in un appartamento del Radio City due settimane fa. L’unico inconveniente con il riscaldamento della camera è stato rimediato immediatamente a seguito della segnalazione. Pulizia e cordialità del personale completano la lista dei vantaggi di una struttura a due passi da Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Quinta Strada e comoda alle fermate metro. Il rapporto qualità prezzo fa il resto... consiglio vivamente.

title: Tiny rooms, but great location
text: We only stayed here for one night, and it was reasonably priced for midtown NYC. We (2 people) stayed in a TINY Queen studio with a little sink, microwave and refrig. The bathroom was also small but well-appointed and had plenty of towels. The staff was friendly enough. The hotel was very busy too, people were coming in and out steadily while we were there. The room was noisy because the hallways are narrow, at least on the floor we were staying. It reminded me of the New York apartments you see on "Law and Order." You can hear the goings-on in the room next to you and door slamming across the way. Also, please understand that you will hear street sounds. We were on the 11th floor and still heard traffic, but after a while it becomes background noise. The only complaints I had were that the sheets were really dingy, though they smelled clean. I was kind of put off by that. I also found the mattress to be uncomfortable. All in all, the place is serviceable. No, the hotel is not the most modern but if you are in NYC you probably aren't spending a ton of time in the hotel anyway. It is right in the theatre district so you can walk to just about anywhere and get just about anything.

title: Pro's and Con's
text:
Overall, I'd say this hotel is average to above average. I will say that I'm stunned that so many reviewers before me gave it 5 out of 5.

It's been a while (decades) since I last drove into Manhattan, so I was a little nervous about getting to the hotel, unloading bags, parking, etc. When we pulled up, there were about 2-3 spots right out front, which surprised me. It gave my mother (the person who booked the trip) a chance to run in and talk to the front desk attendant, and I didn't have to stress about being double-parked. That was a bonus.

The hotel works in conjunction with two local garages to offer discounted parking for guests, which is helpful. Still expensive to park for 1-2 days (it's Manhattan, after all), but it's not of control. It cost $70 (total) for 2 days in the Rockefeller Center parking garage, which is a relatively short walk from the hotel.

We had originally booked what I believe was a 2-bedroom suite (or something along those lines). There was an issue that prohibited them from giving us that type of room when we arrived, so they offered two separate rooms for the same price, which we took. We had to wait a little bit to get in (We walked around a little), but they did have us in before regular check-in time, which was appreciated.

We were initially given 1208 and 1211. Only 1208 was ready. OMG. In my opinion, and I'm not over-the-top picky, this room was small and dated. We were stunned, and not in a good way, because this room looked nothing like the pics we had seen online. Wow. The door for 1211 was open as well, and although it appeared to be a bigger room, it was still not what we were expecting. All of this was addressed at the front desk, and they did offer to move us to 704 and 706. Again, this was appreciated, and the difference between these rooms and 1208/1211, was very noticeable. The rooms on the 7th floor (the ones we saw), were way more up-to-date, including the kitchen areas.

The beds were comfortable, and the rooms were relatively clean. No issues to speak of on that front. It was weird because, while it was obvious that money had been spent to upgrade the kitchen and bath areas, the bedding, walls, phones, etc., are in need of a serious upgrade. The thermostat situation was odd as well, mainly because there isn't one to be found. I spent 15 minutes looking for a thermostat in 704, and finally gave up. I opened the window to get some fresh air. There was a window unit (AC) in 1208, but not in either of the 7th floor rooms.

It's a minor thing, but elevators are extremely tiny. Barely enough room for one luggage cart and 1-2 adults. They're slow too, and I ended up walking up and down the stairs on multiple occasions, rather than wait.

The best thing this hotel offers is its location. I mean, it's a 10+. If you make a right and walk 2/3 of a block, you're at Rockefeller Center/Magnolia Bakery/Radio City. If you make a left and walk 1/3 of a block, you're in the heart of Times Square. It's tough to beat the location. The rest of my group went to a show at Winter Garden Theatre, and it's a 3-minute walk, at least to the 7th Avenue side.

Check in/check out seemed to go smoothly, but I wasn't as involved in those processes.

If I could give it a 3.5, I would, but I can't, so 3 it is. If you want something relatively clean and comfortable, and close to most touristy things in midtown, it's a good option. You do pay for that proximity (again, it's Manhattan). My advice to the hotel: please update your linens, bedding, etc. Spruce those rooms up a little.

title: Central, clean, Art Deco, basic, functional, friendly and value for money!
text:
We were a party of  2 parents, and 2 older teens. We booked a 1 bedroom apartment. Kids had a double bed each and we had double sofa bed.
Rooms were spacious and clean. Kitchenette was extremely useful. We didn't cook, but everything was there if it had been needed.
