Fridge, small freezer, coffee maker, kettle, small oven, microwave etc. Hairdryer in the room plus iron and board. Safe in room which was free. Staff were fab, always had a smile, always helpful. Value for money over and above the big brand hotels, this was a fabulous location! Toasties next door is busy all day long with locals. Perfect for a quick breakfast. 
The location of the property is absolute perfection.  2 minutes off Times square, away from any noise, but close and safe to walk to and from everything. "minutes to Magnolia Bakery, Subways, Macdonalds, Juniors, Radio City Music Hal and Rockerfeller. 
 Art deco, functional, basic but everything you need for a family.

title: Perfect location, lovely accommodation
text: Only criticism I could possibly make is the rooms are dated, however that is not a problem as they are very clean and very big compared to other accommodation in this location. Perfect location, very well priced. The staff at the hotel were so friendly, making a fuss off my toddler. After a long flight we were quickly checked in and helped to our room with luggage. Will def return to this hotel when I go back to New York. Thanks so much for making our trip.

title: Excelente localização!!
text:
Não espere quartos modernos, lençóis de algodão egípcio, camareiras gentis e quarto perfumado. Nada disso... Em compensação a localização é muuuuito boa!

Linhas Amarela, Vermelha e Laranja do metrô num raio de 2 quarteirões - linhas muito utilizadas pelos turistas. Times Square virando a esquina. Magnolia Bakery na esquina oposta. Rockefeller Center a 1 quarteirão. OMG!

Hotel antigo como a grande maioria de NYC, com vista para a cozinha do vizinho, somente 2 elevadores. Pegamos o quarto One-Bedroom with 2 queens que acomodou perfeitamente 2 adultos e 2 crianças. Acomodaria 6 pessoas já que na sala há um sofá-cama mas seria sim um pouco apertado.

O banheiro estava renovado, apertadinho mas ok. A cozinha que pensei ser fundamental considerando que estávamos com crianças, foi pouco usada. Claro que ninguém vai resolver cozinhar em NY mas um microondas e uma geladeira sempre ajudam... Como era inverno, os eletrodomésticos tiveram pouco uso.

As camareiras são terríveis... Entram no quarto sem bater, ficam querendo te tirar do quarto logo para se livrarem do serviço. Tive que reclamar na recepção, que chatice! Já o pessoal da recepção é organizado, estão sempre de olho em quem entra e sai. Foram sempre prestativos e eficientes.

A região de Midtown é bastante barulhenta e o hotel não dispõe de janelas anti-ruído. Aos mais sensíveis isso pode incomodar muito. Toda noite/madrugada acordei com o barulho ora de sirenes, ora dos lixeiros... O cansaço maior me salvou de passar a noite acordada.

As lojas da Times Square ficam abertas até à meia-noite, o que nos ajudou... As crianças iam dormir com o pai e eu aproveitava! Região muito segura... Fui ao "Fantasma da Ópera" a pé e na volta ao hotel ainda fiz umas comprinhas na Sephora, na Gap, M&M...

O Radio City Apartments deixa a desejar a nível de hospedagem mas sua localização... Não sei dizer se retornaria mas que valeu, valeu!

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Nos alojamos tres noches. Excelente ubicación a pocas cuadra de time asiste y a metros del Rockefeller Center.  Los apartamentos tienen cocina y se encuentran bien equipados, fundamental para aquellos q buscan ahorrar un poco en las comidas. La atención es muy buena.  Dato: en la.cuadra 46 entre 5 y 6 hay un negocio que tiene muchas cosas de supermercado para poder comprar.cosas para cocinar. Desde congelados hasta paquetes de galletitas.

title: Lune de miel parfaite !!
text: Nous sommes tombés par hasard sur cette hôtel et n’avons vraiment pas été déçu !! Wow! On a eu une superbe lune de miel dans le penthouse au 13e étage. La chambre avait été rénovée dernièrement, même la cuisinette et les articles dans la chambre était neufs!! Matelas tempur pédicure flambant neuf, etc!! Très bien isolé pcq avec l’emplacement directement a Times Square, c’est bruyant 24h/24!! Pizzeria très bonne et pas cher voisine de l’hôtel, petit resto pour déjeuner à côté très bon et resto chinois excellent !! Je recommande cet établissement sans aucun doute!! Une très belle semaine à NYC!!!

title: New York 2018
text:
Siamo stati in questa struttura a gennaio di quest’anno. È stata la nostra terza volta a Radio city appartaments e come sempre ci siamo trovati benissimo e sicuramente ritorneremo  alla nostra prossima visita di New York! L’hotel si trova a due passi da Times Square e alla fermata della Metro. Il  rapporto qualità prezzo è davvero ottimo e lo staff gentilissimo!!!!
Consigliato!

title: Great studio apartment, perfectly located
text:
Very well placed and well equipped studio apartments, yards from Times Square and lots of key attractions within easy walking distance. Our room (801), had a comfortable king sized bed. A very functional kitchen with sink , full sized gas cooker , microwave,  kettle , toaster and fridge/freezer. The filter coffee machine was a nice touch and there was an ice machine on another floor. The bathroom was a good size and spotlessly clean. There was an abundance of luxurious, white, fluffy towels.The shower was very powerful. Our room was at the back of the hotel and was very quiet at night.
The room was serviced daily , including top ups of tea and coffee, sugar and creamer.
This Art-decor apart-hotel has lovely period features and decor. Staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. A great place to stay. We would happily recommend to others and would stay here  again on our next trip to NYC. Great value for money. Subway station at the end of the street. Perfect!

title: Great Stay for Girls Weekend, Will Stay Again
text: The staff was professional and helpful. Great little kitchen including teapot, coffee pot, small oven, microwave, medium size fridge, a few pans and pots....everything you could think of. Also strong wifi, close to everything, clean and comfortable. I'll be staying here next time!

title: Muy buena ubicacion
text:
Buena relación precio calidad, muy bien ubicado, buenos accesos, buena atencion.
Muy buena calefacción. El apartamento tiene todo lo necesario. Posee wifi aunque se cortaba el sevicio, lo mismo que el cable de tv

title: Wonderful family holiday
text:
We booked this place months ago based on 3 factors - location, accommodation l ml l ĺand price.
Ĺö 
Location - it is literally round the cornerll from Times Square and made walking to places so much easier. 

Accommodation - there is 5 of us and we chose the 1 bedroom apartment. It was everything we w in the living area/kitchen. There was a fridge/freezer, cooker,I microwave, toaster and coffee maker.

Price - I always book somewhere that I can cancel without charge as I am a constant scanner to find a better price but balancing position and accommodation I didn't find anything better.
L
Although you may feel the decor is datI ed the suite was cleaned every day and was spotless. The only thing was that they didn't change the bedding, although I had no complaints about that.

Overall it was a great place to stay and we would recommend it to anyone.

title: Great Location
text: Ideal location & perfect base for exploring NYC as its just minutes from Times Square , Rockerfeller centre , 5th Avenue , etc ..its an old building but Rooms are well equipped for self catering but probably not something thats used often IMO ,

title: Emplacement topissime
text:
L’atout majeur de cet hôtel est sans nul doute son emplacement. Dans la 49th, près de l’angle avec la 7th.
Tout est à proximité : commodités (Metro, resto, commerces) et attractions (Broadway, top of the rock...).
Le personnel est accueillant et disponible.
Côté deco, c’est un peu vieillot. Mais c’est propre et équipé. Kitchenette avec grand frigo, gaziniere, micro ondes et un peu de vaisselle. Table et fer à repasser. 
Dans les studios il manque malgré tout un espace pour ranger les valises. La salle de bain est rationnelle et dispose d’une baignoire.
Bref, un excellent pied à terre central pour un séjour visites/shopping qui vous autorise même à y faire une halte dans la journée pour y reprendre votre souffle ou encore y déposer vos résultats shopping avant de poursuivre votre marathon New yorkais.

title: Volvere
text: Estuvimos una semana en un dpto de dos dormitorio y la estadia fue muy buena. El dpto es de epoca pero esta muy bien y el personal muy amable. Todo funciona y si hay algun inconveniente lo solucionan rapido. La ubicacion excelente tanto para caminar new york como para tomar un subte, hay una boca de subte en la esquina. En sintesis: practico, comodo, limpio y buena relacion entre lo q pagas y lo q ofrecen

title: Ubicacion y comodidad
text: Es como estar en tu casa en pleno centro de Nueva York. Cocina completa, Living y dormitorio. Comodisimo!!!! a dos cuadras de Rockefeller Center y dos cuadras de Times Square. Hay un supermercado (Food Emporium) a dos cuadras. Si bien es un edificio antiguo, (tiene como 100 años) esta muy bien mantenido y los deptos han sido todos renovados. Muy buena la limpieza y el equipamiento. El personal muy amable, tambien. Volveria sin dudarlo!!!

title: Excelente apart y ubicación!
text: Nos alojamos 13 noches en enero; Somos un matrimonio con 2 hijos mayores, Es la segunda vez que lo elegimos y lo sentimos como nuestro segundo hogar!  La ubicación es inmejorable!!! A pasos de Times Square, Rockefeller Center y de las estaciones de subte. El apartamento es muy cómodo, en nuestro caso elegimos con una habitación de 2 camas dobles y un estar con un sofá cama. La cocina esta totalmente equipada para 5 personas, muy conveniente para una familia en New York.El servicio de limpieza es muy bueno y lo realizan todos los días sin costo extra. WiFi gratis. El personal habla español y es muy amable. Si bien están remodelando algunas habitaciones no nos sentimos molestos en ningún momento. El edificio es antiguo pero está muy bien mantenido y la relación precio calidad es excelente!  Sin duda que lo volveremos a elegir!!

title: Old and terrible
text: Stayed for 3 nights, very old building with old fixtures.  Constantly need to adjust hot and cold water.  Toilet is old, very small toilet bowl.  Funky smell.  Two construction site beside the hotel that starts at 7am.  People working in the hotel doesn't care if you are bringing bags up or down.  The staff uses the elevator more than the guests.  From all the employees of this establishment there is only 1 person that cares, the tall bellboy.  Never going back to this hotel.  Location is good.

title: Inmejorable ubicación y un detalle interesante.!!
text:
La ubicación es inmejorable, las habitaciones son cómodas, (1002 y 1004), el baño no es de lo mas cómodo, no tiene videt y el tamaño es bastante reducido.
El detalle que lo hace interesantes es que las habitaciones, (estudios), tiene una cocina, (horno de gas, anafe, horno microonda pileta y una pequeña mesada, esto brinda una interesante opción para el que no esta muy acostumbrado o le hace mal a la comida chatarra.
La atención es buena.

title: Super místo
text: My jsme jeli do New York a řešili jsme ubytování dlouho. Tyto apartmány jsou pěkný, uklizený....My jsme měli apartmán s dvěma ložnicema a obývák a malou kuchyní. Místo   kde apartmány jsou je nejlepší. Time Square je asi 200 metrů. Výstup z metra je přímo u apartmánů ( žlutá strasa - na Grand Zero je to  15 minut metrem ) Trochu problém je probíhající stavba vedle hotelu - my jsme na ní koukali, ale my jsme ráno vypadli a večer jsme přišli. Nás to moc neomezovalo. Já jsem byl spokojený s místem, cenou, kvalitou ............

title: Great location, cozy apartment like feel.
text: We stayed comfortably in a 2 bedroom condo with 5 people traveling. There was a small kitchen, one bathroom and two individual bedrooms. One room had a queen size bed, the other had 2 double beds and there was a double bed pull out couch. Each room had it's own TV with a total of 3 of them so everyone could relax at the end of the day watching what they wanted to. We traveled there in winter and it was freezing outside but always warm and comfortable in our room. The location was the best of all. You are a 1/2 block from times square and right next to a number of restaurant and shopping options. The hotel was great storing our luggage both at the beginning and end of our trip as we waited for our flights. The staff was helpful and accomidating. I would stay there again!

title: Great location!
text:
Location is great and close to Times Square.
The rooms were quite spacious compared to other hotels I have stayed at in NYC. It was very handy having the kitchenette too. The rooms were also clean which is always a must! The rooms are a little out-dated but who cares, you're usually not in NYC to sit in a room all day. I would definitely recommend staying here and if I get back there, I will stay again.
The only negative thing I would say is that the staff at reception were not overly friendly. Some days we would get a smile and other days, nothing.

title: Was not expecting that!
text: Friendly and helpful staff but cleaning staff loud in the halway in the morning.  Nice little kitchenette. Great location near Times Square and subway  BUT  no closet so nowhere to hang your clothes and winter coat.  Same problem in the bathroom, no shelf to put your toiletry items or even a hook  to put your toiletry bag.

title: Close to Times Square
text: We stayed through the new year celebrations so it was busy the apartments while being older are comfortable and have all you need and are self contained or plenty of restaurants nearby if you don’t want to cook overall our stay was pleasant and I would stay again

title: THE STAFF AT RADIO CITY APARTMENTS TOOK ADVANTAGE OF 2 YOUNG AUSTRALIAN TRAVELERS!
text:
THE STAFF AT RADIO CITY APARTMENTS TOOK ADVANTAGE OF 2 YOUNG AUSTRALIAN TRAVELERS!  

I usually don't write reviews but I HAVE NEVER BEEN SCAMMED THIS MUCH IN MY LIFE! Upon checking out we asked if they could call us a cab to Newark airport. The man at the front desk (I wish I new his name) said yes it will take 15 minutes and it will be a $95 flat rate. I thought this was unusual as taxis in NYC are everywhere and seemed pricey compared to when we arrived. I asked ok what was the difference if I just hailed one from the street? He said you never know what they will charge you plus the tolls it will end up being the same so we just went with it. 

A private fancy looking SUV showed up and as the driver was collecting our luggage I was immidiatley upset as we had asked for a taxi cab and were told he would call a taxi cab not a private limousine service. I immediately told the driver that we ordered a taxi and not a private service and that I was upset that the STAFF AT RADIO CITY APARTMENTS ARE LYING TO THEIR CUSTOMERS. I asked what was the difference between him and a cab and he rattled all these sales answers like better insurance cover, better car and that he has a deal with all the hotels in the area. 

IT ENDED UP COSTING US $165 USD when we were told it was a $95 flat rate. 

THE STAFF AT RADIO CITY APARTMENTS TOOK ADVANTAGE OF 2 YOUNG AUSTRALIAN TRAVELERS! Hail your own cabs people.

title: Melhor do que o esperado! Ótima Localização com bom preço.
text:
NY é sabidamente (Manhatan específicamente) uma cidade cuja hotelaria é cara. Principalmente hotéis bem localizados. Esta é uma das poucas cidades no mundo (inclua São Paulo aí) onde hotéis que deveriam ser baratos, como Holiday Inn, Comfort Inn e similares custam tanto quanto seus irmãos mais ricos.

Então, principalmente na época que fomos (dezembro), qualquer coisa menor que 200 dólares por noite na área da Times Square é bom negócio.

O grande "lance" desse hotel é localização. Literalmente no miolo, perto de tudo. Distante 15 minutos de caminhada do Central Park, ao lado da Times Square e com estações de metrô ao lado.

Sobre o hotel em si:

STAFF

Se os funcionários não são o destaque, também não atrapalham. O Nova Iorquino é "mais fechado" do que estamos acostumados. Mas, ninguém foi mal educado. Poderiam ser mais "calorosos" (afinal, trabalham em um hotel). Aceitável

LOBBY E AREAS COMUNS

Bem, praticamente não existem. O lobby e bem pequeno, não há mais nenhuma área comum e existe um restaurante italiano adjacente com acesso por dentro do hotel.

APARTAMENTOS

Pequenos (como quase todos hotéis de NY), porém arrumadinho. Se propõe a ser um "flat" (daí o nome apartments) por isso possui uma pequena cozinha. Com um frio de -7, a falta de isolamento na janela do banheiro se tornou um problema (não resolvido pelo hotel).

Mas, no fim das contas, cumpriu seu papel para as 2 noites que ficamos.

NOTA FINAL

Se o preço for convidativo, ficaria novamente. A localização é o grande trunfo e, no geral, o hotel cumpriu bem seu papel.

title: Strategico
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo apart hotel durante le vacanze di Natale.
Premesso che non è la prima volta che vengo a New York, questa location è la più strategica in cui abbia mai soggiornato.
Praticamente a Time Square ed a due passi dal Rockefeller Center, super centrale nel cuore di Manhattan, offre soluzioni con angolo cottura. Personale molto cordiale e disponibile e pronto a soddisfare qualunque esigenza. 
Di buon livello e pulito, ottimo per rapporto qualità/prezzo. Una nota negativa il riscaldamento non sufficiente, almeno nella ns. camera, problema però subito rimediato. Super consigliato.

title: A lovely hotel...would absolutely recommend
text: This quaint hotel really is reminiscent of studio apartment living from some time ago in the heart of NYC.  We were very warmly greeted by everyone at the front desk.  The staff are friendly and knowledgeable of the area -- they made some terrific recommendations for dinners.  While a wee bit dated (it is an older building afterall) our rooms were very comfortable and very clean with terrific water pressure for those hot morning showers.  The full mini-kitchen was a great bonus for storing and then heating up our left-overs while we were there.  I would happily stay there again!

title: Saved our holiday! Amazing Hotel!
text:
After a terrible stay in Hotel Pennsylvania, my friend and I had to quickly find another hotel, hence Radio City Apartments! 

We arrived at 11pm without booking and the gentlemen on reception were so helpful and accommodating and talked us through the different room options. After us choosing a room, we were swiftly upgraded to one of the Penthouse apartments with no extra charge, just showing how lovely the staff are here!! 

When we got up to our room, it was absolutely spotless! I cannot think of a single complaint, it was a lovely room down to every last detail. The bathroom was clean, it had a little basket of toiletries and plenty of clean white towels. There was also a little kitchen section kitted out with a fridge/freezer, oven, hob, crockery, cutlery and a coffee machine. It was wonderful!

The bed was a large king size, with a memory foam mattress and plenty of pillows, leading to a very good nights sleep. The room also had a flat screen television with a large variety of channels and films, free of charge. It was the perfect hotel room to wind down in after a long day of sight seeing in the city.  However, the sight seeing could continue in the room as the view of Times Square from windows was so spectacular! 

I would recommend anyone and everyone to stay here if they're visiting New York. The location is great and I've never received better value for money!  They saved our holiday after such a terrible stay in the other hotel!

title: Fantástico
text: Un hotel muy cómodo para descansar, tiene cocina y las habitaciones y camas son grandes , muy distinto a otros de la zona. La ubicación es exelente para recorrer nueva york. Habiamos perdido la camara de fotos y los mismos trabajadores del hotel la devolvieron cuando la encontraron. Volvería sin dudas!

title: excelente ubicación
text:
el personal muy amable, la mayoria habla español
departamento muy cómodo, a 2 cuadras de times square
recibieron los paquetes de amazon sin cobrar extra
te prestan paraguas si llueve
volveria sin dudarlo

title: Bang on.
text:
Booked this ages ago for Christmas and New year and while there is a fair bit about the trip I can moan about, and queing everywhere in minus 10 temperatures and cutting winds springs to mind, these apartments in the moaning category.
Old and sort of brownstone amongst skyscrapers, it looks out of place. It's not modern but has a sort of faded grandeur about it, although it not grand in itself.best location ever for NYC. 50 yards off the top end of times Square. Couple of hundred yards off the rockefeller centre, train 30 yards, you can get everywhere quickly from here.
We are in a 1 bedroom apartment with 2 queen's and a pullout in the living room. Basic kitchen which you could easily use of needed, and a nice bathroom.
Maids in everyday changing towels and bedding. Clean as a whistle. Staff friendly. 
If I ever come again I will stay here. Taken a shine to the old place.

title: Perfect Base to Explore New York - and brilliant WiFi
text:
Not the fanciest, not the best front desk staff but the location more than makes up for any of that.
So close to all the action, quick walking distance to multiple subway lines, close to Rockerfeller, Times Square, shopping etc without being right in the crazy action.

Room service/Housekeeping was efficient and we chose not to use it every day but every second.

The Wifi was the best I have ever experienced and if you have teenagers/young adults who want to take their laptops, go-pros, upload pictures and videos this hotel will not disappoint.  All three of were using the free wi-fi at once uploading and downloading - no dropouts, no going slow.  A lot of other NY hotels change you for wifi  for each device!

title: Retro hotel in the best part of New York
text: I spent quiet some time thinking about how I’d review this hotel and then decided that our experience in New York was magical, therefore I’m basing it on that. A family of 5 adults staying in a 2 bedroom apartment for 9 nights. Location is a 10, we walked to most places from the front door. Time square, Central Park, The Rockefeller centre, Grand central station, Madison square gardens are all in easy walking distance. Then you have some great restaurants, bars and shopping all within a stones throw. The hotel is smaller than your big chains but has a more homely feel. The styling is retro and is very clean, and well maintained. The maids and maintenance staff do an awesome job of keeping everything in check. We had a 2 bedroom apartment consisting of 2 singles, a double and a sofa bed. Our apartment was quiet small for 5 adults especially in the lounge/kitchen area where the sofa bed was set up, but with a tv in each bedroom there was room to spread out. The kitchen was excellent although we chose to eat out every night. The full size fridge was great for all of our drinks. We purchased single serves of cereal from Walmart’s (a short walk in time square) and had for breakfast. There was also a Starbucks and McDonald’s there to. The toilet was inside the bathroom but if you go downstairs there is a toilet located through a door to the adjoining restaurant ( it came in handy when 5 adults where trying to get ready). Showers are hot and fresh thick fluffy towels are supplied everyday, along with great toiletries. I didn’t love my bed! The mattress seemed to be made of memory foam, and as I’m a restless sleeper it wasn’t great turning over to a hole I’d created! ... but after a couple of nights and lots of activity I started sleeping better! You hear a few noises, such as sirens but we loved the fact that we were in the city of NY. The room temperature was nice and cosy for winter. We were able to use the hotel washing machines and dryers after 9pm  which we thought was awesome. I would definitely consider staying her again.

title: Great location for central NY
text:
I stayed here With my wife and 2 (adult) daughters for 4 nights. My oldest daughter and my wife then stayed for 2 more Nights. We had a 1 bedroom apartment the first period, and they had a suite the last 2 Nights.

Given that this is very Central Manhattan, the cost is reasonable. Being most other Places on the planet, it would be outrageous. But so it is. The hotel is very Central, With a few minutes stroll to Radio city Hall or Times Square. Lots of restaurants within walking distance as well.

The Apartments are small and the decor is not the most modern, and the lifts are tiny. but the service was great and the Apartments were clean. The great Draw though is the ability to house a Family very Central on Manhattan without going financially broke during a few days stay.

Recommended, would go back if on another Family trip to NY City.

From la Guardia we paid roughly 70 USD for a taxi or an Uber car. 

Ursus

title: Great Location
text: The Radio city Apartments were just perfect for our grandmother, mother, daughter weekend in NYC.  It was so close to Radio City Music Hall and all of the other sites we wanted to see this Christmas.  The staff was very accommodating - we were able to check in early and check out late.  Our one bedroom apartment was clean and comfortable.  It needed a little updating but for the price it was great.  I would stay here again when visiting NYC.

title: Radio City Apartments
text: I stayed in a one bed (queen) studio with my husband. It came with a kitchenette furnished with utensils and appliances (fridge, stove, microwave, plates, cups, fork, coffee maker and a kettle!) Room was clean. The bed wasnt the best and the thread count was ehhh but i still caught some zzzzz and that's all that matter. The location was perfect! One block from rockafellar center and 2 blocks from time square. It was a small studio but they utilized the space perfectly. Everything was updated and modern looking. Staff was nice. And i would definitely stay here again and i recommend this place to everyone.

title: Perfect position and price
text:
I booked this as I wanted a 3 bed room to take my teenage granddaughter to NY with a friend,   Our apartment had a bedroom with 2 double beds, and a very comfortable double sofa bed in the living area.
It was well equipped and very clean.    We rang reception around midnight as we were very hot in the bedroom and couldn’t find how to turn off the radiator.    Reception said they would send someone up and he arrived in less than 5 minutes.   It was typical of the excellent service we received.
4 nights for 3  of us cost around£1000, which we thought was excellent value for such a centrally placed hotel.
Would certainly recommend it, and wouldn’t hesitate to return.

title: Excelente localização
text: Apartamento de dois quartos muito bom! Limpo e organizado. Cozinha equipada e localização excelente, ao lado do metrô e apenas 200m da time square. Numa próxima vez me hospedarei aqui novamente, com certeza.

title: Situacion Inmejorable
text:
La situación, en pleno Times Square, es inmejorable. Utilizando el metro para ir a  Manhattan desde el Aeropuerto JFK  se llega muy fácilmente.  
Nuestra habitación era exactamente igual que en las fotos de booking, lo que es de agradecer aunque no siempre ocurre. 
La cama era comoda y grande, y tanto  las sabanas como las toallas eran muy  agradables y confortables.
El baño era pequeño aunque suficiente y estaba limpisimo, como toda la habitación.
En el frio invierno neoyorquino, la calefacción era mucho mas que suficiente, de hecho nosotros tuvimos que abrir un poquito la ventana para que no hiciese demasiado calor en la habitación.
Aviso a las personas sensibles a los ruidos: las ventanas no son ninguna maravilla, y los sonidos de la calle, trafico, camiones de basura o  sirenas de policía, bomberos o ambulancias.... se oyen bastante. Al menos se oían en nuestra habitación, que estaba en el sexto piso y daba hacia la Calle 49. 
Si teneis habitación con cocina, en las cercanías hay varios lugares en los que comprar, tanto cocinado como para cocinar, como Whole Foods Market en la esquina noroeste de la Calle 41 con la 6ª Avenida, el Whole Foods en el nivel inferior del Time Warner Center, en Columbus Circle o  The Food Emporium, en la esquina noreste de la Calle 49 con la 8ª Avenida

title: NEW YORK AGAIN!!!
text: Hotel is in perfect position to access everything, sites and subway. I would describe it as an iconic hotel, it maintains features that remind you of a period, apartments are decent size well maintained and clean, staff are very welcoming and friendly

title: Great location/price combination!
text:
For an overnight centered on Radio City and Times Square, my wife stumbled upon this lodging.  It appeared to be ideally located - Less than 5 minutes walk to either Times Square or Radio City, and maybe 10 minutes to St. Patricks.  The price is actually pretty reasonable given the location.  To avoid rate shock if you're unfamiliar with local prices, do some comparisons.  The place is a 1908 building, updated for modern lodging in small but functional rooms.  Each room has a "kitchenette", i.e. fridge, microwave, dishes, utensils and coffee/tea set-up.  I don't know if any rooms have a street view, but you don't go to Manhattan hotels to stay in the room, do you?
The staff was pleasant and efficient, and there is an attached Italian restaurant.  Our only real criticism was minor.  Due to the age of the place, the bathtub plumbing can be a little odd.  We had to identify and use two faucets on the wall below/behind the toilet in order to get a hot shower.  The desk clerk said all the rooms are a little quirky, and each is different.  Still, we would readily stay here again.

title: A true NYC bargain
text:
Almost everything about it was a pleasant surprise. We had a 2 bed studio with kitchenette.
The nice thing is having a sitting area alleviates the desire to get out of a tiny room into the city.
Beds were very comfortable and bath and amenities were excellent.
People at desk were friendly and very helpful AND you are a mere 2-3 blocks from every thing tourist in the Times Sq / Radio City area
The only caveats are housekeeping will not clean dirty dishes so use the dishwashing soap that is supplied and don't expect Crate and Barrel furnishings and I wish there had been another 'easy' chair in living room.
In one of the nosiest parts of Manhattan our room was library quiet.
I have shopped hotels all over Mid Town for years so I know you can certainly spend more but you will not get better value

title: Fantastic stay, would definately recommend!
text:
Stayed at the hotel in October for 1 week, my family of four and my sisters family of 5. Rooms were fantastic, plenty of room. Staff were helpful and friendly. Had a couple of issues with the toilet as it blocked 3 times whilst we were there, however, within minutes of calling the front desk, someone was at the door and it was sorted straight away. 
Rooms cleaned daily to a great standard, hotel amenities were more than sufficient.
The location of the hotel was absolutely perfect, close to everything and main subway stations to all the major sites located at either end of the street. I would recommend the little pizza place next door, food was nice and fresh and cheap too. Wouldn't think twice about staying at the hotel again!

title: Hidden Gem near Times Square
text:
Our family stayed at the Radio City Apartments for a Thanksgiving vacation.  We were fortunate that we were able to stay at one of their amazing penthouse apartments (I believe there are 3 total).  Penthouse A was spacious and it easily accommodated our family of 4 (2 adults, a college aged girl, and high school girl).  We instantly fell in love with the wraparound terrace that offered glimpses of Times Square and the surrounding buildings.

Staying at the Radio City Apartments is like living in the city versus staying in the city.  I should know since I lived in NYC for over 7 years.  While I typically try to avoid staying in tourist areas, the Radio City Apartments is located on a fairly quiet Midtown street just steps away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, and within close proximity of a plethora of attractions and sites.

title: Amazing stay
text: We stayed for 6 nights 26th November till 2nd December, it was one of the bests hotels we have ever stayed in when we are in New York. It was so close to Times Sq but you wouldn't know and a few minutes from 5th Ave. We found the staff very helpful organising a car back to the airport letting us have the room for a couple of extra hours which was a blessing when we were going home. The rooms are really big and plenty of space for the 3 of us they were cleaned every day, we never once had a problem with the elevators and we were on the 12th floor. Plenty of places to eat within walking distance. We would 100% stay here again I don't have anything negative to say about the apartments.

title: Slitent hotell, men utrolig god beliggenhet!
text: Vi ønsket å bo nært Times Square, og dette hotellet ligger like rundt hjørnet! Rommene var veldig små (det så mye større ut på nettsiden da vi bestilte) og det var temmelig slitt. Aircondition'en på soverommet funket ikke helt som det skulle. Vi ville nok ikke ha valgt dette hotellet igjen, men det var rimelig og sentralt. Vi var stort sett på rommet kun på natta, så det fungerte greit for oss.

title: 3 night stay
text: I cannot day enough good things about the location of Radio City Apartments! Minutes away from Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Halle, Broadway, and Fifth Avenue. It is all within walking distance. There are an abundant of restaurants and food vendors with steps of walking out of the front door. Two room with kitchenette was clean and appropriately supplied with everything that we needed. The elevator was quite slow and we often opted to use the stairs. The staff were fairly quiet and would only speak once spoken to; a little bit more smile and friendliness would get me to give 5 stars. Overall a pleasant place to stay. Not glamorous or over the top but when you come to NYC to see the sites, you’re barely in your room. Would definitely recommend for future stays.

title: Perfect Location, Perfect Room, Perfect Trip
text: Radio City Apartments really is in the heart of it all.  We arrived early on a Wednesday, around 11:30 a.m., and we were able to check in immediately.  Unlike some of the other reviews, we found the front desk staff extremely friendly and professional.  If you talk to them, you will find they will smile, laugh, and joke with the patrons.  They were otherwise businesslike with the occasional "hello" or "have a good day."  The entrance of the hotel, and lobby, while small, were very charming, and decorated beautifully for Christmas.  We stayed in a room on the 11th floor with windows facing a walkway and not directly to 49th street.  The elevators were perfectly fine, and we never had an issue with them being slow.  The up and down arrows on the 11th floor don't light up when you push them, so, you didn't know if the button was actually pressed and the elevator was actually coming.  You just have to wait for a minute, but it always showed up.  The room itself is large for a NYC room, and the kitchenette had everything needed, however, we only used the paper towels, fridge, and microwave.  There is a grocery store a couple blocks down which is convenient.  Everything in the room was CLEAN which is my number one priority.  The bathtub had a stain in it, but probably not something they could address without replacing the whole tub.  I have seen other reviews about the rooms not being updated, and things being old, but everything in our room appeared updated and fairly new.  The colors chosen are a bit retro, but nothing was run down. The location of this hotel was my second priority when choosing, and for the price, it can not be beat.  Subway stations were close by for easy transit to uptown or downtown.  It is an easy walk to restaurants, Time Square, Rockefeller Center, and more.  We ran the window unit air conditioner, and kept the fan running instead of on auto to drown out any outside noise.  It seemed to help, and the outside noise did not bother us at all.  We will definitely stay here again when we return to the city.

title: Una jova de 1906 ubicada en el corazón de NY
text:
El hotel es una joyita de la arquitectura de NY del 1900. Muy bien mantenido, hay que tener en cuenta que es un edificio antiguo, con lo cual, tiene la esencia de los edicios antiguos con ciertos de sus problemas y estética, los apartamentos no son grandes, pero sí cómodos y si tienes algún problema en la habitación lo solucionan enseguida. Es un poco ruidoso, pero NY es una ciudad ruidosa y aisla lo suficiente para poder descansar. La ubicación es EXCELENTE, el punto medio ideal para ir a la parada de los buses de turismo, a central park, a times square, al Central Station, MOMA, la 5ta, la biblioteca a pocas cuadras y si querés caminar más el Skyline y las bicis para ir al downtown. 
Los conserjes Jaime y Carlos fueron muy atentos y serviciales. Aclaro: hablan español pero por política del hotel sólo te hablarán en español si les decís que preferís que te hablen en ese idioma (esto me lo contó una española) 
Aclaración importante: si hcen pedidos en AMAZON o cualquier otro lado Sólo aceptan 2 paquetes por HABITACIÓN, con lo cual, agrupen sus paquetes.

title: Muy cómodo, fuimos en Invierno y la cocina te ayuda con la cena luego de los días de caminatas
text:
La ubicación es perfecta, todo muy cerca, el metro a pocos metros.
Tiene lavandería lo que ayuda cuando viajas en familia.Es un edificio antiguo pero mantenido. Nos tocó una habitación interna se dormía perfectamente sin ruidos de la calle.

title: boa localização porém alto custo.
text: Hotel é bem localizado, próximo a Time Square e ao Rockfeller Center, quarto com 2 camas boas, porém pequeno, não cabia um berço, pois o meu filho ainda é bebê e não dorme na cama. Mas tinha sala com um sofá e um armário com pia, fogão e mini geladeira. Tinha barulho de obra e a iluminação da Time Square atrapalha um pouco, pois gosto de quarto pra dormir bem escuro.

title: Fantastic location and big room
text: Right around the corner from Time Square. We stayed here in November 2017 for 4 nights. Room was really spacious with seperate dining/mini kitchenette. Bedroom had two comfy double beds. Good size bathroom. Close to subway and the shops and attractions. Used basement laundry facilities which was handy. Only negative was that we found the front desk staff unwelcoming and lacking enthusiasm at all times. Would stay again.

title: Super Apartments
text: Radio City Apt’s are in a great location just off Times Square. Although the apartments are not modern they have brilliant facilities and are very clean. Highly recommended for a family or couples. Toasties next door is an excellent Deli especially for breakfast.

title: Worse customer services ever!!! Gas leak in the apartment.
text: Myself and my family stayed here in October. Great location and the room fit all 6 of us. When we arrived the weather was hot and the apartment windows were all open so we didn't notice that the gas cooker was leaking gas into the apartment. We arrived durning the day and head straight out, when we got back at night we used the cooker to make tea, just before we went to sleep we thought we smelt gas but not to sure if we had turn the cooker off correctly and the windows were all open. During that night my sister sleeping outside on the pull out bed was coughing all night, the next day when the cleaner lady came in we asked if they could smell gas and she could get it straight away. We rang down to reception and they sent someone up straight away to fix the cooker and it turn out that the connection was fitted incorrectly and there was gas leaking. The staff in the hotel was so rude didn't offer us new room as they were fully booked up but when we rang our rep from our package company they rang the hotel and suddenly a room was available but didn't fit us all. The hotel did not apologise once to us and they just said it was our fault for not reporting it sooner. WORSE customer service ever would not stay here again!!!

title: Noise, noise, noise!
text: If you book a studio it will be street-side and the street sounds will come through loud & clear.  It's a shame because the facility itself is fine, but after finally falling asleep after the traffic noise from below ended (1-2 a.m.) I was awakened by what sounded like a jack-hammer - sidewalk cleaning being done right across the street with exceedingly noisy power-washing equipment - IMPOSSIBLE to sleep for the 2+ hrs this went on.  We were on the sixth floor - not sure it would have mattered being any higher.  Would never go back.

title: Disappointed in service
text: Be cautious of service. Though accommodations are adequate, service is pretty horrible. The night time desk manager is unfriendly. At time staff did not speak. Checkout was hectic since they refused to accept my company card despite that the company took the prior steps to book reservation. At the end when my company called they refused to give last names when asking for management. "Jose does not have a last name," they said. Very childish.

title: Great Experience
text: Three friends and I chose this location for a 2 night stay in Manhattan recently due to its amazing location and positive reviews.  We were impressed in every way by the customer service, standard of the room that we had and of course the location which is close to all of the midtown hot spots.  The front desk staff were incredibly helpful and courteous and upgraded us from a 1 bedroom apartment to one of the penthouse suites when we checked in.  They also gave us great recommendations for nearby restaurants.  The room that we stayed in was beautiful and spacious with a king sized bed in the bedroom, a pull out couch and we requested a roll away bed as well.  There was an outdoor balcony that wrapped around the apartment and a full kitchen as well as a dining area and living room.  The bathroom was large and clean with all of the amenities and toiletries you would need.  We were extremely pleased with our stay and would highly recommend this property to others looking for quality accommodations for a reasonable price in the theatre district/Times Square area of the city.

title: It's all about the location!
text: Second time here, and the main reason is the location, close to Time Square, subways, restaurants.  The apartments are better than the rooms I think, and try to get a higher floor round the back or the side. Our friends were given a room on the first floor at the front and it was very noisy, but the staff were good about moving them the next day. I would stay here again as it is good value for New York.

title: Great location but tired interior
text:
The building looks quaint from the outside, and remains very tired in the room styling & furniture, however, the location is great and the room size which we were in was great. We got a two bedroom apartment, which overlooked 49th street from the living areas.

The noises came straight in through the window air-conditioners when they were off, but because we had unseasonably warm weather we had them on most of the time anyway. The one in the main bedroom had a loud rattle which was annoying, but I did note it for the maintenance staff to look at.

The 2nd bedroom had two double beds, which was great for the kids, and our stay was pleasant and spacious. The rooms were clean, they had it fitted out with everything you need- It just feels so old. I'd stay there again, as it was a great location, but if they freshened up the interiors, it would get my review from 4 to 5 stars.

title: Idéalement situé
text:
Le point fort de cet hôtel est son emplacement. Nous avions réservé un appartement pour 6 avec  une chambre 2 lits doubles.  Propre mais un peu "vieillot ", l'eau chaude met beaucoup de temps à arriver. Nous étions au 4e étage, pratique car pas besoin d'ascenseur mais plus bruyant et sans vue. Mieux vaut demander une chambre en étages supérieurs. Hôtel à taille humaine. 
Tout ce qu'il faut pour se restaurer à proximité et lignes de métros très proches. 
A conseiller donc

title: Great location
text: Stayed here for 3 nights in October 2017.  Absolutely perfect for what we needed.  Rooms are small but we were only there to sleep in them!  Very clean and comfortable and the shower was great.  Maid service every day with clean towels.  Perfect spot right near Times Square.  Highly recommended.

title: Posizione da favola!
text: Abbiamo trascorso 10 giorni in luna di miele in un appartamento composto da camera con letto queen size, angolo cottura con tavolino e due sedie e bagno con vasca al 7° piano (di 12). L'hotel ci è stato consigliato da un amico che si era trovato molto bene e devo dire che non siamo rimasti delusi. Non costa poco (noi abbiamo speso complessivamente tasse incluse sui 3.000$), ma la posizione è impareggiabile praticamente a due passi da Time Square, ma in una via secondaria piuttosto tranquilla. Abbiamo girato a piedi tutta Manhattan e preso la metro solo per andare nella parte più a sud (financial district/Battery Park, Brooklyn e Coney Island). Ad ogni modo i trasporti non sono carissimi a NY, abbiamo fatto abbonamento settimanale a circa 30$. L'appartamento era essenziale, ma pulito e abbastanza spazioso, cambiavano asciugamani e persino i saponi tutti i giorni e la cucina attrezzata si è rivelata un'ottima scelta, dati i prezzi di NY (c'è tutto il necessario, pentolame e persino strofinacci, scottex e forniscono anche tè e caffè). Il personale è molto gentile e disponibile, ci hanno anche prenotato un'auto privata per andare in aeroporto allo stesso prezzo di un normale taxi (sui 70$). Sicuramente lo sceglieremmo di nuovo per un viaggio futuro.

title: TERRIBLE service and accomodations
text: Do not stay here.   There are much better places.    The only good thing is its location.   We stayed here for four nights.    NO HOT WATER on three of the four days.    Alarm clock in room broken.   Man at front desk had us fill out a work maintenance request . . .nothing was fixed.   NO hot water, alarm clock time was wrong and buttons broken so you could not set the correct time.   Asked for a 5 a.m. wake up call on our last morning so as not to be late to airport . . never happened.   Put the tag on the door that it was ok to clean room on one of the days.   We were gone from 6 a.m. until 4 p.m    Room was never cleaned (which really is not a big deal), however, we had to find someone on another floor to get towels, Kleenex, and toilet paper.   Window air conditioning unit SOOO loud (on a positive, it did drown out the city noise, but also could not watch the tv at the same time because you had to have the volume up so high that your neighbors would be bothered).  Men at the front desk really could have cared less.    NYC was AMAZING . . just not radio city apartments

title: Viagem entre amigas
text: Viajamos em 3 amigas, e o quarto acomodou perfeitamente: 2 camas em um quarto muito amplo e um sofá cama na sala. Cozinha equipada, com acessórios, mesa com três lugares, banheiro pequeno porém confortável. Há poucos minutos da Times Square caminhando e ponto de metrô na esquina! Radio City foi uma boa surpresa!

title: Great Location
text: Stayed here for 5 nights.  Room clean and beds comfortable staff very helpful and friendly.  Very central to most things.  1 block from Times Square and Top of the Rock lots of restaurants nearby for snacks or meals.  Subways are also nearby.  Will be staying here again.

title: Excelente
text: Lo primero es la ubicación! Entre la 6 y 7 AVD , a 1 min de times squared y a 2 de radio city. Nosotros estuvimos en un estudio con dos camas de matrimonio ( aunque éramos 2) con cocina y baño. A la cocina no le faltaba detalle (horno, cafetera, nevera, fuegos, cafetera, sartenes..) todo muy limpio y cuidado. Cnd volvamos a N.Y volveremos a los aparatos radio city

title: Pretty good
text:
Stayed in this hotel for 10 days; myself, hubby and a 2 year old. Booked a 1 bedroom apartment. 

Staff: the front desk staff are not the best, not overly helpful and generally, don’t really seem like they want to be there. The cleaning staff were amazing. Lovely ladies who went above and beyond. We were at the hotel most days for a nap, they would do a quick clean or come back. 

Rooms: the room we had was great. The bedroom was massive and had 2 queen sized beds and we ordered a cot which fit comfortably. There was an air conditioner in each room. The living area was also generous, the kitchen was really great, full size frigde and coffee machine with coffee and tea. 

Probably need a new matteress on the food out sofa though!! We  booked a bathroom with a bath, but ended up being put in an accessible room which was a pain with a 2year old at bath time, the shower flooded the bathroom, we ended up making a “fort” with towels, again, the cleaning staff were so attentive that we had a new “fort” every day! The main downfall with the rooms was the noise from the street, even though we were on the 11th floor and the AC was quite loud, the sirens at 2,3and 4am became a little much by the end of the trip!

Location: close to everything, easy walk to Central Park or jump on the train and go downtown. 

Definitely recommend a trip to the food trucks around the streets.

The lifts Are pretty slow, so if your checking out, try and go a little earlier. The hotel says it has washing machines, but to be honest, it’s not worth your time, they’re always in use by the hotel and you really don’t want to be down in the basement after 7:30pm when the machines are available to the guests (or 8pm depending on who you talk to) or ever as it’s pretty creepy! 

Overall though, a great hotel, close to everything and good for families.

title: One night stay to see Hamilton!!
text:
We arrived early and our room was not ready yet, which we figured would be the case.
They took nour bag and checked it for us. We then returned after the show and checked in, the staff was very pleasant and helpful. We had reserved a Queen room and they upgraded us to a 1 bedroom apartment. It was very nice and had everything you could need in a room, very clean and the King bed was extremely comfortable. I would highly recommend stayng here, very centrally located to the the Theater District and Times Square.

title: Perfect central position for sightseeing
text: Travelling with another couple, a 2 bedroom apartment in an excellent central location close to attractions and subway. Decor is dated, but apartment was clean with daily housekeeping. Living area and bedrooms complete with a/c and TV's. Great little kitchen. Reception staff are exceptionally helpful, friendly and efficient. Two blocks from Times Square, 5th Ave., and supermarket each.

title: Good location but small
text:
We stayed at Radio City Apartments for 6 nights. We had a one bedroom apartment with two queen beds and a sofa bed in the kitchen area. The apartment was clean and secure and serviced each day. 
 
The bathroom was small!! as was the apartment but then again this is New York and space comes at a premium.

Overall the apartment served us well, mostly due to the good location. There is a Subway at the end of the road, a good pizza place right next door and after a long day and night it was good to be able to come back to a central location to rest.

The main reason I am giving Radio City Apartments an average rating is due to the checkout process. On our last day I went to check out, got my bill all was in order and I handed over a credit card (Westpac currency card or travel card). I was promptly told that they do not accept travel cards as payment. 

Now this card is an actual visa card and I had used it all over America and paid at several other hotels without any issue.

The chap at the front desk as less than friendly and said those are the rules when I pressed him on the matter as he suggested I go down the road and draw cash to pay. We argued for a while and got no where. 

Which business in today's times does not accept money from a customer?? businesses should just say thanks and let me take your money but no not Radio City Apartments.

title: Excelente ubicación! Excelente precio beneficio.
text:
Nos alojamos 5 noches en un apartamento superior con una niña de 9 años.
Podría ser más agradable la decoración, no tan lúgubre pero queda compensado con la excelente ubicación que posee. En la esquina hay una entrada de subterráneo por lo que nos movemos perfectamente bien en transporte público y caminando. La ubicación es excepcional,  todo al alcance de tu mano. Volvería a alojarme en el sismo sitio en New York

title: Tamaño apenas justo, muy bien ubicado
text: Departamento estrecho, pero ya al reservar lo sabíamos. Ubicado en calle 49 casi 7ma. Ruidoso, pero esa ubicación en NYC sin duda que lo es. Debería estar más equipado en utensilios de cocina. Personal muy amable.

title: Lo mejor es la ubicación
text:
La ubicación es perfecta. A pasos del rockefeller center y de Times square. Con el metro en la esquina. La misma linea para ir al puerto de la estatua de la Libertad, Broklin, Soho,  sin hacer combinación. 
Lo malo es que la habitación no tenía ni armario, ni caja de seguridad. 
Traten de arreglarlo de antemano ya que dicen que algunas si lo tienen. 
Y el trato de algunas personas en la recepción no es la mejor.

title: Convenient Location, Excellent Service!
text:
We stayed at Radio City Apartments from September 12th to September 14th, 2017. Upon arrival, the doorman quickly helped with our luggage. At the front desk, Carlos promptly assisted with check-in. When there was an issue with our room because of allergy issues, Carlos quickly re-assigned us another room. The rooms are spacious and furnished, your "home away from home." There was a small refrigerator and a gas stove. We had plates, dining utensils, cups, a water kettle, and a toaster inside our room. They also supply paper towels and dish soap too, an added bonus. The bathroom was stocked with plenty of towels, disposable show caps, small soap bars that have a wonderful and pleasant fragrance, and small bottles of shampoo. If you need anything else, do not hesitate to contact the front desk. 
The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to many attractions and landmarks including Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Plaza, the Museum of Modern Art, the MTA Subway station along with numerous restaurants and shops including JCrew, Loft, Banana Republic, Cole Haan, and Nintendo New York. 
The room was clean and the beds inside the room were comfortable. The sleep quality was good. We stayed at the hotel because of the location, not for the views from our hotel window. Be aware the two elevators are small and for those travelling either in large groups and/or have luggage, be prepared to wait. 
I am happy with our stay at Radio City Apartments. The convenient location was well worth the price. Special thanks to Carlos and the staff for their excellent service!

title: Reasons to Go or Not Go to City Appartments
text:
At first sight i was asking myself why i reserved this appartement.
Old school, Old Fashioned, Old Furniture, Little showerroom, Little kitchen.

But....

This appartment is situated in the centre of New York, 50 meters from Times Square, THE place to be. The living room is okay, beds slept okay. 

So, Yes it is not luxurious, but you are 1 minute away from Times Square, two minutes from 5th avenue. So complainting is also an option, but forget where you are. Enjoy NY.

title: Great apartment in the centre of all the action!
text: Great location. We had a 2-bedroom apartment. Very impressed with the spacious apartment, well furnished, very comfortable, good kitchen facilities. Very friendly and helpful staff on the desk. Would definitely recommend, and will certainly stay here next time. Couldn't have been better.

title: Quick overnight trip
text: This was a quick one-night trip for a concert at Radio City Music Hall, what a nice surprise!  Have been to NYC many times, usually stay at one of the hotels near Times Square, but from now on it's Radio City Apartments.  The rooms are a bit dated, but clean and comfortable. Studio apartment had microwave, fridge with freezer, coffee maker with coffees, tea, glass ware, plates, cups, silverware, dish soap. Only draw back was no closet, just a hanging bar with a shelf...but no problem for a one-night stay. The front desk was quick efficient, and friendly. Check in was less than 5 minutes. And the location!! 2 minutes to Times Square, 2 minutes to Rockefeller Plaza, can't wait to come back and stay longer next time!

title: Soooo handy !,,,
text: Stayed for five days and whilst my first impressions were OMG what has my travel agent done .But after a quick walk around the streets I could see why I was booked in to RCA ...It's in the middle of everything ,Being a theatre  freak all shows I wanted to see were in 8mins walking distance .No long walks or taxi rides after a show .....The apartments are rather small and very 1980 in decor .(Dull and brown )  A very large fridge and oven and hot plates and a sink you could float the titanic in ...... Microwave and bits and pieces ... a table that seated two ..........If you wanted to cook ,very few implements to use (But why would you when there are dozens of restaurants nearby . Absolutely no hanging space and one set of draws ..........The bathroom whilst beautifully clean and white .had not one surface to put anything on ....Use the dinning table .as you won't be cooking .....Air conditioner very noisy .a rather sad dull uninteresting room but as I only needed to put my head down at night it was just ok

title: Clean Apartments in very central location
text: Nice clear apartments in Mid Town Manhattan 3 mins to Times Square and Rockefeller Centre.  We stayed for 8 nights.  Its a fantastic location if you are a tourist in NYC. The apartments are clean with all the basic facilities.  We had our own kitchenette with hob, microwave and fridge.  All pots, pans, glassware, cutlery and cups & plates provided.  Washing up liquid, cloths and tea towels, tea bags and coffee also provided.  Supermarket near by too.  Cleaning service with fresh towels provided everyday.  One criticism is very little storage for clothes.  No wardrobe in the room, just a rack with about 5 hangars.  This is not enough for 2 people staying for 8 nights.

title: Perfect!
text: Stayed at the radio City Apartments in September. We were a party of 4 so had booked a 2 bedroomed apartment.  I expected a tiny apartment so were delighted with the large roomy apartment we were given.  The apartment was spotless, cleaned every day with the bath towels (2 each) replaced every day.    Tea and coffee was supplied and the kitchen was well stocked with everything we needed.  The location is perfect for all the sites (2 minute walk to Times Square)  My husband and I stayed in a very nice hotel in Times Square 2 years ago and I preferred the apartment.  The staff are polite and helpful, nothing is too much bother. My top tip for New York, skip the trip up to the top of the Rock and take the lift to the Rainbow room on the 65th floor (2 floors below the viewing floor) and spend your money on a champagne cocktail;

title: Back to school  Last visit to NY.
text: Loved the memory from being a kid in the Bronx! Of course it's been updated but still has the old charm of living in a NY apartment as a kid. I was pleasantly surprised at the full size refrigerator, sink and stove.

title: Great hotel and location
text: This is right in the heart of Times Square making it easy to walk or catch the subway and get anywhere quickly.   Nice accommodation, small kitchen, coffee makers, etc.  the location is really great. We had great service, politely answered any questions we had and were helpful.

title: Immaculately Clean A real gem
text: My mother daughter & i stayed four nights, room cleaned everyday, fresh towels. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment 2 x double beds & a double sofa bed, well stocked kitchenette. TV with on demand programmes if required & cable tv We were in a side room on 11th floor. Staff polite & friendly. Apartment close to time square but not too close to cause noise, nice area. Highly recommend the chinese 2 doors away, plenty of ither restaurants nearby. This is a little gem of a place to stay in the Big Apple. We will definitely be back.

title: Great location!
text: Stayed for 4 nights - 2 adults, 2 teens. Room was excellent - clean and plenty of room. Close to everything - Times Square just around the corner! Subway just metres way but we didn't use it - walked everywhere, including Central Park, Natural History Museum, Madame Tussauds, Intrepid, Top of the Rock, Broadway shows, Empire State Building. Can highly recommend for those wanting to be in the thick of the action and soak in the fantastic vibe of NYC.

title: Fantastic!
text: I travel to New York twice a year and for as long as I can remember I have always stayed at Radio City Apartments. As usual I am never disappointed and it is my home from home. Excellent location close to transport, shops, theater and many bars and restaurants. Great staff, spotlessly clean, constantly being maintained and the bonus of having a kitchen area is invaluable for breakfast and take away food from the many places nearby. The prices are very good value, in fact I would say a bargain! There is always a friendly welcome from the boys on the front desk who are also very helpful. You can leave your luggage for free before or after checking in/out. Be warned though as the apartments are so popular it is advisable to book ahead. I have already booked my next trip!

title: Estratégicamente ubicado
text: Nos hospedamos en el Radio City los primeros días de septiembre.  Fuimos en familia. Este hotel está ubicado en pleno centro, a pasos del Time Square, de Brodway, del Rockefeller Center, del Subway...Ideal para recorrer la zona caminando o tomarte el subte en la esquina.... Hay mucha movida en el lugar hasta altas horas de la noche. Como dijeron otros viajeros, el edificio es antiguo pero modernizado y en continuo mantenimiento.  Las habitaciones son amplias, con una pequeña cocina y mesa para poder comer ahí.  Los empleados son muy amables y muchos hablan español.  Recomiendo también las habitaciones de los pisos más altos.  Agradezco al personal de conserjería porque ante un problema en una de las habitaciones dieron rápida respuesta, haciendo nuestra estadía más confortable.  Volvería a alojarme en él.

title: Radio City Apartments
text: This hotel is centrally located and offers several different types of rooms/apartments for a good price. That is why you go there. The staff don't offer any help or kind words. They are just there. Which we knew going in and weren't surprised. The room was supposed to be smoke free but it had clearly been smoked in. Elevator didn't work 2 of the three days we were there. All in all, in NYC you are normally just looking for a place to sleep and then you get up and go. So it is fine. We had a family of 5 so the 2 bedroom apartment worked. However, next time we would probably go with an Air B&B or something. We had several windows pointing different directions and none of them had a view. It is close to everything, so thats why you go there.

title: Recomendable
text: Excelente ubicación, limpio y confortable, no es barato pero para una familia es más económico que ir a un hotel (ahorras comidas) el personal es respetuoso, tiene lavadero, el único inconveniente que no tiene acceso para cochecitos de bebe pero lo suplantan el personal del hotel que te ayuda, nada de lujos pero sin duda volvería (3 cuadras del times square, 2 rockefeller center, 1 de la parada de subte de times square)

title: VACACIONES INOLVIDABLES
text:
Hemos estado en el mes Agosto dos semanas en Radio City Apartamets. La experiencia es totalmente recomendable. A parte de disfrutar y conocer una ciudad increíble, hemos tenido la suerte d alojarnos en estos apartamentos. Lo mejor que tienen es su estupenda ubicación, a un paso d Times Square, de Central Park, de la 5 avenida, de la Estación Central... se puede ir andando a un montón de sitios, teniendo en cuenta que las distancias en NY son muy largas. La atención del personal es muy buena, sino hablas inglés, casi siempre hay alguien en recepción que habla español...una mención especial para Jaime, que siempre era muy amable conmigo y me resolvía cualquier duda o problema. Limpieza y cambio de sabanas y toallas diario. Lavanderia en el sotano de edificio que funciona con monedas, mejor bajad a partir d las 21h para lavar y no interferir en el trabajo de ma empleada d la lavandería, pero ella explica el funcionamiento d las máquinas muy amablemente
Los inconvenientes ( por decir algo) es que el edificio es un poco viejo, pero lo tienen muy bien conservado y trabajan continuamente para ello. Es recomendable pedir en los pisos mas altos, para escuchar menos los ruidos d la calle y del aire acondicionado, aunque como son máquinas q están puestas en los huecos d las ventanas, entra el ruido del aparato de tu habitación

title: Sehr gute Lage, etwas in die Jahre gekommen
text: Mit 4 Stunden erst spät am Abend eingetroffen erwartet uns eine schöne Überraschung: Wir erhalten ein Upgrade in eine der Penthouse Suites im Dachgeschoss. Das Zimmer ist grossartig ausgestattet mit separatem Living Room und Kitchenette und riesig gross. Schade, dass wir nur 2 Nächte bleiben...

title: OTTIMA POSIZIONE MA DELUSI DAL PERSONALE
text:
Con la mia famiglia ho soggiornato in questa struttura per 7 giorni, la prima settimana di agosto. Il nostro era un monolocale Deluxe con cucina. L'appartamento è molto carino e pulito ( l'unica pecca è il condizionatore rumoroso). Il wifi è gratuito.
Il Radio City Apartments si trova in una posizione strategica per visitare la città: vicino alle stazioni della metro, a 5 minuti a piedi  da Times Square e dal Rockfeller center. La strada in cui si trova è molto trafficata ma dal nostro appartamento ( eravamo all'11 piano e dalla parte interna) non si sentiva tanto il rumore del traffico.  
L'unico lato negativo di questa struttura è, a nostro parere, il personale della reception: ad esclusione di una persona ( che purtroppo abbiamo visto solo una volta) tutti gli altri sono stati freddi, poco ospitali e poco disponibili per chi come noi parlava un inglese a livello scolastico: o sai l'inglese o ti arrangi!

title: Hotel fraud, non disclosed rules
text: After booking an overnight stay at this location with friends for the New York City Salsa Congress, experienced rude front desk and security personnel.  We were told we weren't allowed to have more than two people enter room after midnight.  I secured this room for sole purpose to change clothing and have a place to leave our belongings only to find out we weren't able to return to our room at 4:30 in morning.  Two of us were allowed in room and our significant others were told they couldn't.   We were from out of town, in pouring rain, and two women left in apartment while our men had to leave.  The room was empty all say and night.  I ended up paying $320.for two hours.   Unfriendly and uncompromising personnel, poor public relations, bad business.  Would not recommend this place to anyone.  There is no mention in paperwork you cannot have more than two people enter a room after midnight.  Place is a hole in wall and too small for comfort as well.  Not worth the money

title: Lots of space & great price!
text: Almost didn't want to write this review because I don't want to give away this "secret"! But this is a GREAT place to stay. The location is so close to Times Square, NBC studios, Rockefeller Center, etc. yet it's quiet enough to get a good night sleep. This place has character & a good vibe. The room was big- a bedroom, living room with small kitchen & bathroom. The price was great. Nothing negative to say!

title: Perfect location at a good price!
text:
Second time in New York staying at this location. If you like to walk and see the sights, this is the perfect place. Good place for larger parties.

Nice rooms but very small bathrooms!  Front desk people are efficient but not friendly or helpful. 

The location and price is worth any small inconvenience. 

Love the places to eat right next door on both sides! Subway on the corner.

Will definitely return!

title: Recomiendo
text:
Es un hotel muy bueno. La atención excelente . El personal muy amable y siempre dispuesto a ayudar .
, ante cualquier dudas o asesoramiento de paseos etc.
El Sr. José de reservas, muy atento. Y el recepcionista SR. Carlos Osorno y el SR. Pedro Méndez de mucha calidad , calidez y  siempre  buen dispuestos a asistir con buen humor y simpatía, necesaria para cuando se está lejos del hogar.
Muy recomendable , con la habitación y servicio de mucamas.

title: Nye at Nyc :-)
text: Stayed here for a week on nye, its in the heart of everything,times square about 10 min walking and central park about 20 min. The room was ok,big enough u can even call it vfm especially for the period we were there:-)

title: Dont let the size fool you!
text: We went to NYC for a little birthday weekend get away. Found Radio City Apartments via online search. Noticed the price was really good for its location and it being a Sat night. Room was clean, staff friendly and helpful. The room was on the small side but was laid out very efficiently. Although we did not use the kitchenette, we were impressed with the amenities the room offered (mid sized fridge, microwave, stove and small oven and sink along with dishes and the like). Loved the old time touches of a renovated building such as real wood banisters and mail chutes on each floor. The elevators are a little on the slow side so allow a few extra minutes. And LOCATION! A very short (less than a couple of blocks) has you right in the middle of Times Square and in the area of many of the Broadway Shows. A short walk to Central Park / Rockefeller Center as well! Over all very pleased and will stay here again for future trips to NYC.

title: Holiday USA
text: Could not get a better position than these apartments. Visiting NYC for the first time with my hubby on our 6 week USA holiday, this place is in the best spot, Times Square is virtually around the corner, and Central Park is a 5 min walk in the opposite direction. Having a small kitchenette we were able to have our own breakfast, instead of buying it each morning for our 8 day stay. Rooms were also relatively quiet considering location. Reception staff very always helpful with directions. Highly recommend for location.

title: Excellent bolt hole
text:
This place was perfect for our requirements. The apartment had two bed rooms and a lounge do there was no need for us to sit and drink wine in the bathroom floor when the kids were in bed (as we do in regular hotels!).

The front desk staff were great. They really buoyed our spirits after a nasty yellow cab driver tried to rip us off on our way back from JFK.

We loved the cooking facilities. You could cook anything there. It had all of the cooking implements as well as a proper cooker, oven fridge and freezer. There's also a whole foods super market just around the corner where you can pick up food. Ideal!

It was great that there was a dining table that all four of us could sit around for meals and a proper sofa to relax on.

The decor isn't fancy but that's not important to us. It was clean, secure spacious and perfectly kitted out. 

Would definitely recommend!

title: Good location BUT.....
text: It was great having the space for five travelers in NYC.  Clean, ample space and great location near Times Square, subway and restaurants and kitchen amenities.  Customer service was totally non existent.  Check in was okay (not great) but for the next five days there was never a good morning, hello or anything.  I hope they get some welcoming and friendly training from management.

title: went to see a concert and found this great place to stay
text: The location was GREAT.  The room was clean and having the kitchen space was a nice bonus.  There was not a view but that did not matter we were there to see the city not look out the window.  The staff were pleasent and responed quickly to any requests.  We would stay there again

title: Un très chouette hôtel très bien situé !
text:
Très chouette hôtel typique new-yorkais, bien situé à deux pas de Times Square et des métros.  Nous étions déjà venus dans cet hôtel en juillet 2014 et nous y sommes revenus sans hésitation.
Très belle et grande chambre au 7e étage avec vue à l'arrière du bâtiment donc plus au calme (c'est relatif à New York !).  Très bonne literie (même le divan-lit que notre fils a utilisé était super confortable !).  Très propre.
Cuisine équipée (frigo, micro-onde, plaques électriques, assiettes, casseroles, verres, couverts etc ...).
Pas de petit-déjeuner compris.
Bagagerie disponible à la réception et assez bien sécurisée car seul le personnel de l'hôtel a accès au local et nous a remis un petit ticket par bagage.
Bref, hôtel à recommander !
Un seul point négatif : le divan-lit réservé n'était pas installé à notre arrivée.  Nous l'avons signalé à la réception ... Mais, nous avons dû faire le divan-lit nous-même avec les draps qui étaient dans une armoire de la chambre ...

title: Surprised
text:
I was expecting a normal room and that is what it might be called but it had a mini kitchen.  I had a microwave, small oven, set of 3 dishes, some pots and pans, and a small fridge. Adequate for the 3 days I was there. I could have easily had all 3 meals in the room if I had wanted.  It was located in an area that was in the middle of the hustle and bustle of New York. Walking distance of many places including the theater district. 
There was a small courtyard that I could see from our room. 
 It was clean. Staff was helpful. I would use the hotel again.

title: Good but could be much better
text: Awesome neat hotel, centrally located. Apartment doesn't mean size though but it was nicely organized. Front desk staff is kind of cold and not very welcoming, their initial behavior was "here are the keys now get lost". Besides that all great.One thing to remember parking is not free ( the website I booked it from didn't mention it but they gave me 200$ coupon for it) . I will recommend it, especially if you are visiting first time.

title: Fantastic Location, Clean & Very Comfortable
text: My family of 5 adults stayed in a two-bedroom apartment. We love everything about this apartment. It was clean and very comfortable. The location is superb! Times Square is just round the corner. Grand Central Terminal and MoMA are a short walk away. We also took a walk to Central Park and Macy's (Herald Square). There are 3 subway stations nearby. Food Emporium (very nice supermart) is also a stone's throw away. For the price we paid, I don't think there is a better place in midtown Manhattan than Radio City Apartments. I will definitely stay here again if we visit NYC again.

title: Weekend with family
text: I called about a week before our check in to see if we could be upgraded to a bigger room or the Penthouse because we were celebrating my husband's 60th Birthday.  I was told nothing was available but they would mark it in my reservation if something came up.  We were able to check in when we arrived, around 10:30 am.  They handed us the keys and showed us the elevators.  I couldn't find our room # on the keychain.  All it said was "PHA".  Got on the elevator and me, my husband my 10 year old son noticed "PH" was on the top floor.  My husband said "Penthouse??"  I said "HAPPY BIRTHDAY!"  I was just as shocked as he was!  Needless to say, it was a great stay with a beautiful view out on the balcony.  Loved the old, ornate feel of this place!  So close to Times Square and Rockefeller Center.  Staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful.  Would definitely stay here again.  I've already recommended this place to my friends who are looking to go to NYC in the very near future.  Thank you Radio City Apartments for making my husband's Birthday special!!!

title: Muy buen lugar para vacaciones
text: Somos un matrimonio, estuvimos 4 noches. Piso 11, lugar confortable, limpio, con gente que hablaba nuestra lengua y siempre dispuesta a informar con amabilidad, incluyendo desde la recepcion hasta las mucamas. Realmente muy bien ubicado y el sitio de cocina mas que suficiente para no gastar afuera, con un supermercado a una cuadra en 49 y 8, que hasta vende comida preparada. Una linda escapada a Nueva York.

title: Situation idéale
text:
Nous avons occupé un studio à 5 en Août 2017. 
Les points forts : idéalement situé à 2 pas du métro, de time square et du rockfeller center, chambre faite chaque jour, serviettes changées tous les jours, chambre vieillotte mais propre,  bonne literie, studio équipé pour cuisiner, café, thé à disposition avec cafetière, cuisinière, frigo, micro onde  et vaisselle pour 5. Important aussi : wifi GRATUIT !
Les points négatifs : pas beaucoup de rangement pour 5, pas possible de dormir avec la clim tellement ça fait du bruit, la rue est bruyante aussi toute la nuit ça circule beaucoup, nous avions demandé une chambre au calme (au 5e) qui donnait derrière dans la cour, pas super vue mais un peu plus calme que sur la rue principale !
Bref, je conseille cet appart hôtel. Au niveau prix nous avons payé 2200 Eur pour 5 personnes et pour 8 nuits mais nous étions au cœur de Time square, il y a un arrêt de bus touristique presque au bout de la rue, c'est pratique aussi quand on a pris le PASS avec le bus !

title: Todo muy ajustado
text: Las habitaciones son demasiado chicas los aires son ruidosos y antiguos, la cocina-comedor no tenia la capacidad para 6 personas (4 sillas) muy chico, nada de mesada,  el Internet (wi fi) muy débil  solamente en la recepción  había buena señal. Los empleados excelente desde los recepcionistas hasta  los de limpieza muy amables y la ubicación es muy buena

title: Girls Holiday
text: Have stayed here over the years about six times now have found the apartments to be clean  well maintained staff are always very friendly and always willing to help in anyway they can . Great location close to all shopping two minute walk to times square. Just love these apartments..

title: Studios parfaits idealement situés
text:
Nous avions réservés 2 studios pour 3 personnes, avec chacun un grand lit très confortable., nous les avions côte à côte, ce qui permettait de manger tous les 3 dans le même studio dans la partie cuisinette qui comportait une table et des chaises, une gaziniere avec four et four à micro onde, un frigo et une cafetière. (Les 2 studios étaient identique) Le café et le thé étaient renouvelés tous les jours. Nous avons beaucoup apprécié. A proximité de Time Square, un métro au coin de la rue, c'est l'endroit idéal pour séjourner à New York.
La salle de bain est équipée soit d'une douche ou d'une baignoire avec draps de bain, serviettes et mini serviettes ainsi que des produits de douche.
Le ménage est fait tous les jours et tout le personnel est très serviable et discret.
La climatisation était très efficace et comme il faisait 30 dehors nous l'avons appréciée.
